campaign.story:
Grab that Victorian outfit from your closest and join the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Future on a time traveling adventure. You'll play tricks to each time period as you try to outwit your fellow travelers and collect enough wreaths to decorate all the holiday doors.

Ghosts of Christmas is a new version of the acclaimed hard-to-find Japanese game "Time Palatrix" by Taiki Shinzawa. Have you ever played "spades" or "hearts" and thought "I wish this game had time travel?"
All in a small 5 x 5 x 2 inch box

Ghosts of Christmas is a trick taking game where you play cards into three separate tricks: past, present, and future. You visit all three locations in a single round, and winning tricks in one time period could help you win more in the future!

The gameplay remains the same, but with a new optional variant for a more relaxed game.
Twelve colorful characters inspired by A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens.

Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Taylor is an avid player of trick taking games and has a YouTube channel dedicated to them. Ghosts of Christmas can sound confusing at first, but Taylor does a great job explaining how it all works.
Please Note: Prototype components are shown in the video. The final version will have some minor changes.

Also please note: This is one of the most creative Kickstarter preview videos we've ever seen. Give it a chance. You won't be disappointed.
#1 Meeeaty - Some trick taking games are relaxing affairs. Play your highest card and hope for the best. In Ghosts of Christmas, there are multiple ways to approach each round and use brain cells.
#2 Ripple Effects - When you don't have the cards to win in a straightforward way, sometimes you can engineer a change in who wins the "Past" trick in order to make the "Present" and "Future" trick work out better for you.
#3 Dials - They're both fun and informative. A great visual way for everyone to keep track of which suit they can play to each ghost.
#4 Different Variants/Difficulty Levels - If you want a more low stress evening (or you are just learning), play the variant without bidding. If you think you've mastered the game, try playing one of the TWO variants with the "Beyond" ghost that add even more options.
#5 Bidding Options - Speaking of bidding, the ability to place an "exact bid" or a "wiggle room bid" gives you the option to play it safe or really go for that high score each round. 
#6 Small Box - It's a fact. Games in smaller boxes take up less room on your shelf, get taken to more game nights, and get played more. This is a small box game. (We work to keep even our "big boxes" pretty small.)

Put on your hard hat and install factory tiles in this fast, furious and fun game of factory planning. Connect your tiles to build the best possible production chains. Whoever makes the most profitable factory wins!
Efficiently packed into our 10.8 x 6.8 x 2.75 inch box
Like Ghosts of Christmas, we're republishing this cult-classic by Corné van Moorsel because it deserves a wider audience. The gameplay will stay the same (if it ain't broke...), but it has brand new art.

Our Touch:
1. Added a sixth player
2. Official variant to play without the quick grab element. Details TBD but will definitely be a part of the game.
3. Added unique names and logos to each of the six company boards and score tokens to make the game more thematic and improve accessibility for color blind players.

Play solo, with a full table of six players, or anywhere in between.
What's your favorite machine name?

It's a puzzle, but not a jigsaw puzzle. Like a "How am I going to connect all of these? Did you just take the machine I wanted? I have no use for blue! Let's play again. I think I get it now." kind of puzzle.
Unique names improve theming and accessibility
Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Please Note: The game shown in this review is the original Factory Funner. Our version has the same gameplay, but all new artwork, and support for a 6th player.
#1 Quick grabbing is rewarded - This game doesn't have analysis paralysis. When the machines are flipped over at the start of the turn, you have to decide which one you want. Too slow and someone will take your machine. Too fast and you will grab one that you thought would work ... but didn't.
#2 Non-real-time variant - What about groups who don't like that real-time part of the game? We really think that is the best way to play, but we realize it isn't a fun or even possible option for everyone. We're including an alternative rule that removes all the speed elements and is still fun (in a different way).
#3 Making it work - At some point during your game, someone at the table will be quiet for 30 seconds. Then they will announce, "I think I can make it work." Pipes start getting laid. Reservoirs are moved around. The table will laugh at how ridiculous their factory looks. And in a few turns you will know if what they did was smart or short sighted.
#4 You Will Improve - You might not be good at this game the first time you play it. You will get better. You will learn. You will overcome. And it will be rewarding.
#5 Bad Grammar - Factory FunNER is the sequel and a very solid improvement to Factory Fun. It uses hexes instead of squares to allow more creative building, and some subtle improvements to scoring, length, and machine placement rules really improve things.
#6 Solo Mode - You can play this game by yourself. Never know when that might come in handy.
#7 On Tour - Factory Funner has a lot of similarities to our other game "On Tour".  It shares the roller coaster emotions and intuitive gameplay.  Whether you're building an optimized route, or installing the most efficient machines, you'll feel the same tension and joy of making it all work out.

Note: Our game will NOT be an exact duplicate from these reviews, but the core gameplay will stay the same.
Zee Garcia's Kickstarter Pick of the Week | Dice Tower
Turn into a high-flying stock trader as you work against the other players to control the market, buy and short stock, and make the most money.
Have you been pumping cash into GameStop? Want to have the fun of making big bets without risking real cash?
You're going to thoroughly enjoy this brand new game that will bring you into the exciting and crazy world of buying and shorting stocks.
*No financial knowledge required
** Really does play within 60 minutes 
Our standard box size: 10.8 x 6.8 x 2 inch
Bear Raid is designed by Ryan Courtney, the same mind behind two other mind-bending games, Pipeline and Curious Cargo.
These are four of the character you can play as. What should the other two be? Leave your ideas in the comments.
For those who are wondering about the name, Bear Raid is a real phrase used to describe when a stock price is intentionally lowered through short selling and rumors.
Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Please Note: The game in this video is a prototype and the final version will have some adjustments.

Also Please Note: We're super excited that Jac, who does not normally make board game videos, agreed to do one for Bear Raid since she's the most passionate person in the world about this game. She is responsible for getting Chad (Owner of BoardGameTables.com) to play Bear Raid and ultimately publish it. Part of Kickstarter is authenticity, so we wanted you to hear from a real fan.
Later during the campaign, Chad will be interviewing Ryan Courtney about some of the different strategies in Bear Raid. We will post that here after the interview.
Submit a fake news headline and win a copy of the game!
We're hosting a contest over on Reddit.com/r/BoardGames where you can submit some ideas for a fake headline that will be used for one of the forecast cards in the game!
Enter today! →
#1 Shorting Stock - Not many games let you do this. It is so much fun to short stock and then drive the stock down.
#2 42 Dice & Event Interaction - Not a lot of luck (but some luck). 48 dice. It is a lot. It's not just a matter of chucking dice and moving the prices. Each company has dice, and they interact with different "event cards" every turn. It's a cool mechanic that lets you get a glimpse of what might happen next turn, but not a perfect picture.
#3 Controlling What's Rolled - Not all the dice are rolled. You can influence what gets rolled. Leave dice on a company or take them back. Leave dice behind your screen or add them to the bag. These decisions are just as important as buying or shorting the stock.
#4 Unspoken Alliances - There's not negotiation. But sometimes you will find you can go further if you and a "partner" work together. Maybe one person can't bankrupt a company by themselves, but two people working together can. Just watch out. Most partners want to do about 40% of the work and leave the other 60% for you.
#5 Quick - Many financial/economic games are long, but Bear Raid packs all that action into 60 minutes.
#6 Q.E. - Although our other financial game QE is certainly a different game, we really enjoy the genre. We think great financial board games are really under-the-radar. Wouldn't you agree?
#7 Surprisingly Funny - You expect silly games to be funny. You don't expect a stock market game to have humor in both the gameplay and player's reactions to it. You could almost call it a party game.
#7 Bears - Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.

For the gamers who want the absolute best from every game, you're in luck!
Wood components for the most handled pieces of Ghosts of Christmas and Bear Raid feel better in your hand. The Factory Funner box inserts makes setup way faster. Each upgrade adds both form AND function.
If you want something to carry all three games, and many more, this is for you.

Taiki Shinzawa has been living and working in Tokyo designing original and unique board games since 2011. He enjoys origami and puzzles which has lead to a fascination with trick-taking games.

Maria Surducan creates illustrations with one hand, graphic designs with the other, comics with the third, and holds a coffee cup with the fourth. Only this way does she think she can draw herself the perfect life. She lives at mariasurducan.com
Ryan Courtney is a New York City based designer best known for Pipeline and Curious Cargo. He enjoys providing an opportunity for players to challenge themselves by adding a thinky twist to established genres.

Nick Nazarro is a multi-faceted artist working out of Los Angeles. Co-owner of Lay Waste Games, he has illustrated games such as Dragoon, Human Era, and Life Siphon. Also working at DreamWorks animation, Nick contributes visuals to many animated shows, such as HarmonQuest and The Midnight Gospel. When Nick isn't drawing, he can be found on Twitter, tweeting about drawing.
Corne Van Morsel is a game designer in Maastricht, Netherlands.  Board games, card games, dice games, thematical and abstract games, varying from 2 player games to 10 player games. Mainly deep games packed in a short amount of time with short rules, attractive for both heavy gamers and casual players.

Nigel Sussman creates complex isometric murals and illustrations by hand and with a lighthearted sense of humor that keeps you looking, and smiling.  He enjoys creating seek-and-find type illustrations that feature complex fantasy architecture and imaginary machines. His influences include Martin Handford (creator of Where’s Waldo?), MC Escher and the original SimCity computer games.
Anca Gavril is the art director and graphic designer for BoardGameTables.com. When she's not reading, playing and cooking with her daughter, she can be found working. She misses hosting game nights with her friends now that she owns a real gaming table (the Jasper!!). She always involves her husband, Filip Gavril, in playtesting the prototypes and he is the 3D artist who designed the Factory Funner insert and created all the gorgeous renders you can see on this page. 

Sam Hillier has always enjoyed teaching and explaining things, whether that's teaching philosophy (in a previous life) or new games to his family. Now as a professional writer of rulebooks, he can put that passion to work, helping players discover the joys of new and exciting games.
BoardGameTables.com was founded in 2014 by Chad DeShon, a gamer who wanted a nice table for  playing board games and figured other people might as well.
Now, in addition to selling high quality custom board game tables, BoardGameTables.com also sells a less expensive, some-assembly-required, solid wood table called The Jasper Board Game Table.
Our board game bags were created for a similar reason. We needed something to carry our games in. No off-the-shelf options worked for us. They were too big, too small, or  not protected enough.
And if that was not enough, we have published 5 quick but deceptively strategic board games and 3 small "super easy to play" games.
You can find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and YouTube.

campaign.story:
Clash of Deck is a card-based combat game for 1-2 players aged 8+ that plays in 30 minutes, created by Léandre Proust, with artwork from Studio Rexard, and published by Grammes Édition. Create your 8 unit army and battle other Lord-Sorcerers to destroy their Strongholds!
Clash of Deck is dead… Long lives Clash of Deck! Clash of Deck is a card game which has been played and tested by hundreds of players throughout its first year of existence, as a French version. The game was published in 2020 in an atypical form: cards you cut yourself from a folded sheet of cardboard. A new standalone expansion was published each month. 
Today, thanks to the feedback and support of its community of players, Clash of Deck takes off with a new edition, available in English. The game will have more conventional components, such as "real" cards, larger and of better quality, with a tuck box. 
The game will be fully translated in English and French! The rules and the FAQ are only available in PDF. Most of the game's content is language independent. German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Korean, Portuguese (European), Portuguese (Brazil), Greek, Russian, Slovene, Japanese, Polish, Hebrew, Vietnamese, Hungarian, Arabic, Ukrainian, Filipino, Afrikaans, Swedish, Turkish, Serbian, Chinese, Catalan, Danish, Galician, Esperanto, Indonesian, Czech and Breton are already unlocked!
The tuck box is approximately 90x60x15 mm in size. The cards will be 56x87 mm in size and have round corners, with standard quality Blue Core 280 GSM. This is the material used for successful games such as Magic: The Gathering and Pokémon.
Unlock rewards by generating points. To generate points, at the rate of 1 point each: Fan on BoardGameGeek (641+462), #clashofdeck or #grammesedition on Instagram (75), Share on Facebook (523), Retweet on Twitter (343), Share / Like on Kicktraq (79).

Face off against another player and choose your format: Draft or Constructed. We recommend the Draft format for your first plays. Each turn, the players draft cards from a common deck to build themselves an efficient deck. For the Draft format, you only need one copy of the Starter Kit. The Constructed format is destined for experts who've mastered the game's mechanisms and the synergies brought by special abilities. Players build their own decks by choosing 10 cards among all the cards from the game. Their opponent will banish two of those cards at the beginning of the game, to form the final 8-cards deck. For the Constructed format, each player must have a copy of the Starter Kit.
Each player receives a “Watchtower/Stronghold” card. 
Place the 2 “Bridge” cards in the play area. 
Shuffle all the other cards into a draw pile. 
Then, reveal the top 4 cards of the draw pile. First, player A chooses 1 of the 4 available cards. Then, player B chooses 2 of the 3 remaining cards. Finally, player A takes the last remaining card. Repeat the operation, but this time, player B chooses the first card. Repeat until each player has 8 cards. Each player shuffles their cards, constituting their hand. They then place their “Watchtower” card in the leftmost place in their hand.
The player who crossed a bridge last becomes the first player. For their first turn, they begin the game with only 6 Mana.
Players play their turn one after another. A turn consists of 3 phases:
Phase 1 – Mana Regeneration:
The player gains as much Mana as the number of cards in their hand (including the “Watchtower/Stronghold” card). Mana is used to pay cards costs. The player can use it during phase 2.
Phase 2 – Summoning:
The player can spend the Mana gained during phase 1 to play cards from their hand. A player can only play the 4 leftmost cards in their hand (ignoring the “Watchtower / Stronghold” card). 
A card’s Mana cost is indicated in their upper left corner. Mana that isn’t spent during a turn is lost. A player cannot spend more Mana than they gained during their previous phase 1. The play area consists of two lanes. When playing a card, the player chooses in which lane to place it. 
Players only summon units in their respective Realm: player A places their card on the left of the “Bridge” cards and player B places their cards on the right of the “Bridge” cards. There is no limit to the number of cards in a lane. A summoned unit is placed from the player’s hand in the play area, face up, in the lane of their choice, behind their other units already in play. The card remains in play as long as it isn’t destroyed.
Phase 3 – Assault:
A unit has Health Points (HP), and an Attack Value (ATK). A unit cannot attack the turn it enters play. Each unit a player controls inflicts their ATK value to an opposing unit. Units automatically activate in a predetermined order: first the upper lane, from the unit further away from to the unit closest to the “Bridge”; then, the lower lane, from the unit further away from to the unit closest to the “Bridge”. 
When a unit suffers at least as much damage as its HP value, the unit is destroyed. It suffers the entirety of the damage caused by the attack and the card returns to its owner’s hand, in the rightmost place.
Then, move all the units on the lane closer to the “Bridge” so they fill the gap. Units regenerate their HP at the end of the turn. During an assault, a unit inflicts its ATK value to the closest opposing unit on the same lane. If no opposing unit can be attacked, the unit then inflicts its damage directly to the opponent’s “Watchtower/Stronghold”.
When a “Watchtower/Stronghold” suffers damage, shift it that many places to the right in the player’s hand. 
When a “Watchtower” reaches the rightmost place in a player hand, it is destroyed: flip it to its “Stronghold” side and return it to the leftmost place in the player’s hand. Excess damage inflicted to the “Watchtower” does not carry over to the “Stronghold”. When a “Stronghold” card reaches the rightmost place in a player’s hand, that player loses the game.
End of the game
The game ends as soon as a “Stronghold” card reaches the rightmost place in a player’s hand. Their opponent then wins the game.

campaign.story:
Gift of Tulips is a game of gifting tulips and building beautiful bouquets with friends. The game evokes the feeling of visiting Amsterdam with friends and experiencing the Dutch culture. Gift of Tulips features artwork inspired by the blue and white delftware pattern that is unique to the Netherlands, the windmills and waterways of the countryside, the flower fields of Keukenhof, and the buildings of Amsterdam.  
When I visited Amsterdam and the Netherlands, I really felt like I was coming home for the first time in my life.  With Gift of Tulips, I wanted to create a game that exemplified my wonderful experience.
Build your bouquet, gift tulips to your friends, and create a beautiful Festival display in this gorgeous card game for 2-6 players.
Read the review https://www.pudgycatgames.com/post/gift-of-tulips
Gift of Tulips Overview
In Gift of Tulips, tulip enthusiasts explore Amsterdam’s Tulip Festival to build colorful bouquets and give tulips to their friends.
Players choose between building up their bouquet to try to score major points in the end game Tulip Festival, giving tulips to other players' bouquets for immediate points, and placing tulips in the Tulip Festival to adjust each type's ranking. Each turn, players draw one Tulip card, take an action, then draw another Tulip card and take a different action.
Game Setup
Gift of Tulips starts with two tulips in the Festival, then players are each dealt two Tulip cards.  Players choose which will start their bouquet and which to place into the Hidden Showcase that may affect the end game Tulip Festival. 
Gifting Tulips
You can choose to gift a tulip to another player. You gain the value of the tulip given, plus additional points based on the type's current rank in the Festival.
Keeping Tulips
You can choose to keep a tulip for your own bouquet. If you keep a tulip that is ranked 3, 4, or is currently unranked, you will also gain points.
Adding to the Festival
The last choice is to add the Tulip to the Festival.  You can change how the Tulips are currently ranked by adding the Tulip straight to the Festival OR choose to add it to the Hidden Showcase for a chance to influence the ranks at the end of the game.
Game End
At the end of the game, up to 5 Tulips from the Hidden Showcase are added to the Tulip Festival, adjusting the final ranking. Points are awarded to the players that have the most cards of each Tulip type. The player with the most points wins!

NOTES FROM THE PUBLISHER (Carla Kopp) 
Growing up, I never really felt like I belonged in any one place until I visited the Netherlands. There was something about the place that just felt like home, even though I’d never been there before. It reminded me of visiting my Dutch grandparents, with the blue and white delftware patterns, wooden clogs, tulips, and windmills. I remember growing up and knowing that if someone had a windmill in their yard, they were family, and going to Amsterdam definitely left its mark on me. 
It wasn’t just the objects I remembered from my childhood, but all the sights as well. From the canals to the fascinating, detailed, and sometimes outlandish architecture, there was something that caught your eye wherever you went. But going even further, the culture also greatly resonated with me. Most people in the Netherlands speak at least Dutch and English, but a good amount of them also speak French, German, and/or Spanish, as well. Historically, a lot of the Dutch people were traders and wanted to speak to you in the language that you were familiar with. It’s that sort of attention to detail and empathy that made me think I was finally somewhere I belonged. 
With Gift of Tulips, I wanted to create a game that really exemplified that experience in the form of a game. The player that wins will most likely be the one that gives out the most tulips and gives them to a variety of players. If a player simply hoards what they have, they may not get far. 
The artwork of Gift of Tulips is reminiscent of the flower fields of Keukenhof, the blue and white delftware pattern that is unique to the Netherlands, the windmills and waterways of the countryside, and the buildings of Amsterdam.

Your Game will arrive via one of the following hubs: USA (US backers), Canada (Canadian Backers), Germany (EU, Asia, Australia and New Zealand backers).

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We are committed to being respectful of the environment in the choice of our decisions. We believe that a game is durable when it is well designed and well made.
Reusability and recyclability
Only the necessary production will be manufactured. The pieces will be cut so as to minimize the waste of wood sheets. No plastic component will be used in the game.
We invite people who no longer want the game to donate it to a charity in their area or to trade the game on board game forums like board game geek.
Sustainable materials
Wood and bamboo are ecological and renewable materials with underestimated possibilities. All the pieces of the game are made of wood or bamboo which are a noble material, available in abundance, ecological, sustainable, recoverable, biodegradable and renewable. The wood used is FSC Canada certified. A great ecological concern will also be taken into account when choosing cotton or linen bags.
Environmentally friendly factories
The production will be done in workshops where concern for the environment will be essential.

campaign.story:
https://buttonshygames.com/products/death-valley

Sunlight glaring through the windshield. Your favorite songs blasting through the speakers. Candy bar wrappers piled next to a warm drink in the cheap plastic cupholder. Your companion riding in the passenger seat, snapping pictures of landmarks as you settle into the hypnotic rhythm of the road. But be careful: this fun road trip could get dangerous as you drive through Death Valley.

Death Valley is a pocket-sized, push-your-luck, tableau building game for 1-2 players, with each traveler striving to assemble the best mix of cards in their Journey and Scrapbook in order to win the game.
Death Valley is 18 cards, packaged in a portable and durable wallet.

Each turn, players will choose whether to assign a card to their Journey, or move cards from their Journey to their Scrapbook. Cards feature stars (points), special abilities (affect the value and position of cards), and some interesting facts about Death Valley.

Each card also has a hazard (Heat, Terrain, Flood or Animals) listed. Having 3 of the same Hazard visible in their tableau will cause the player to bust and lose all the progress in their Journey.
All 4 hazards and their card distribution within the game.
At the end of the game the player with the most stars in their Journey, plus any additional points from card abilities, is the winner.
To set up the game, shuffle all 18 cards and place 1 face-up between the players. On a player’s turn they have 3 choices: add the face-up or face-down card from the top of the deck to their own Journey, or Rest. When a player Rests, they move at least one card from their Journey to their Scrapbook (stacking them into a single pile if they select multiple cards) and shuffle as many of their remaining Journey cards into the deck as they choose.
After the player takes their action for the turn, they check for Hazards among the visible cards in their Journey and Scrapbook. If they have 3 of the same Hazard type showing (3 Flood cards, for example) the player busts: 1 of the Hazard cards is removed from the game and the rest of the player’s Journey cards get shuffled back into the deck.
Once there is only one card remaining in the center area, the game ends. Each player counts up the stars showing in their Journey row. Visible cards in the Journey and Scrapbook might have abilities that adjust that score. Once all effects have been applied, the player with the highest star count is the winner.
Backseat Driver Variant
If you want to really press your luck and give up a little control, try out the Backseat Driver Variant. In this variant players may choose to play the face-up card on their opponent’s journey as well as their own. At the end of each turn you will check to see if either player busts.
Solo Mode - Designed by Kevin Ellenburg and Mike Mullins
The game will come with rules for solo play. Here you will face an AI explorer that thinks through its action each turn similarly to a player (playing the more intense Backseat Driver Variant). This explorer never rests in its pursuit of adventure.
If you would like to try the game yourself, the mostly black and white preview PNP is available at PNP Arcade now!
https://www.pnparcade.com/products/death-valley-kickstarter-preview
In previous campaigns we created expansion material and used it as stretch goals. Since 2018, we've just given it away from the start. So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is Death Valley: Panamint City.
This expansion consists of 6 more cards, letting you customize the deck before playing Death Valley. Before play, organize all the base game and expansion cards by hazard type. Then select 3 Animal, 4 Flood, 5 Terrain, and 6 Heat cards to shuffle into the deck. Unselected cards will not be used. Includes Vultures, Panamint City, Red Cathedral, Ubehebe Crater, Zabriskie Point, and Panamint Dunes.
Here are the rewards available during this campaign.

To add more games to your order, you can do one of a few things:
US Backers only - to order games that ship now - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0321us" to get 15% off  of your order. Your website order will ship now, as long as you don't  order any pre-order items, otherwise the entire order will ship as  soon as everything comes in. As always, if you reach $25.00, you will  also receive free shipping. (NOTE: We previously offered a US Backer  code to combine games to save on shipping, but in most cases this was a  much better deal of free shipping AND 15% off.)
International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0321international" (REPEAT: THIS IS FOR BACKERS ONLY) to get free shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this  offer is 3 wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including  anything that you order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games  (and 3  expansions)  will end up bumping into the next shipping tier,  which can be as much as  $10 on international orders. These games will  all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
There are many notable games and we'll be featuring those throughout the campaign.
While the game includes lots of great little historical facts about Death Valley, here's a little history about the game itself.
Death Valley was originally Kevin Ellenburg's entry to the 18 Card Challenge: Design A Game About A Real Life Location, and we’re happy to see it coming to life. It has a unique take on the familiar push-your-luck mechanic where players have to think about managing their hazards as well as the card abilities, making each choice matter beyond the immediate threat of busting. On top of that, the gorgeous art from Fachri Maulana perfectly captures the lonely beauty of Death Valley National Park.
First up is Kevin's initial pitch video in it's entirety (note some changes were made to the gameplay and cards throughout development):
And here is the 18 Card Challenge video where it was a finalist, along with two other games that we eventually published, Skulls of Sedlec and Horreos. All 3 of which are available here. 


We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames,   promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts ... every   month! Supporters also receive from $1 to $10 off EVERY WALLET GAME  that  we make. (Members back our Kickstarter projects at the $1 pledge  level  above.)
Our 2021 $5+ packages include an episode of The Final Lightyear.
Gather your crew and gear and launch into a  fringe section of space where the law teeters over the edge and a good  captain can earn a living. There's no shortage of threats that endanger  the goodfolk of deep space, but luckily your torpedo bay is full and  lasers are hot.
In Lightyear you'll play solo or cooperative with a friend, as the  captain of a so-called starship, in hopes of earning some rewards and a  decent rep. Using tactical maneuvering and dice-based action selection,  you'll work through the sector's small, medium and large enemies trying  to gain rewards and ultimately live to see another day. Customizable  episodes will challenge you with variable enemies and threats while  offering powerful new gear and talented crew to help you in your  adventures.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something   extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion  / promo cards for our existing games.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of   the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice).   The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that  is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the Panamint City expansion  here).
If that sounds cool to you, check out the Board Game of the Month Club on Patreon!
http://www.patreon.com/buttonshy
Thank you for checking out Death Valley!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our method of publishing and using multiple manufacturers, there's always a chance that one part of the game could come in with an error, leading to delays. We've been able to minimize these errors in recent years, but they can happen from time to time. We've also upped our pre-press staff internally to make sure we can hit intended deadlines.

With COVID-19 some of our suppliers have been delayed, so we've been allowing additional time in our estimations and setting up backup suppliers as well. Our local staff is working while socially distancing, so we are allowing additional time for a smaller staff to assemble and ship games. 

Our unfulfilled projects are moving along according to schedule. Ugly Gryphon Inn is shipping now, two months ahead of schedule. Our Agropolis Campaign is scheduled to be fulfilled in March and backers are up to date with the progress. Our Reprint Campaign is due to fulfill in June and moving ahead as planned.

Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
New critters and new ideas are arriving every day at the Newleaf train station! Being the first official city of Everdell, Newleaf has grown into a thriving destination with numerous exciting opportunities to discover and explore. Attract eager visitors to your city, make your reservations, travel further with tickets, and build the most prosperous city Everdell has ever seen! Prepare to experience an all-new Everdell that will keep delighting and surprising you for many more seasons to come.
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Lurking in the depths of Mistwood, the cunning and villainous Nightweave plots to take over Everdell with the aid of her spiderlings. Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in both solo and two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from our More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave, meet heroes of renown in our Legends II and Corrin Evertail expansion packs, and find abundance in new farms in our Through Every Season expansion pack. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability.

Will the sun shine brightest on your city?
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.

New to Everdell?
Check out this great How to Play video from Watch it Played!
Within the charming valley of Everdell, beneath the boughs of towering trees, among meandering streams and mossy hollows, a civilization of forest critters is thriving and expanding... Everdell is a game of dynamic tableau building and worker placement played over four seasons. Whoever makes the most impressive city wins! 

On your turn, you can take one of three actions:
a) Place a Meeple: You have a collection of wooden Critter meeples. You can place these on the board locations, events, and on Destination cards. Critter meeples allow you to perform various actions to develop your city: gathering resources, drawing cards, and taking other special actions.
b) Play a Card: Each player is building and populating a city; a tableau of up to 15 Construction and Critter cards. There are five types of cards: Travelers, Production, Destination, Governance, and Prosperity. Cards generate resources (twigs, resin, pebbles, and berries), grant abilities, and ultimately score points. The interactions of the cards reveal numerous strategies and a near infinite variety of working cities.
c) Prepare for the next Season: Critter meeples are returned to your supply and you gain bonuses depending on the season. The game is played from one year’s winter through to the end of autumn. Players add up the points from their cards and other bonuses and whoever has the highest total wins!
New content that will delight and surprise you for many more seasons to come!
Golden Occupied Tokens
The new Critter and Construction cards in Newleaf are played like normal Critter and Construction cards from the base game, except that you use Golden Occupied tokens instead of normal occupied tokens. These Golden Occupied tokens are limited -- a player can never use more than 3 in a game! These new cards are very powerful, so choose wisely which you'll spend your Golden Occupied tokens on! 

Through Every Season Cards
Since the beginning of Everdell’s history, farming has been a vital part of the valley’s way of life. Farmers face a number of challenges through the four distinct seasons of the year and must adapt as the weather changes. Experience the story of an Everdell farm throughout the year!
The 8 new special Farm cards in Mistwood replace the basic Farms in your Everdell game. These often give you the choice of two abilities, and you choose which of these abilities to use each time the card activates.

More Legends
Legendary cards represent unique Critters and Constructions that are powerful upgrades of other Critters and Constructions. Use them when you are familiar with the base game, and are looking forward to a twist on a regular game! The More Legends cards in Mistwood are added into a game of Everdell in the same manner as the Legends from Everdell: Collector's Edition.
New ideas are arriving every day!
Station Cards
Faceup Critter and Construction cards on the Station board work like Meadow cards and may be played on your turn, but whenever you play a card from the Station, also gain the reward listed on the Train Car tile beside the card! This reward is gained after you have fully resolved the played card and any additional cards that may have activated as a result. After you've gained the reward, replenish both the Train Car tile and the card played.
Remember: cards on the Station board are not Meadow cards, and therefore any abilities that affect Meadow cards (such as the Inn) do not apply to Station cards!

Visitors
Newleaf is a bustling and growing city in Everdell, and now that the railway system is in full operation, many new critters and big ideas are coming into the Emerald Valley. The Visitor cards that come into play on the Station Board offer players a new end game scoring opportunity!
To gain a Visitor card on your turn:
Place a worker on the Station. The Station is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Choose 1 of the faceup Visitor cards and discard it facedown on the Visitor discard pile.
Reveal 1 new Visitor card and choose 1 of the 2 faceup Visitor cards to take and place by your city. If you do not want either of the faceup Visitors, you may draw 1 from the top of the Visitor deck instead. If you selected one of the faceup Visitors, replace its card with another one from the Visitor deck.
Gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles by the Station; set that tile aside and draw a replacement tile.
Visitor cards will score their listed point values, if your city contains their requirements at the end of the game. Visitor cards that you have obtained and failed to please (by not meeting their requirements) are not worth any points at the end of the game.

The Knoll
You may place a worker on the Knoll to choose any 3 cards from the Meadow and/or the Station to discard. Replenish the discarded cards from the main deck, and draw any 3 cards into your hand from the Meadow and/or the Station. After drawing your cards, you may then gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles. Set that Train Car tile aside and draw a replacement tile from the bag. Finally, replenish the 3 cards you drew into your hand.
The Knoll is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Everdell has a brand new villainess!
Now while playing Everdell, you can pit your wits against Nightweave, our newest automated player for solitaire and two-player games. Nightweave is designed to function like a real player at your table: she has her own hand of cards, Prepares for Seasons on her own schedule, and, most importantly, she has her own agenda!

Nightweave has her own Big Critter meeple along with 8 spider meeples (not just 6!) that will move about the board to do her bidding -- blocking exclusive Locations, taking events away before you can get them, and even enacting Plots and Plans that will interfere with your options as a player, reminiscent of the Weather cards from Spirecrest.  She has eight different personalities that influence what she targets and focuses on, so there's lots of variety in gameplay!

What Happens on Nightweave's Turn?
Turn over the top card of Nightweave's Activity deck. These cards are the heart of her decision-making during the game, instructing her to play cards into her city, place spider meeples on previous, exclusive Locations, take a Basic or Special event, etc.
Nightweave will perform the first action listed for her current season, if possible. If she cannot perform this action for any reason, she will take the second action for her current season. If she cannot take that action either, she will perform as much of the Default action at the bottom of the card as she can. This could include discarding cards, collecting point tokens (yes, really!), and/or a number of other actions.
If Nightweave herself is in the Meadow and there are no spiderlings left in her lair when she draws an Activity card with a Spider or Nightweave icon, she will Prepare for Season. 
The game ends when you run out of actions and when Nightwave Prepares for Season at the end of Autumn.

Can you stop Nightweave from taking over Everdell? Check out the Rulebook for more in-depth information about this automated player!

campaign.story:
Three Sisters is a beautifully-illustrated, backyard-farming roll-and-write game for 1 to 4 players that plays in about 45 minutes.  
Three Sisters is named after the Indigenous agricultural technique - companion planting - that is still widely used today. Three different crops—in this case, pumpkins, corn, and beans—are planted close together. Corn provides a lattice for beans to climb. The beans bring in nitrogen from the air into the soil, and the pumpkins provide a natural mulch ground cover helping to reduce weeds and keep pests away. 
All the crops, fruits, flowers, and hives are represented by mini-tracks. The areas are interconnected to other elements in the game, giving you bonuses along the way. Many crops generate goods that are used to unlock bonus actions. Advancing on all of these tracks offers various amounts of points, advancements, and bonuses.
Three Sisters is the brand new loaded roll-and-write game from the designers of Fleet: The Dice Game, Wasteland Express Delivery Service, Piepmatz, Stellar, and more. Three Sisters packs all the decisions and fun of a full gaming experience into an efficient and innovative package. 
 The Tractor Meeple is an alternative meeple to Farmer Edith for those extra busy days in the yard!
Preview Video from Tantrum House 
Three Sisters is played over 8 rounds. Each round, dice are rolled based on the number of players, grouped by number, and each group is placed on a section of the action rondel. Then players take turns drafting one die and using it. When everyone is done, everyone gets another action based on the die that is remaining.
The die you take lets you do two things: Work your farm based on the value of the die and then take the action of the section you took it from.  When you work on your farm, you are focused on the zone matching the die value. You may either Plant or Water. The actions on the rondel let you interact with other areas of your yard like your shed, fruit,  or apiary. 
The player sheets have several areas: Your field, divided into six zones, each containing the three crop types, and various other areas related to additional actions you can take: Fruits, perennial flowers, your apiary, and a shed with tools that have special abilities.
How to Play Video from All You Can Board 
 Three Sisters has a fully developed solo mode sure to satisfy solo gamers of all types. Farmer Edith will get in your way as you work to grow the best garden. But don't take our word for it:
Solo Mode Playthrough One Man and His Meeple   
 Here's what reviewers and insiders who have played Three Sisters are saying about the game: 
Three Sisters vs Fleet Dice  - Glenn, Boardgames and Bourbon 
 Three Sisters Preview from Gameenthus.com   
Three Sisters Playthrough with Stella and Tarrant from Meepleuniversity.com   
 Preview Video from All You Can Board 
In addition to the tractor meeple, a KS Exclusive mini-expansion - The Weather Expansion  - is FREE to KS backers and will not be included with retail copies of the game,  but may be available directly from Motor City Gameworks in the future.

Kickstarter Exclusive: The Weather Expansion 
The weather expansion is Kickstarter Exclusive content for all of our backers! 
The Weather expansion uses the value of the highest undrafted die to create a weather-related condition that will apply to the next round of play. This means that while the first round of the game will play normally, every subsequent round will have a weather effect that will provide emergent tactical decisions and opportunities for you as you farm.
The weather expansion board sites above the game board and the cloud meeple is used to mark the weather condition that is in play for the round.
 We appreciate SO MUCH that you have considered supporting Three Sisters on  Kickstarter. Shipping is expensive and difficult. Motor City Gameworks understands that you have many choices on how to spend your hard-earned gaming dollar. 
We would like to help with some of the cost of shipping to make it as bearable as possible. Please see the shipping estimates below. 
 All estimates include a significant discount! 
While the shipping could change, we have worked very hard to provide the best possible value by setting up partnerships all over the world.  This allows us to provide customs-friendly shipping to the USA, Canada, the EU, Australia, and parts of Asia. If you reside anywhere not listed, please contact us through Kickstarter and we can provide a shipping estimate.  Shipping will be charged post-campaign in the pledge manager. You will be able to confirm your reward, updated total with shipping, and your address.
 *Rest of Asia includes Japan, Korea, South, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Macao

Additional Copies
Additional copies will be available in the pledge manager after the campaign for $29/ea. Those extra copies will include all Kickstarter exclusive content.

Shipping Estimates for Additional Copies
The current shipping estimates are based on one copy, weighing near 1.5lbs. The shipping with additional copies will be calculated based on weight and the shipping discount will come off the top of the total.  The estimates below are for planning purposes,  it may come in less or more.

In most non-US regions, each additional copy would be $5 additional shipping, up to 3 three add-on copies (4 total copies on an order).

For US backers,  each additional copy would be $2 additional shipping, up to 9 add-on copies (10 total copies on an order).

Again, do not add these to your order on Kickstarter, back for one copy and additional copies can be added during the pledge manager. Thank you!!

Risks and challenges
This is our third Kickstarter campaign since 2018 so this is not our first rodeo. Of course, there are always challenges and unforeseen obstacles that arise when creating a brand new product. Our previous campaigns have given us so much experience in all aspects of bringing a product to life, as well as running a crowdfunding campaign.

We'll make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadlines for delivery in May 2021. We'll personally make sure we're 100% transparent in all our updates regarding our progress. The project could face possible challenges if the quality of the product or packaging does not meet our standards. However, we’re in constant communication with our manufacturer and have built a great relationship with them as well as several working prototypes which we hope to make slight improvements to as the campaign progresses. 

As we want to share our project with the entire world, we're still a small business that faces challenges in providing affordable pricing when it comes to postage. We're not large enough to have warehouses around the world to bypass customs fees and the continually rising shipping and postage rates. We'll do our best to guarantee that you will not pay additional fees to have your items delivered but some locations might involve customs fees and duties that are the backers’ responsibility. 

While we want to ship all rewards at the same time, some will receive them sooner than others, depending on your physical address.

campaign.story:
Hit the Silk!
(slang) To parachute (use a parachute). “With the engine on fire he had to punch out and hit the silk”
It was always going to be a daring heist. Everything was going to plan until the pilot seized a gun from the lockbox, opened the emergency door and fired three rounds into the engine before bailing with his parachute and a spare. 
You need to secure the loot but now you’re a parachute down on a plane that’s losing altitude. Fast. Who can you trust? Who's got the cash? Where are the 'chutes? And can you hold your nerve before you Hit the Silk!?
Hit the Silk! is a game of suspense and treachery. It's a highly social, semi-cooperative experience myriad with bluffing, negotiation, social deduction and a few take that elements which force you to reevaluate your strategy. 
Player Count: 3-6 Players / Time: 20-45 minutes / Suitable from 7+
 Last 48 Hours! Campaign Summary
As our successful campaign draws to a close, we're looking likely to upgrade a few components with 2-3 stretch goals reached. Due to high interest in extra game content, we'll be releasing an "Extra Cargo" pack with a new scenario, cards and dice. You can find out more in the pinned update (6). 
Hit ths Silk! is just £22 with lots of interesting content both in the standard pledge and there are minis, Stop the Train! game and other new content available now and post-campaign. 
Help us land this plane and get to our third stretch goal £21k target!
Extra Cargo with more content available as an add-on in the Pledge Manager
Game Overview
What's in the box?
When the game lands and you open the box, here’s what you’ll find inside:
1 x Altimeter & Needle
1 x Playing Board
              - Front: Card Organiser
              - Reverse: Landing Sequence End Game
1 x Plane Token
3 x Handcuff Tokens
2 x Poison Tokens
51 x Equipment & Action Cards
18 x Flannel Cards
1 x On Your Turn Card
2 x Landing Sequence Dice
1 x Game Play Guide
+ any stretch goals unlocked from the campaign
As a band of criminals, you have highjacked a plane to pull off a heist. With the loot, you must to settle a debt with an unforgiving casino owner. The plane is now in trouble and losing altitude fast. You need to parachute to safety, as a team, with enough money to settle the debt, but hold on... there are not enough parachutes!
What follows is a scrabble to find the cash and secure a parachute as it's everyone for themselves. That's where our game begins...
THE START
The game starts with the plane at a high altitude. For each action taken, the plane then drops 500ft (sometimes more). Before the plane crashes, players must agree by majority vote to Hit the Silk!
The plane height is tracked by the Altimeter, which also indicates when you will cast a vote - is it time to Hit the Silk!? At 1,000 ft, there is a mandatory bailout, below which it is impossible to survive the jump.
The Altimeter acts as a countdown
INVENTORY
In the fallout (after the pilot has jumped out of the plane), everyone grabs six cards. From these, they must choose to keep 4 and openly discard the other 2. 
Here are the cards you might find:
ASSETS
Briefcases - stashed with loot (at values of £10k, £20k, £30k, £40k)
Parachutes - to save your life
Knives - to defend against theft
Selection of Cards from the Game
ACTIONS (when played, these cause the plane to lose altitude)
Spy - looks at another players' hand
Handcuffs - attach yourself to another player to prevent them jumping without you
Key - unlock handcuffs OR open the lockbox
Steal - speculatively steal from another player 
Kung Fu - defend an attempt to rob you
Revolver - threaten a player with your gun to demand items
Bullet - combine with a revolver to take matters into your own hands and gain loot
Poison - poison another player to accelerate negotiations
Antidote - save a player from death by poison
SUNDRY
Pilot's Licence - gives you an advantage if you're the last man standing and need to land the plane - see section below!
Flannels - just a pile of laundry, unless you're swindling someone in a trade
On your turn card - reference card for game play
ON YOUR TURN
The starting player (selected at random) begins her turn by taking as many of the following actions as she wishes:
Play Reference Card
Change Cards (once only per turn) - trade out unwanted items from your hand for new ones. Players will see what you discard. As the plane descends, you'll get more choice in the card draw. 
Perform actions - use as many action cards from your hand as you want. Remember each action causes the plane to drop lower!
Offer trades - make deals with other players and exchange cards face down. No one said you had to be truthful in the trade right?
...or do nothing. There's a cost to doing nothing though - the plane drops another 500ft before the next player begins their turn, with one eye on their hand and the other on the Altimeter. 
HIT THE SILK!
When the opportunity arises to jump out of the plane (as indicated on the Altimeter), the players vote to wait or Hit the Silk! If there's no majority decision to Hit the Silk! then players return to the plane and continue negotiating and seeking out the items and loot they need. 
If there's a majority vote to Hit the Silk! everyone jumps out of the plane. Then players reveal all of their cards and find out whether the team has sufficient cash to pay off the casino (and hopefully some surplus!).
Anyone handcuffed to someone wearing a parachute gets dragged off the plane and the fates of the two are entwined. Two parachutes will save them, one will not.
STRATEGY
Be careful what you reveal! In collaborating with others, you will need to convince them you have a parachute and sufficient cash. Here's the catch - in doing so, you make yourself vulnerable to theft or attack from the desperate. 
You have a number of tactics at your disposal: trades (you can cross someone or trade honestly), bluff about your hand, defend your assets with a weapon, or go after a parachute by theft or force. Be warned - alliances can be fragile and you definitely can't rest on your laurels. Fortunes can change in the turn of a hand. 
WAYS TO WIN
You land safely as part of a group with enough cash to pay off the casino
If left on the plane without a parachute, you skilfully land the falling plane (see below)
WAYS TO LOSE
You land safely, but without enough cash between you. Without the casino's money, you're as good as dead
You're killed (shot, poisoned or handcuffed to someone without enough parachutes between you)
You're left on the plane without a parachute and it crashed into a lake, mountain or runway
LAND THE PLANE!
Without a 'chute, left high and dry, any stragglers get a last ditch attempt to land the plane. Flying isn't exactly your forte, so don't expect good odds. Maybe lady luck will be on your side though. 
The Card Organiser is flipped to play the Finale Ending
Players flip the board over and navigate the mini game with two dice that determine the direction and distance of plane movement. Luck interweaves strategy as your decisions and dice rolls guide the plane closer to the ground. It's a frantic attempt to dodge the lake, land and screech to a halt before the aircraft hits the mountainside. 
RULEBOOK
Above, we've tried to introduce the game in a story telling way, but if you're looking for a deeper understanding of the rules,  here's our draft gameplay guide.
You can also get an idea of how to play from this video put together by Lance of Love2Hate Board Games:
NORTHERN DICE
"It’s nail biting stuff, and it’s that captivating theme and engagement that we loved." Read Northern Dice's excellent preview: A 5000ft Leap Of Faith

BOARD GAME REVIEW
"There is a lot of mayhem, amusement and take that packed into the deck of cards. Escape Plan really know how to imbue theme into a game." Read More: Hit the Silk! Preview 

AMATEUR BOARD GAMER
"Dive into this thriller! ... simple to teach... an excellent game with quick and intense gameplay". More over on Board Game Geek:  AGB Preview of Hit the Silk! 

WHAT BOARD GAME?
"From the designers of my 2020 party game of the year, Hit the Silk! Is a brilliant family-friendly game that brings fresh new ideas to the table. With immersive and engaging components, bright and vibrant art and varied card play, Hit the Silk! will be an insta-back for many when it hits Kickstarter this year. Don’t miss out!" 
Watch below: Jim.Gamer of What Board Game conducted an interview with Brendan Mills, designer of Hit the Silk!
Our prototype went out to a number of other previewers and we've collected some of the great feedback for the game here: 
Here are the pledges offered in our Kickstarter. 
If you are a retailer and interested in further details, please visit the FAQ section or email orders@escapeplanboardgames.com
As if the base game wasn't thrilling enough, we're hoping to unlock some additional, exciting stretch goals during the campaign.
There's a mix of component upgrades and brilliant, new game features. You can keep track of our flight path below and help us reach the dizzy heights by sharing the project.

At the end of the campaign, we'll wait a few weeks for pledges to be sent through to us by Kickstarter and begin using that time to finalise the artwork - and make any adjust if we reach stretch goals that require us to modify anything. 
In the mean time, we will open up a system to allow backers to pay for shipping and manage their pledge. We'll then provide a cut off date for getting that detail to us and lokck in the final numbers of production and finalise the specifications. 
From there, we'll send the files over to LudoFact and they will pass through data control. We know from experience of working with them that they are reliable and communicative. We anticipate that production will finish in the Autumn and we will then move into fulfilment in the early Winter.

ABOUT US
We've successfully launched and delivered the well-received Stop the Train! and prior to that have been known for creating live escape adventures in London (UK) for teams of up to 7 players, immersing them in the 1940's with a mission to save themselves, or greater still, save Britain.
The thematic idea for Hit the Silk! was originally considered as an ending for an escape room back in 2015. In early 2020, it was re-imagined during lockdown as a semi-cooperative, social game.  We hope you will help us bring it to life.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SECOND KICKSTARTER PROJECT

We're still fairly new to the board game category, but we do have the experience of running a successful campaign the first time around, delivering 75% of orders ahead of schedule. We also many years experience in delivering successful games in a parallel industry: escape rooms. There's a lot of transferred knowledge we bring with us. Whilst we are reaching a new audience for board games, we do have an established following of gamers and marketing experience in the team to extend our reach.

PRODUCTION VALUE

Our default is to always aspire to the highest quality available; the challenge is that this needs balancing with affordability. We're asking for backing for a new project and are aiming for a price point that is attractive to supporters without compromising on component quality. We're working with industry experts to find this balance.

MANUFACTURING & SHIPPING DURING COVID-19

As with any large volume order, there is an inherent risk of delay to project delivery. Experience shows us to manage this risk best, we need to work with reputable suppliers who have a track record of delivery high quality projects to an agreed timescale. The COVID-19 pandemic presents many unknowns and may delay the production a little, but happily, we are sourcing from European suppliers so we are unlikely to see significant delays. We have had their assurances that the impact is minimal at this time.

We have developed the product as far as possible (manufactured prototypes; fully tested game play; artwork design signed off; marketing plan devised) prior to manufacture. Therefore, we do not foresee any delays from our end. We're excited by the prospect of Kickstarter support bringing this game to market.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We are working with eco-conscious European suppliers that have a green promise. It is intended that we will make the product fully from recyclable materials to avoid any landfill increase.
Sustainable materials
Cardboard: the paper industry is very energy-intensive, however most of the required energy can be produced in-house via renewable energy sources such as wind and solar. We will seek out the cardboard with the highest possible percentage of recycled material saving resources and consuming the least energy. Where wooden pieces are used (minimal), sustainable forestry will supply. We aspire to avoid plastic.
Environmentally friendly factories
We insist on working with a factory that has an eco-conscious policy that invest in renewable energy and use local/regional sources to avoid unnecessary long distance haulage.

You're not a freelancer, but you want business and lifestyle inspiration from some of the most talented people.
You want to learn about freelancing or use freelancers in your business. 

The specs 
80+ pages // 21cm square // Full colour // 100 gsm silk pages // 250 gsm silk cover // Perfect-bound (flat edge) print 

Issue 1 Features and Regulars 
Your Letters // Last Year a DJ Saved My Life // What’s The Deal With… Clubhouse? // Do Give Up Your Day Job // Made By Freelancers // Side Projects // Well I’d Like to Know If You’ve Got The Notion? // Routines & Rituals // My Day Off // Top of the Shops // Creative Burnout // What We’re Listening To // What We’re Reading // What We’re Learning // Newsletter Love 💌  // Freelancer Stats // Feeding Your Creativity // The Creative Process // Can You Be a Creative With a Family? // So You Want to be a… Graphic Designer? // Creative Spaces // City v Countryside Living // Sell Yourself // Do I Need… Business Insurance? // A Day in the Life… // Money // Pricing Freelance Projects // How Do I… Write My Manifesto? // Mental Health // Physical Health // Pets // Plant Power 🌱 // Events Calendar // Jobs // Your Questions Answered // Mindset // The Secret Freelancer // 3 O’Clock Somewhere // The Creativity Playlist 🎵

Subscribe for the first four issues for the best value and to give us the greatest chance of hitting our goal and making the mag. 

Who is it for?
Our core audience will be creative and B2B freelancers, and companies of one. But we'll be featuring stories from a huge mix of the most talented freelancers, so expect to discover more people like you, as well as being inspired by those in completely different industries to you. 
Copywriters // Translators // Illustrators // Graphic Designers // Artists // Videographers // Photographers // Researchers // Brand Strategists // Marketers // Web Designers // Web Developers // DJs // Tattoo Artists // Hair Stylists // Journalists // PR Experts // Artist Managers // Authors // Content Creators // Creatives // VAs // Social Media Managers // Wellness Coaches // Accountants // Editors // Musicians // Producers // Bloggers // Vloggers // Streamers // Influencers // Trades // Calligraphers // Personal Trainers // Yoga Teachers // Business Coaches
Our aim is to be inspirational without being unrealistically aspirational.
We're making this mag from London with mainly UK-based stories, but we're also talking to freelancers around the world.
Even if you're not a freelancer, we think you're going to get a lot out of reading stories and news from the most talented and creative people and small businesses out there.

Freelancer Magazine | Issue 1 | Creativity
Freelance questions we'll be answering
How do I get my first clients? // How do I say bye-bye to imposter syndrome? // What’s the best way to pitch? // How do I get a mentor?  // Should I start a newsletter? // How do I write my manifesto? // How do I raise my prices? // What’s productisation? // Do I give up or do I just keep chasing payments? // What’s the best way to run an online workshop? // What’s the best biscuit for dunking? // How many breaks should I take to play with my dog? // Do I need business insurance? // Should I try to make my business look bigger than it is? // What accounting software do I need? // How do I write a content plan? // How do I raise my profile? // How much holiday should I take? // Should I use my own name for my business?

Why print? 
We're on our screens more than ever, so we thought it would be nice to deliver you something super exciting through the post—a lovely printed and well-designed piece, written for you. 
Sprawl on your sofa or take it to the park with a coffee and cake.  We hope you'll fold over the page corners and keep it on your bookshelf to refer back to later. 
There will be plenty of ways for us all to chat and connect online, but we know that not everyone always feels like attending an online networking event or being on the socials. The magazine is a way to feel connected to what's going on in the freelance world without always being online. 
Freelancer Magazine | Issue 1 | Creativity
The funding goal and what we'll spend the money on
Our funding goal covers the design and the minimum print run so we can make the first four issues. Kickstarter fees can be up to 10% and post & packing charges also count towards your goal, so we have taken this into account. 
Sophie is covering the start-up costs of the video, pre-launch designs and website. 
After we reach our goal, we want to get the mag to more freelancers, and Sophie will pay herself a bit to make this sustainable. Beyond that, we'll be commissioning other freelancers to work with us. Beyond that... who knows? How exciting is that? 

Rewards 
We're keeping it simple. The rewards are where you can buy issues of the magazine. This Kickstarter will establish a product/market fit for the mag before we go to print and make more issues. We're inviting retailers and advertisers to be part of this from day one via this Kickstarter. 
The Kickstarter platform doesn't let you choose more than one reward, so please email editor@freelancermagazine.co.uk if you are interested in more than one reward and I can sort it out for you. 

The Team 
Sophie Cross (it's me!) is the founder and editor of Freelancer Magazine. I've been a freelance marketer and writer for eight years. I'm collaborating with freelance graphic designer, Angela Lyons, who specialises in designing magazines. This won’t be the first magazine we’ve made together - we’ve teamed up on 10 magazines before, so we’re pretty confident we can do a good job.
Huge thanks go to cover stars and launch party hosts DJs Dom C and Mary Rose. And to filmmaker, Jesse Roth, for shooting and producing the Kickstarter video. When I went to all these guys with this crazy idea a couple of months ago, they got straight on board with their unlimited support and massive amounts of energy. 
We couldn't have got this far without the people who have already sent messages of support, shared social posts, shared their excitement and advice for the mag, been interviewed and contributed to Issue 1, and agreed to be part of future issues. 
THANK YOU SO MUCH!
Please keep sharing with other people you think might like the mag.

campaign.story:
Now the campaign is over, you can pre-order via the Alley Cat Games website!

The Eternal Palace has fallen into disrepair. As the leader of a noble house seeking the favour of the Emperor you plan to aid in its reconstruction. Collect the materials you need to contribute to rebuilding the Palace monuments, and commemorate the restoration by creating a beautiful painting of his beloved gardens.
Will your efforts catch the eye of the Emperor, or will your rival nobles be honoured instead? Only one house will win the Emperor’s ultimate recognition.
Eternal Palace is a highly interactive dice-placement Euro game for 1-5 players. Players assign workers, represented by dice, to locations based on their combined value. You'll visit locations to gain resources, rebuild monuments, and gather painting pieces for your masterpiece. 
Dice placement
The way dice are played in Eternal Palace is unlike any other game. You'll roll dice and secretly group them behind a screen. Your opponents will know what dice you have but not how you'll use them. Will you use the 3/4/5 to visit locations 3, 4, and 5 or will you group them to visit location 12? Or maybe something in between? Predicting your opponents moves and making a surprise move yourself really elevates Eternal Palace to a game that is truly great! Once the dice are locked in, you can either stick to your decision or use some wisdom to manipulate your dice and go somewhere completely different!
Interactive and positive gameplay
Unlike other worker/dice placement games that focus on blocking opponents, the interaction in Eternal Palace is focused around mini races at each location. Get to the top of a location's track first and you'll get a bonus point. The race at each location means you'll always be interested in what your opponents are doing. Should you try to catch up or will you focus your efforts elsewhere?
Great table presence
Gaining points has never been so beautiful. Each painting layer you gather in Eternal Palace is layered onto your canvas to create a unique painting, which scores you points at the end of the game. If you win one of the race tracks, you'll gain a unique feature piece and a bonus point.
Hand- cut prototype of the painting pieces in action - the cut will be much more accurate in the production version!
Gather painting pieces throughout the game to paint your masterpiece

*All photographs on this Kickstarter page are photos of the prototype, not a pre-production copy of the games, so dimensions, components and colours are subject to minor changes.

The Deluxe Edition is limited edition which is unlikely to ever come into retail stores or mass distribution. If it does, it will be at least 3 months after the base game.
The miniatures from the deluxe edition come in grey, but they look great when painted!

For this Kickstarter campaign we have chosen to focus our stretch goals on making the Kickstarter pack even better to reward our Kickstarter backers even more! They will be revealed below once the campaign is funded.

All stretch goals now unlocked


Want to make Eternal Palace even better? In addition to stretch goals that are focusing on the Kickstarter pack, these social goals will improve the game quality for all versions of Eternal Palace.
Follow the instructions below to unlock some great component quality upgrades 

The image now has over 75 Thumbs so the box will now be upgraded with a spot UV! Click this image to go to the image on Board Game Geek and boost it even more if you haven't already!
This Instagram post now has over 300 likes so we've upgraded the rulebook with a linen finish. Click this image to go to the Instagram post.
This Facebook post has now been shared over 100 times so all cardboard tokens have been upgraded to 2mm thickness.
We now have over 150 retweets, so we've unlocked linen finish on all cards!
We now have 300 more Kickstarter followers so all card stock has been upgraded to 330 gsm
The deluxe edition will be exclusive to Kickstarter backers and direct orders for at least a 3 month period. It may never enter distribution!
- Slickerdrips
Gather resources,  recruit advisors, rebuild monuments, and create your masterpiece to gain the favour of the Emperor.
Roll your dice to see what values you have to play with this round. The player with the lowest total goes first. You'll be able to see each others dice rolls but you'll secretly group them behind a screen, so you won't always be able to predict what other players will do this round
Group your dice to visit higher value locations  or keep them separate to visit multiple locations. You'll even be able to manipulate your dice and change your strategy based on the other players' actions.
Visit locations to gather resources. Visit with more workers to gain bonus resources. Resource gathering spots (and some other spots in the game) are also a race to the top: be the first up the track to gain a unique feature piece for your painting and an extra point for the end of the game
Placing a die here, the blue player gains 1 wood. The yellow player placed 2 dice here so gains 3 wood
Advisors give ongoing benefits or powerful one-time bonuses. You'll be able to recruit them at spots 1 & 2 in slightly different ways. At spot 1, draw 3 face down cards and choose from them, at spot 2, choose from the face up cards before your opponents hire them.
Placing a die here, the blue player recruits an Advisor
Contributing to rebuilding will gain you favour with the Emperor, and an art piece towards your masterpiece. You'll also claim the monument to take credit for your contribution but timing is important and these monuments will change hands throughout the game so only one person can ultimately take the credit. 
Placing a die here, the blue player pays 1 wood and gains 1 favour. They also gain the painting piece and monument
Creating your masterpiece is key to being honoured by the Emperor. The locations you visit will gain you a painting piece, which scores points and brings the game closer to an end. You might even get a unique feature piece to add to your painting if you're the first to 'complete' a location. 
Finishing your painting first and getting the longest 'run' of painting pieces will gain bonus points at the end of the game.
2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12 - a run of 7 painting pieces!
- Rahdo
The solo mode is included in all versions of Eternal Palace
In the Solo Mode, you'll play against the Master, an AI opponent. The Solo mode plays similarly to a 2 player game but after you've grouped your dice the Master's dice groups are determined by the flip of a card. 
When it's the master's turn he will decide where to go, first checking if any of his dice values are the same as yours (in which case he'll try to beat you there) then checking which dice spots gain him a benefit (like going up a track or taking a monument)
The master is a worthy opponent, with 3 difficulty levels to suit all player skill levels. 
The solo mode also has different sets of cards that can be used, which gives the master a different feel every time. This makes the solo mode very variable and offers a lot of replayability!
The solo mode is compatible with all expansions, except the turn order expansion
The solo mode is included in all versions of Eternal Palace.
Full solo rules are in the print and play folder

The Turn order tokens (included in the base game) give advanced players a way to alter their turn order and perhaps gain an advantage at a pivotal moment in the game! They can be played after dice are grouped but before they are revealed.
Each expansion adds a unique twist to Eternal Palace.
Labyrinth
Race through the labyrinth to gain bonuses. Will you take the longer path to gain additional favour from the Emperor or will you race to the centre?
Exports
In the Exports expansion complete export requests at the market by trading goods and you'll gain the benefit of the export. 
You'll gain the bonus when he export is complete and you'll even be able to visit the fulfil the export request more than once to gain the benefit multiple times
Composition
If you complete specific painting combinations first you'll gain a bonus. Some combination are harder to complete but you'll get better bonuses

The Labyrinth and Exports expansions are only included in the deluxe edition of Eternal Palace. The Composition expansion is included in the Kickstarter pack (free to all Kickstarter backers)
The Labyrinth, Exports, and Composition expansions are also compatible with the solo mode.

 Help us make games - We're a small company and we rely on Kickstarter income to survive. We’re still not able to put our bigger games like Eternal Palace straight to retail so we count on our Kickstarter backers to help bring them to life.

We were lucky enough to be able to survive as a publisher but we still need help recovering from the shipping delays, cost increases, and business interruptions. By supporting us on Kickstarter you're directly supporting Alley Cat Games!

An optimistic prediction of the timeline:
 April: KS completes. We finish all remaining graphic design and development.
 June: Submit Files to manufacturer
  July & August: Manufacturing
