  November: Fulfilment commences
  December Fulfilment completed. 
 January: Most backers have their copies.
  PLEASE NOTE: If there are any delays it could push this back farther for completing fulfilment. The above is an optimistic prediction. We always add extra time to our tiers' estimated delivery dates - as delays can happen. Therefore a realistic prediction is that people's games arrive in January/February - as we have indicated in the tiers themselves.
CONVENTION SALES: We will be taking some copies to sell at conventions. However, by backing the KS, you are: guaranteeing yourself a copy, getting cheap delivery, and helping us continue making games. We will guarantee IF your copy cannot arrive before these conventions, but you or a friend are attending the convention, you/they can pick it up from that convention. Conventions we may be attending before fulfilment include UK Games Expo, Origins & Gen Con.

At Alley Cat Games we're a multicultural team so we're acutely aware of the importance of appropriate research when representing a culture that doesn't reflect our own heritage, even when the setting is fictional like in Eternal Palace. That's why we paid a cultural advisor and involved them in our research on Eternal Palace at an early stage. We made a lot of changes to the game and took on advice for things such as representation, thematic choices and even colour options. 
It's also important to point out the one aspect of the game that we didn't change, the easels. These were not commonly used in China during the time period, but we felt that they added a table presence and beauty to the game that would not have been as striking had we meticulously represented painting styles in an accurate way.

updates.update_userinfo: Eternal Palace is our 2nd most backed campaign ever - First look at 3D prints of miniatures!
updates.update_content:
Despite having run over 10 Kickstarter campaigns, each time we launch a project on here we hold our breath a little. The reason is simple, each game launch is the culmination of a huge amount of time, effort, and passion by our small team. We've playtested and developed for hundreds of hours, paid artists and graphic designers to make it look like a game you'd want to play. Created countless prototypes, from the early handwritten paper ones to more professional productions so we can photograph them, all before it ever appears on this site.
Thank you to over 3,300 backers our 2nd highest KS total!

campaign.story:
Check out Updates for the latest news about Caper: Europe.
Looking for your CrowdOx Survey? Find your survey here.
Missed the campaign? Visit CaperEurope.com to join the heist.
Stay Connected with Keymaster by Joining our mailing list.
Follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.
Join the Caper: Europe Card Game Group on Facebook!
In Caper: Europe, turns follow a simple structure. On your turn, you will take pick a card from your hand and play it on your side of the board. Your opponent will do the same. Then swap hands. Follow this pattern until you only have one card left in hand, which you will discard. This happens over six rounds for two types of cards: Thieves and Gear.
You will also need to keep their eyes on the loot. Each location rewards points for the Mastermind (that's you!) who controls it at game end. Controlling locations require Capers. Each time you gain a Caper, move the location's Thiefle one space toward yourself on the Caper track. If the Thiefle is closer to you than your opponent at the end of the game, you win the location and gain it's benefits. 
An experienced Mastermind (that'll be you one day) knows it takes a team to win. Each of the target locations has room for three Thieves and each thief has space for three pieces of Gear. Thieves and Gear work together to provide you points and give you control of locations. And despite common misconception, the Thieves of your crew are not selfish! Every gear card at a location counts toward all Thief abilities at that location. Strive to assemble crews whose abilities complement one another and assigns gear that provides bonuses to multiple thieves.
Caper: Europe include everything you need to plan heists across four major European cities. Each city sets the stage for a unique heist experience each time you sit down at the table.
What better way to celebrate our journey through the cities of Europe than with some postcards commemorating our favorite stops? For this campaign, you can participate in a series of challenges to unlock sets of vacation postcards from the Caper Universe. Each set you unlock will be added to your pledge for free! Reconnect with old game night rivals you’ve been missing. Maybe pick out a couple favorites and use them as mini-prints in your hideout. And when it’s safe to do so, challenge friends to a game of Caper: Europe.
You may be the type of Mastermind that wants to know every detail of the heist before it takes place. Which probably means you want to read the rules or take Caper for a spin on a virtual table. Our working draft of the Rules is available for you to peruse at the link below. Plus, check out the working draft of Old Bill while you're here!
If you own Tabletop Simulator (or want to purchase it) you can give Caper: Europe a try today! Every week, we will update the mod with a new city. By the end of the campaign, you'll be able to play the whole game on TTS!
Join us for a Livestream on Twitch every Thursday in March!
 Check out our Q&A stream from 3/2
It's Mine published by Mont Taber stole our hearts when we first heard about it from the Dice Tower's Zee Garcia back in 2017. Mattox in particular was enamored with bringing it to the US and so we obtained the US and Canadian rights with the understanding that Keymaster would rebrand the game and work with Josh Emrich to build out the world of the game through new illustrations. We released Caper in the fall of 2018, but by the time we needed to reprint the game in mid 2019, we didn't have capital to do so (we'd spent all our money printing PARKS).
So, we took the opportunity to dive into development with designer Unai Rubio (something we didn't have the opportunity to do when we originally localized the game). You can read about Unai's journey on BGG. We started by addressing community feedback around usability and learning the game, added some diversity to the cast of characters, then focused on redesigning the game around the best parts of the original.
We are so glad to be able to bring you this iteration of Unai's vision and are especially excited to have the worldwide rights to selling and distributing the game. Caper: Europe is truly a passion project and we hope the redesign feels that way to you.
All add-ons will be available in the pledge manager. You can purchase them after the campaign.
The full Keymaster Catalog (including our other decks of playing cards) can be purchased in the pledge manager to be shipped with you pledge.
If you are in the US or Canada and don't want to wait for the pledge, you can order all our games and merch available on our website - KeymasterGames.com.
Flat Rate Shipping: You will only be charged the applicable rate above no matter how much you order. So, find (or make) some friends that want to split the cost of shipping with you! Once the campaign is completed, you will be given the opportunity to add additional copies to your order without increasing the cost of shipping.
International VAT: We will be collecting VAT in the pledge manager and remitting it on your behalf. Your pledge will ship DDP (Delivery Duties Prepaid) to the US, Canada, EU, UK, Australia, and New Zealand. Those VAT rates are as follows: Canada 5%, Australia 10%, New Zealand 10%, United Kingdom 20%, EU 20% (we ship from France and pay at the French rate).
US Sales Tax: US residents, we will be collecting sales tax in the pledge manager for the following states: California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington

Alternate Shipping Options: Paying for shipping is a drag. We get it! If the shipping prices above give you pause, there are several other paths to getting your hands on the Mastermind Edition.
1) Join the Caper Facebook group or BGG Forums and organize a group pledge!
2) Reach out to a FRIENDLY LOCAL game store in your area to ask if they are joining the retailer pre-order. (See retailer information below.)
Keymaster is here to inspire you to explore life together. We think board games are a perfect avenue to create that joy and deep connection with each other, especially when they are beautiful and immersive experiences. Caper is particular is a chance to explore our quirky sides and share an engaging head to head game that should remind you of your favorite heist movie and quirky comedy all at once. We hope you love it!
Keymaster Games is a very small company. Until last year, we only had 1 full time employee. And with the success of PARKS, almost all of our capital is devoted to trying to catch up with it's demand. Without your help, we wouldn't be able to bring Caper back to market this year. Additionally, Kickstarter is an incredible way to engage with you and share our passion for this game! We love hearing from you in the comments section and providing you updates on how the game progresses through manufacturing and development.
We are so lucky to work with incredibly talented members of our community! Beyond the content creators featured in the preview section above, we want to especially thank the folks below.
Photos: Ross from More Games Please - Thanks for being a wonderful human and for taking incredible photos of the preview copy!
Video: Brian from Further Up and further In - Movie magic! Thanks for always knocking these videos out of the Colosseum!
Video voice-over: Paula from Things Get Dicey - The jokes on you - we get the better end of the deal when we get to work with you. 
Welcome to the heist, retailers! If you’re a store looking to carry Caper: Europe, you’re in the right spot. Keymaster offers retailers access to our Kickstarter games through preorders on our wholesale site.
If you do not already have an account on our wholesale site, apply here.
If you already have an account you’re all set!
We’ll communicate with retailers through our retail newsletter from there with how to place your order for copies of the game (including the Kickstarter Exclusive Version) to be delivered alongside Kickstarter fulfillment.
To qualify, you must have a brick and mortar presence and you must be in one of the approved shipping regions/countries listed on the shipping table.
Terms and Conditions:
Thanks for checking out our Campaign! The following is meant to set expectations as it relates to this project and Kickstarter's terms of use. It outlines what you can count on from us as a creator as well as some of your responsibilities as a backer.
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change.
You are responsible for confirming your pledge, address and other information required to ship your rewards to you in a timely manner. Until you confirm you pledge, we have no way of identifying which rewards you desire to receive or where you wish to receive them. If you do not confirm your rewards in the Pledge Manager within 6 weeks of the conclusion of the campaign, you agree that Keymaster will have fulfilled its obligations to you in full for payment received. We may, at our discretion, offer a refund or choose to ship your rewards if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 6 week window has elapsed.
We work with world class shipping partners, but they are only as good as the information they are provided. It is your responsibility to monitor the project's status and update your address as needed prior to fulfillment. The best way to monitor the project's status is to read our Kickstarter Updates. Should you provide an incorrect or out of date address, you will be responsible for costs incurred if a reshipment or reroute is need.
That said, even with world class partners and correct addresses, shipments are sometimes damaged or lost. If any part of your order, other than a game box, is damaged upon opening, we will provide free replacement parts for as long as we have them available.
If ever a shipment is not marked as delivered, we will cover the cost of reshipment. Additionally, we will cover the cost of 1 re-shipment for any lost or stolen package within 2 weeks of the package being marked as delivered and after our shipping partners conduct an investigation with the carrier.
Our Goal is for you to be the first in the world to play our games. As such, we will not sell and deliver Caper: Europe at any convention or on our webstore until we have delivered games to a majority of our Backers. Additionally, we will not release Caper: Europe to retail until 30 days after the majority of fulfillment in a given country is complete.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you are reading this, then you are seriously considering our project. Thank you! You can be confident that we will deliver an incredible experience based on our seven prior campaigns. All of the art is and graphic design is complete, the game has been playtested extensively, and we are ready to move to print shortly after the completion of the campaign. Barring acts of God, we will be able to hit our September fulfillment date.

Our biggest challenges are not specific to our operations, but rather the global political climate, specifically trade to and from China, Cornoavirus, and global economic recessions. We have contingencies to deal with each.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Keymaster endeavors to deliver you the highest quality products on the market to promote both your enjoyment and their longevity. You copy of Caper: Europe will be manufactured using:
- 2mm greyboard box
- Ivory core, linen finish cards
- High quality, resin or wood stolen goods (TBD)
- Game organizer for protection during storage
Environmentally friendly factories
A message from our manufacturer:

At Panda, we have a commitment not only to produce the best quality games in the industry, but to operate in a sustainable and ethical manner.

We believe in producing the highest quality games in the industry, so you, your friends, and your family can play them for years to come. We also believe in reducing the environmental impact of producing games. Some steps we’ve taken in that direction include using eco-friendly inks, glues, varnishes, and wraps, as well as sourcing wood from providers who use responsible forestry practices.

We also feel strongly about recycling. Our standard cardboard components are made from 30% recycled material, our shipping cartons are crafted from 100% recycled paper pulp, and we take great care to recycle all excess plastic and paper materials instead of simply discarding them.
 
We are committed to continuing the push toward more sustainable manufacturing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Background - 

This is the 1st game launched by TGG Games, but we are very familiar with the board game market. We have Kickstarted over 600 campaigns across all our accounts, supporting 517 different publishers. The publishing side has self funded and produced 6 titles in 2020, and we have 15 more in the queue. Some of our publishing partners include Steve Finn, Bruno Cathala, Ludovic Maublanc, Artem Safarov, Todd Sanders, and Awaken Realm Lite!

TGG Games has a strong understanding and knowledge of what is required for manufacturing and distributing games. We have a very good working relationship with our manufacturer as well as a strong understanding of international freight and delivery requirements. 

Art & Design -

This game has been played and tested by many, it is 100% ready. All of the artwork is 100% complete. Once we receive the funds from Kickstarter, we will immediately begin the manufacturing process of MOB: Big Apple with 0 delay of any kind!

Shipping -

Customer will have the option to pickup at any 'The Gaming Goat' retail location in the world for free! There will be an 'in store pickup' option located in the pledge manager. US and Canadian orders will be fulfilled by our Fulfillment partner D6, the rest of the world orders will be fulfilled by our fulfillment partner Surfing Meeple. Both companies are amazing at what they do!

Manufacturing -

We will be working with Whatz Games for manufacturing. We have been working with them on the manufacturing many of TGG-Games. They produce great quality products, stick to their timelines well, and have great communication. 

Refund Policy

A Full refund will be given to any request received within 14 days of the MOB: Big Apple Kickstarter campaign ending. After 14 days have passed, we will only refund 85% of the amount paid. This is due to Kickstarter and merchant provider fees. Once the fulfillment process of MOB: Big Apple has begun, no refunds will be given. If you have any issues with receiving your game after we have shipped them out, please email us at matthew@tgg-games.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello all!
We apologize for the wait on this update, we wanted to wait until we had clearer information to provide to everyone.

I am disappointed in myself to have to update you all that the fulfillment will be pushed back. MOB: Big Apple had a super successful campaign, so successful that it caught the attention of international publishers, as you all know.  We did as much as we could to prepare for our Kickstarter and thought we were fully ready to print once the campaign ended.  We did not however anticipate working with international publishers. I must admit this is my first time working with international publishers to localize a game, and it came with some unexpected difficulties. Communications have been made difficult due to extreme time zone difference between ourselves, partners, and the manufacturer. File translations and preparations due to revisions have taken quite a bit longer then I had expected as well, unfortunately. We also had to receive and have revisions done for the stretch goal components in the game as they were something we added mid campaign to bring more people to the campaign and add more to the game.

Hello everyone!
We wanted to take a minute to give you a quick update on MOB: Big Apple.
Surveys
We sent out the surveys from the pledge manager a couple of weeks ago, and since then the survey are at 87% completion! Thank you to everyone for such a quick response and action with your surveys.  If you have not filled out your survey, please do so when you are able. Here is also a link you can use as well to have your survey resent to you if need.

Hello everyone! 
I know we've said it several times, but thank you so much for your support throughout the MOB: Big Apple campaign. We appreciate it so much and are very excited to get to bring this awesome game to you all. There are a few things we wanted to mention.

Hello everyone! 
We wanted to quickly post just to say thank you!! It has been such an amazing campaign, we've said it before and we will say it again, we are blown away by the support we have received from the community. Thank you all so much, together we were able to unlock all of the Kickstarter Exclusive stretch goals, well deserved!

First, I'd like to apologize to your inbox, I'm sorry....  Okay, now to the update!

We just UNLOCKED ANOTHER KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE STRETCH GOAL!! All Kickstarter backers will receive miniature crates that have a wash finish on them! 
We are absolutely flying through these stretch goals, it's so awesome! Thank you to the all the new backers as well as the continued support of previous backers.

Hello and wow! 
This campaign has flown by! We have seen an amazing amount of support in the last few days and are excited to be entering the final 2 days with so much support! We honestly believe we will unlock that hidden 35k stretch goal by the time the campaign ends.

Stretch Goal Unlocked!

Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal Unlocked!
We are excited to announce, (which we are sure most of you probably already know) we have unlocked the 2 Cardboard Meeple Holders, or Henchmen Warehouses as we call them. We have seen a tremendous amount of support since yesterdays update, thank you for making this Kickstarter exclusive stretch goal possible!

Hello everyone!
We wanted to take a minute to post about some exciting updates for MOB: Big Apple.
International Publisher
We have signed an international publishing deal with Bumble3ee in Spain. They will have a fully translated Spanish version of the game. When the campaign ends, you will be able to choose if you'd like the English version or the Spanish version of the game in the pledge manager. The Spanish version will be fulfilled by Bumble3ee and the English version will continue to be fulfilled by the fulfillment partners we have teamed up with, D6 and Surfin' Meeple.

Hey everyone!
Stretch Goals
You spoke, we listened! We’ve been coming up with ways to make the game even MORE Deluxe than it already is, so we can provide everyone exciting stretch goals and Kickstarter exclusives! Here is what we have been hard at work on after crunching some numbers.

Click here to play on Tabletop Simulator (TTS). You can go to our Discord channel to find scheduled events and ask questions!
For this campaign we will be releasing new Myth cards and other surprises on a regular basis and may also have funding goal stretch goals as well.
Cost:  Shipping is really expensive (almost as much as making the actual game) and we have tried to come up with pricing that accurately reflects our cost to get the game into your hands without creating a logistical nightmare on our side.  Your shipping will be added in the pledge manager.  We expect that we'll have to come out of pocket a bit based on what we are charging and we are ok with that.
Tracking: We will also be using non-trackable shipments in some cases in order to save on cost as tracking can add 30-50% or more in some cases. So please understand if we do not have tracking with your package we did so knowingly. Rest assured, that we will get you your game and any risk associated with a package not being trackable is on us.
Delivery time: While we would love to get everyone their games at the same time, it is just not possible. There is a high likelihood that some areas of the world will get their games before others. Our commitment is to get the games ready and printed as fast as possible (we've already done a ton of the prep work).
At the factory we will break out the shipments to each fulfillment company with instructions to them that they should begin shipping as soon as possible upon receipt. In addition, because we have complete control over the U.S. shipments, you will not be able to order and receive the game on Amazon (or from any other US retailer) before our backers have it.
Please note: Because of unexpected delays and other unforseen issues, we reserve the right to sell the game at major conventions, even if they have not been delivered yet.  The reason for this is that conventions are among the best form of marketing and therefore necessary to give the game the best chance for success.
One guarantee we will give is that if we do release the KS exclusive version anywhere before the backers receive theirs it will be at a price that is higher (usually significantly) than what was offered in the campaign.

Risks and challenges
As a publisher that has brought more than 20 games to market thus far, we feel confident in our ability to get this done. The gameplay for this game is 95% complete. The art and graphics are well underway. We are confident that we will hit our release goals with no problems (shipping delays or Acts of God notwithstanding). In addition, our intention is to not release this game to standard retail until all U.S backers orders have been shipped. Our goal is to have it in our backer's hands 2-4 weeks before someone can buy it on Amazon.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of our games are made with longevity in mind. We use high-quality components for all of our pieces. Short of losing pieces (which we typically replace for only shipping costs), our games should last you for decades to come.
Sustainable Distribution
All of our fulfillment and logistics are arranged to limit the number of miles/stops each game travels. It's not only better for the world, but it also makes business sense. Based on our previous campaigns, less than 5% of our games come all the way to our warehouse in the US before being shipped back out to other parts of the world.

campaign.story:
Mailing List
Prison Architect BGG Page

“The dice drafting works fantastically. This is my favorite game play mechanism of all time. The truly wonderful thing is all the positive interaction with your opponents that creates really interesting interplay over the board with other players.” - Rahdo
“Rome & Roll is a fantastic game, always a beautiful, thoughtful puzzle though it is easy to get your head around. Now Gladiators adds more variety: more buildings, more Gods, a new territory, but the big new things are the public advisors, the Colosseum where you assign gladiators, and even more added to the solo mode!” -  Tom Heath, Slickerdrips
Kovray Studios - "The expansion does a splendid job of really enriching the Rome & Roll experience, the mechanism of the coliseum battles is clever and fits so well thematically. The expansion doesn't just add another element to the game but instead integrates in every aspect of the game, uplifting the entire experience."
Two Moms Game“The Gladiators expansion is a must for fans of Rome & Roll or anyone who likes dice drafting strategy games. The base game is fun, the expansion takes it to the next level with a full refresh and completely new mechanisms.”

Long Distance Gamers Written Review
Brooks: "The most beautiful thing about Rome & Roll is that you’re not punished for your play-style. You can be an aggressor that devotes resources to conquering the outlying territories, you can live your best merchant life amassing a fortune of points, or you can reconstruct the city creating synergistic, point-spewing neighborhoods."
  Kitty: "Gladiators is a perfectly thematic addition to an already meaty and marvelous game! Something fantastic about Rome & Roll, as well as Gladiators, is that everything feels so purposeful."
Check out Steph's review on BGG
Steph Hodge, All the Meeples of the Rainbow - "Super thinky game. You really have to plan out what you will want to try and draft. So much to do and so little time. Be prepared for a lengthy game with tons of choices. The expansion is nice and I would recommend it to those who already enjoy the game!" Read Steph's Full Review.
Not Bored Gaming's Mark Dainty - “If you thought that Rome & Roll was good then I’m here to tell you that the upcoming Gladiators expansion is some next level shizzle!! I just got my butt kicked by Seneca as the crazy Naughts and Crosses (but not really - as you can place both O’s and X’s) takes the strategy required in a whole new direction. It’s a whole lot of fun.”
Episode Coming This Weekend!
Dereck from SoloBGPodcast - “The most strategic , challenging and fun solo mode that I have ever experienced in a roll and write game, the theme and the designers is a guarantee for this one”

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PSC Games is a seasoned board game publisher, with 17 successful Kickstarter campaigns under our belt. Rome & Roll: Gladiators is our 18th Kickstarter campaign.

Unexpected delays may affect any production schedule. In our case, these would most likely be associated with shipping, manufacturing, or customs processes. Should any delays occur, we will endeavour to keep our backers up to date every step of the way.

Please keep in mind that the shipping date shown in our Kickstarter campaign is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in some regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Please note that our game's stretch goals and the final design may differ from those shown in our campaign – sometimes we need to make technical changes as we go to improve our designs or find a better way to do things.

Items offered as an exclusive are produced for Kickstarter backers and remaining stock will be available at conventions and through our website at our discretion (not at retail).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Click to late pledge for Tiny Epic Dungeons!
All images, components, game mechanics, add-ons etc. shown of the game are subject to change per manufacturer's requirements and/or the publisher's preference for what is in the best interest of the game and the backers.
Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge: 
This image is updated with unlocked stretch goals.
28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players! 
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Stories expansion is available in the 'Gameplay All-In' reward tier or as an add-on in CrowdOx after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Stronghold Games' previous success and the assistance and guidance of the experts we are working with will enable us to deliver this project on time. We have every confidence that Ares Expedition will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS
We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS
If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY
Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update - Thousands of packages on their way to you, 2nd containers are arriving soon.
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!

As you may have seen, shipping has started in the US & EU and some packages have already arrived in both regions. Packages are being assembled in Asia, and shipments from the US to Canada, and EU to UK fulfilment centers have started their journey.

However, before we go over those shipping details, we want to acknowledge that we hear your feedback. This community has made it clear that we misstepped in the way we conveyed the information about the Target release and our inability to get your games out before then.  We should have made this known earlier, but we didn’t.

Tomorrow (Sunday), Target will launch an exclusive edition of Ares Expedition across all their US stores. This is an exciting moment for us as a company even as it is disappointing that we weren’t able to get backer rewards out before Target’s June 20th release date, that were unable to modify once agreed upon. Our original production and shipping dates gave us time to get backers rewards out before this date. Unfortunately we weren’t able to predict the significant supply chain and production issues related to COVID restrictions around the world. We apologize that we weren’t able to hit our original planned dates that would have had most of you playing your copies by now.

Good news terraformers! Our first containers are through customs and your games will arrive later this week in the US and EU fulfilment centers. Once those arrive, we will forward the first set of games to the UK and Canadian fulfilment centers.  Games for Asia, Australia and rest of the world have already arrived and packing them for the regional hubs has already begun.

We will start sending games to you just as soon as they arrive at your fulfilment center.  Keep in mind that this will be a rolling fulfillment and second containers for each region have been delayed by a couple of weeks and are currently three weeks behind the first containers. That means it will be at least six weeks from when the first shipping notice goes out before the last does, and that shipping will start in the US and EU before UK & Canada by at least two weeks given intrar-egion current transit times.  Rolling fulfillment will get games to everyone faster, but it will be a source of frustration for some.  We apologize in advance if your order is later than the others.

updates.update_userinfo: Closing in on Fulfillment! Locking addresses on June 4th!
updates.update_content:
Expeditioners, we’ve been hard at work tying up some logistics and shipping issues and the good news is that  we’re nearing the final step of this campaign. There are still a few hurdles between now and you getting your games but we’re way ahead of our original projection of shipping in September.

So the short update is that your copies of Ares Expedition are now on ships heading to the fulfillment centers!  While that is well ahead of our original schedule, this actually is a couple of weeks later than we were expecting. Over the last few weeks there have been significant delays. The first delay was some minor retooling of the dual-layer player boards, to tighten up the spaces that a few eagle eyed backers noticed in our update photos.  This will make the player mats more usable, but it did add a few weeks to our production time. We wanted to make sure these were high quality, and that meant making some changes so this delay was the right call.

Expeditionists,
I come bearing good news! Printing is progressing well and we are ahead of schedule.  This might not be the most exciting update as the production process churns along, however, we did want to take a moment to show you the production sample of the sleeves in action.  They came out great!

campaign.story:
Garphill Games, in association with our international partners are proud to bring you City of Crowns, and the Collector's Box for Paladins of the West Kingdom.
Kickstarter or retail? City of Crowns and the Collector's Box will be coming to retail in various languages. There are no exclusive items in this Kickstarter campaign. If you'd prefer to wait for the items to become available in retail, we are 100% okay with that. Please just choose whichever option works best for you.
In Paladins of the West Kingdom: City of Crowns, noble allies have responded to the recent attacks against our borders. Only through careful negotiation and diplomacy will these dukes, barons, counts and margraves offer the aid we so desperately need. Will you be able to muster enough support to once again defend this great city, or will you crumble beneath the weight of indecision and apathy?
Key Changes:
Board extensions for each player, providing a way to take the new Muster and Negotiate actions
Board extensions at either end of the Main Board, housing the new Muster and Negotiate cards, plus revealing more Townsfolk and Outsiders each round
Each player has a new Diplomacy attribute to manage
New Townsfolk, Outsiders, Paladins, King's Orders and King's Favours
Updated rules for solo play, with an added difficulty level
Components
This deluxe Collector's Box is designed to fit Paladins, City of Crowns, and all additional content, such as promos and metal coins. And yes, it fits sleeved cards. See the photos below. All boards sit together over the wooden components and smaller cards, keeping everything in its place. The box is the same size as the Collector's Box for Raiders of the North Sea (295x295x69mm).
The Vassals Mini-Expansion
Included inside every copy of the Collector's Box is a mini expansion, which adds new yellow workers to the game. These new Yellow Workers can be placed onto any Worker spot, regardless of its required colour. In addition to this, they also discount actions where they’re placed by either 1 Silver or 1 Provision.
For those not interested in getting the Collector's Box, we should have a small amount of the Vassals Mini-Expansion available in our Promo Store later in the year. It is not available separately for this Kickstarter campaign.


Preview from Meeple University

Then simply add the cost of any extra items to your pledge level. This will need to be done during the campaign, as there will not be a pledge manager. All pledges are in NZD. There are no additional shipping costs for add-on items.
You cannot have multiple languages as part of the same pledge.
Two weeks after the campaign ends, we will send out surveys where you will have the chance to confirm what add-ons you included in your pledge.
Each copy of Architects will include the 2018 KS Promos (excluding the tax stand), provided in a separate bag.
Each copy of Paladins will include the 2019 KS Promos inside the box (in a separate bag of French/Portuguese).
Each copy of Tomesaga will include the 2020 KS Promos inside the box.
Groups:  Over the past 7 years we have always looked to improve how we handle larger group pledges. We want to offer the best prices, while keeping everything running smoothly for fulfillment. Therefore, we have set a lower price for all add-on items, regardless of the total quantity. There are no extra shipping fees for add-ons. There will not be any further discounts beyond this.

Retailers: We will not be taking orders for retailers in this campaign. We recommend going through normal distribution channels. If this is not possible for your store, feel free to contact us after the campaign has ended for a price list.
All shipping rates are automatically added as you select your Reward Level.
Garphill Games will handle production and fulfillment of all English versions.
Pixie Games will handle production and fulfillment of all French versions. The French edition is only available in France, Belgium, Luxembourg and Switzerland.
Mosaico Jogos will handle production and fulfillment of all Portuguese versions. The Portuguese edition is only available in Brazil and Portugal. All Portuguese copies will be sent using a tax-friendly shipping option.
Other Languages
Other language versions will also be produced on a similar schedule, but are not available through this Kickstarter campaign. This includes German, Italian, Spanish, Polish, Hungarian, Czech, Dutch, Chinese, Thai, Japanese, and more. If you would prefer one of these languages, you will need to wait for the retail release in your country.

No Stretch Goals?
For this Kickstarter we have decided not to offer any stretch goals. Instead, all components will be upgraded from day one! Linen finish, black core cards, premium wooden tokens, thicker box, solo mode, etc, etc. On top of that, we have also heavily reduced the cost of all add-on items.

campaign.story:
Center Cam- A new way to video-conference!
   The transition to remote work and online video-conferencing has led to a problem: Where do I focus? At the webcam on the edge of my screen? Or at the people/notes on the screen, which makes me look like I'm looking down to anyone in the meeting? But most importantly, when you look AWAY from the people in your meeting, you can't see the other 90% of human communication which comes from  the NON-verbal!

 Center Cam changes the angle of your webcam, from the periphery of the screen, to the middle of the screen where the action is. Center Cam allows you to look at the people you're talking to and have them FEEL like you're looking at them- BECAUSE YOU ARE!

(UPDATE - WE'VE HIT OUR TARGET! IN 24 HOURS!
STRETCH GOALS ARE NOW LISTED BELOW!)

Our second ever Kickstarter, to make a new, wonderful album for 2021!!
Hello dear friends, fans and family,

Two years ago we asked for your help to support us making a new album, "Jonny & The Baptists Love You & Hate Bastards". And you were brilliant. We raised £5380; made an album we're immensely proud of, and we able to pay everyone who worked on it a fair wage. We were able to pay for the producer, the engineers, all the equipment we needed to hire and the production work; and then the costs of pressing the CDs and their cases to a very high-quality. Thank you for this: you guys rock.

Well, we're ready to make another album and we're asking for your help again. As you may know, we have always avoided getting a recording deal that would almost certainly demand a higher-percentage of our frugal earnings and, worse, limit our freedom to write and perform whatever we want. And, in this climate of no gigs and almost no income for us two, there's no way we could afford to pay costs and fees upfront and wait to recoup from sales in the autumn. 

So - if you can help in any way, we'd be honoured. If you think you'd like to buy our album anyway, then please do so upfront and in so doing you'll also be a part of making it happen. And if you're feeling OK for money why not get a souvenir too - a lyric sheet and photo from the album recording, all signed and framed. A personal hand-written thank you card to accompany your new CD? Or maybe have your name in the album liner notes forever - or even get your very own zoom preview in April or May (where we'll do the new show for you, and any three songs from our back catalogue as the encore).

If you can't afford to help we still love you very much, and we understand how hard it is right now (hence why we're doing this again!). 

With all our love,
Jonny & Paddy 
(Jonny & the Baptists)
x x x x x x x x x x x x 

 UPDATE: Woah, Nelly! (I think a. still a phrase and b. I also think it means what I think it means)
STRETCH GOALS.
As of right now, we are on £9814 which is truly wonderful. Thank you all so much, from the bottom of our hearts. It's overwhelmingly kind and we're smiley and will keep doing our best to make this all super rewarding and joyful for everyone involved (especially all of you lovely lot).
We've had a bit of time to run the numbers and work out some more official budgets for proper stretch goals, make a few more reward tiers and fine tune how all this is going to work in a beautiful way. Here we go!
 STRETCH GOAL ONE - £5000 - HIT!
Instruments, Equipment & Fees
This stretch goal has already been met, and has given us the ability to repair our instruments and get the gear together to record the album to higher standard (not to mention it'll help us be brilliantly equipped to also tour the show with these instruments). It also covers the Kickstarter commission fee which we MAY OR MAY NOT WHO IS TO SAY initially not taken into account. THIS IS NOW SORTED HOORAY AND THANK CHRIST!
 STRETCH GOAL TWO - £6500 - NO PROBLEM MATE!
Pay Paddy (blonde one, tall, wonky charm)
This stretch goals ain't far off, and (this is going to initially sound really silly but bear with us) gives us the ability to PAY PADDY. In the costing of the album we decided not to include paying ourselves as we know money is tight for everyone and we just wanted to make something uplifting without putting too much pressure on whether or not our time and work was budgeted for. This still makes total sense to us, however getting paid would make a huge difference to our lives and help with things like rent, bills, food, and self-esteem. The next stretch goal after this is Pay Jonny, but we're obviously going to split whatever we get to down the middle as we do that with everything. It felt odd writing this slightly personal money bit but hey we would rather be honest with you.
STRETCH GOAL THREE - £8000 - DONEZO!
Pay Jonny (big beard, stout, youthful curmudgeon)
Much like the last goal, this goal allows us to PAY JONNY. I said it before but just to say it again, we will split this between us but anything towards our day-to-day costs of trying to make a record whilst the world (and the rather large prices therein) continues to spin around us would make a huge difference to our fears, concerns and money deadlines during the actual making of the album. We might even get to tick the box marked 'actually paid work' this year - who knows!
 STRETCH GOAL FOUR - £9000 - SORTED MATE.
Professional Mastering & an Extra Track on the Album
This one's obviously a bit of a pipe dream, but usually the two of us and Rob have stabbed our way through mastering with no real idea of what we're doing, and each time we always get to six months after release and say "Hey wouldn't it have been cool if this was professionally mastered? Oh well" and in a magical idealistic world this could actually be possible this time. It would sound killer, and make us feel like real big time music boys. As a big thank you we'd even use the remaining money to book in extra studio time to record an extra track for the album. Wouldn't that be rad?
STRETCH GOAL FIVE - £10000 - WE CAN ACTUALLY DO IT.
Professional Music Video for the Lead Single & an Extra Track on the Album
Now this would clearly be a wild amount of money to be donated, but we think it's possible so here goes. If we hit 'the big 10 Kay-bos' (correct?) then we could make an actual professional music video that has things like a budget, a director and a camera person who isn't a phone balanced precariously on a brimmed hat. We'd love to do something like this to release online and promote the album and the tour, and if you help us make it a reality we promise we'll put our all into making it excellent. We'll even try once again to throw ANOTHER extra track on the record as a double thank you.
THERE'S ALWAYS ROOM FOR MORE!
I'm going to stop writing now as these are numbers I feel uncomfortable imagining being able to wield in my actual hands in the name of creating something, but we have big plans and big ideas and if there's ever a world in which I need to write new stretch goals then I'm ready for it. I'll even eat my hat*.
Watch this space.
We love you all, thank you. Let's do this.
P&J XX
*Actually I will not do that as I love my hat very very dearly and we haven't budgeted for another hat.
True Love. Photo by Steve Best.

There aren't too many risks involved here. This is going to be our eighth album of new songs, so we've got a pretty good track record. Plus we start the tour in June 2021, so if the album isn't done by then we'll probably be killed by our agent! 

We know what we're writing about and have plenty of time to finish. Plus we're working alongside long-term collaborator Rob Sell, who will oversee production on the album - a job he did for our last five albums "The Satiric Verses", "The End Is Nigh', "Eat the Poor", "Songs for the Apocalypse" & "Jonny & the Baptists Love You and Hate Bastards". All in, it's pretty certain we'll be all finished by the June 2021 deadline!

campaign.story:
CoraQuest began life on a particularly boring lockdown afternoon. Cora, my eight-year-old daughter, and I both agreed that we were fed up of doing the same old maths worksheets. We decided we wanted to do something more exciting with our time instead - like design our own board game!  
Cora and I spent many enjoyable days working side by side on our game. Cora was having so much fun she never noticed me sneaking school work like maths, creative writing, art and computing into the project (shhh, don't tell her). As CoraQuest developed we both felt so pleased with it that we wanted to share it with other people too.
While it started as a homemade project, CoraQuest has had massive amounts of support from a whole legion of playtesters. Although its roots are still true to the game Cora and I made together on our kitchen table, our playtesters have helped us develop CoraQuest from its rough and ready origins to a smooth-running, polished, and above all very fun game.
There's enough content in the CoraQuest box to keep you going for a very very long time. However, Cora and I had so much fun with the creative process of making the game that we wanted to provide the same exciting experience to others too. 


The rulebook for CoraQuest includes guidance and encouragement on how to create and draw your own heroes, characters and adventures - making the game fully customisable.  
What's more, we've even made a fantastic free web-based app that you can use to create your own heroes and print them out on "official" cards and matching standees. Just draw and upload your picture, choose your hero's stats and special abilities, and then print them out - it's as easy as that!
CoraQuest is designed to be as accessible to children as possible without diluting any of the fun for adults. Here are three of the key features of the game:
You explore the dungeon by drawing cards from the dungeon deck and placing each card out into the layout.  This means every game you play will have its own unique dungeon map - providing a different experience each time. 
Whenever you venture into the dungeon there is a chance you will encounter some of the fearsome creatures that lurk there. Orcs, goblins and gremlins emerge from the shadows whenever a card with their symbol is added to the dungeon.  
Whimsical and family-friendly narrative emerges during the game via the "quest cards" that are spaced out within the dungeon deck.  When a quest card is placed in the dungeon you read a short passage from the quest book and carry out any special instructions it gives you.   
The quest cards' illustrations include multiple elements that are open to interpretation, allowing you to use them as inspiration to design your own adventures.
Combat is exciting, fun, and simple for even young children to understand. It's resolved using custom red and white dice. Your hero card and your weapon tell you what colour dice you need to roll, then you inflict one damage to your target for each success you get.  
If you're in combat and you completely miss your target your hero flips over to their "determined" side. This means you will get even more dice to roll for your next attack. This helps take the sting out of rolling badly for younger children (and for adults too).
The countdown track adds another level of decision making and tactical thinking to the game.

Each hero has a special ability that is activated by putting a token on the countdown track. At the end of each round the tokens will move down one space on the track. You're unable to use your special ability again until your token has moved off the bottom of the track and has come back to you, so you need to think very carefully about when is the best time to use it. 
The countdown track also has a second use - to add the threat of a spider attack! 
This mechanism has received some of the highest praise from our playtesters, as it creates tension and ensures the game moves along at an exciting pace.
Each time you complete a round without having explored further into the dungeon, the "threat token" moves down one space on the countdown track. If it ever moves off the bottom of the track then a swarm of spiders appear in the dungeon and start attacking the heroes. The ever-present threat of being swarmed by spiders really moves the action along! 
Sharing creativity and fun is at the very heart of CoraQuest, and that is why we not only encourage you to make your own content for the game, but we also encourage you to share it with others too! 

We have a special section on our website where we host community-created adventures, heroes and enemies that people can download and use for free. We already have lots of things on there. For example, acclaimed board game designer Jerry Hawthorne (Mice and Mystics, Stuffed Fables) stumbled across the print and play version of CoraQuest and liked the idea so much that he sent us this awesome band of brave rodent adventurers that he designed and drew.
Jerry's characters will not be included in the CoraQuest box, but they can be downloaded to print and play from the CoraQuest website.

Jerry isn't the only one who has sent in their work for us to share on the website though! Look at these fantastic adventurers from six-year-old Enydd Chadwick.
Be aware that these are the prototype versions of the game. They do not feature the finished artwork and there may also be some small changes made to the rules before final production.
Why should I back CoraQuest on Kickstarter?
If CoraQuest doesn't get funded on Kickstarter it won't ever be made. This is very much a passion project for all involved and we do not have the resources to make and distribute the game without your support.
Will CoraQuest be available at retail?
We don't have any plans at this time to put CoraQuest into retail distribution, however if the opportunity arises we would consider it.  
If the Kickstarter doesn't reach its target will I still be charged?
No. You will only be charged if we reach our target.
When will I get my game?
We are aiming to deliver the game in late November 2021. We will keep all the backers regularly updated on each stage of the process until everyone gets their games.
How long after the campaign ends will you be charging for postage? 
We will be sending out an email via our pledge manager (Gamefound) around two to three months after the campaign has ended. This is so we can minimise the risk of us charging either too much or too little for postage, as the rates for this can fluctuate.
Will I have to pay customs charges or tax on my game?
We will absorb the costs of customs charges and taxes (including VAT) for games delivered to the US, Canada, UK, Australia, New Zealand and the EU so you should not have to pay any additional fees in these areas. Other regions may have additional customs charges as per local regulations.
How thick are the Dungeon Cards?
The Dungeon Cards are made out of 310gsm card (the same material that high quality playing cards are made out of).  We have found in our playtesting that using cards as opposed to “tiles” makes very little difference to the game, and it also enables us to keep manufacturing and shipping costs as low as possible as they are both cheaper and less heavy - allowing us to pass those savings onto the backers.
Shipping for CoraQuest will be charged after the campaign has ended in order to minimise any fluctuations in the cost of this between the campaign close and the date of delivery.
These are the current estimated charges based on quotes provided to us by our shipping partners. However these may be subject to change due to unforeseen international events or changes in law between now (February 1st, 2021) and the time of shipping.
*There are a number of countries that we are unfortunately unable to deliver to. We apologise if our shipping restrictions disappoint anyone. We have limited resources to deal with shipping issues and do not wish to make commitments we are unable to keep. 
We are also unable to ship to PO Boxes. 
The countries we can not ship to are:
South America: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Paraguay, Peru, Suriname, Uruguay, Venezuela, Falkland Islands, French Guiana, South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands, Trinidad & Tobago

 Shipping 
To see shipping costs to your country, please click on the pledge level you are interested in. Shipping is charged during the campaign.

Shipping to Asia and Oceania
Because we print in Europe, it is significantly more expensive for us to ship to Asia and Oceania than for other countries. Due to rising costs this year, we have had to significantly increase shipping costs to Asia and Oceania. These costs represent the current reality of shipping to these regions for us.

Made in the European Union
We are happy to support our local economies by printing our products in the European Union. 

How to Play Metro
Every Player is the owner of a metro line company and has the same number of wagons for the game. You want your wagons to travel as long a distance as possible, because you receive victory points for every section of a track tile they pass. But be careful! Because the common rail network is built by all players in turn, your fellow players could also try to let your metro line run into a destination station on as short a route is possible.

At the start of the, a frame is placed around the board to indicate where each player's metro line starts. In the center of the board is a central station, and metro lines can terminate here or at the end of the map. 

Each tile in Metro shows metro lines going in different directions. On their turn, a player will either place the tile they have in their hand, or they may draw a tile and must place this one. Tiles may not be rotated, and must be placed adjacent to a previously placed tile. 

As soon as a Metro line has connected to an edge station or the central station, a scoring takes place. The owner of that line gains 1 victory point for every tile track it passes. If it passes multiple sections of the same track tile, it generates 1 victory point for each of those sections per track tile. If the line terminates in the central station, the points for that line is double

The game ends when the tracks of all players are completed which will be at the latest after the last tile is placed. The player with the most points is the winner.

For more information go to see the game page on Board Game Geek


Production and Delivery
The production of Metro - The City Edition and the Deluxe Big Box is planned for Q3  2021. Our games are printed in Europe, so there is little delay between the end of printing and them arriving for fulfillment in our warehouse. Pledges to the US will most likely be sent via container to a fulfillment center. Please note that all shipping projections are our best estimates only, and not guarantees.
We offer "friendly" shipping to a number of zones around the world, including the United States, Canada, and the European Union. If your country is not listed as "friendly," Queen Games is not responsible for any local charges, customs fees, or if a local carrier (i.e. not the carrier we shipped by) loses your package. In these cases, we are not able to reimburse you for any charges.
Post Campaign Communication
We will monitor the comment section and messages while the campaign is active in order to answer everyone's questions. Please note that, since we do not have a full time employee dedicated to Kickstarter alone, we may not be able to actively monitor the comments after the campaign closes. If you have a question about your pledge, please send us a message.
We will do our best to post all pertinent information in a timely manner either as an update or in emails to relevant backers.
Terms and Conditions
By pledging for this product, you are accepting the following terms.
REFUND POLICY Following the terms of Kickstarter, Queen Games will provide a full refund provided the request is received within 14 days of the close of the campaign.If a request is made after this period, any refund would be at the discretion of Queen Games, and would be a maximum of 90% based on incurred fees and handling costs. This policy applies to add ons in the pledge manager as well.
DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.
RETURNED PRODUCTS If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.
FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY We will send a survey out to backers to collect addresses. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.
REASONABLE CHANGES TO PRODUCT By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the name, final look, and materials of the project are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter campaign was active. Queen Games will make all reasonable efforts to make the final product congruent with what is presented in the campaign, and to inform backers of the reasons for necessary changes.

campaign.story:
Covid Deniers is a party game that puts you at the center of the fight against fake news and conspiracy theories about the coronavirus. Become a Good Citizen and defend the public order of your village – or destroy it with cruel lies and accusations!
Covid Deniers offers an exciting political spin to award winning games like Werewolf or Mafia. Intense debates, dramatic tension and fun for you and your friends are guaranteed.
Covid Deniers is designed and illustrated by Pasqual Schillberg (Akademie der Bildenden Künste Stuttgart). Video by Kolja Haaf (Filmmaker and Journalist, Süddeutsche Zeitung). Voice by Azeret Koua (Theater Dortmund).
Infections are spiking out of control, your village is in chaos. The Good Citizens are all worried and follow the government's instructions. Only some Deniers don't believe in the pandemic at all. They keep their infection a secret and try to stay undercover.
To start playing Covid Deniers, every player draws a secret role card. The game begins at night. All players are asleep. Only the Deniers are free to open their eyes. Now it‘s time for conspiracy. Each night, they can put one Good Citizen into quarantine. One round at night is followed a daytime round.
At daytime, the Good Citizens try to find out who among them is a Covid Denier. Within an open group discussion, they decide on one player to be tested for his or her true identity. In the end, either the Good Citizens keep their majority in the group — or the Deniers take over.
Additional roles, such as the Superspreader or the Virologist, come with special abilities and turn Covid Deniers into a viral experience! Our full guide including all rules can be found here.
The final game will include additional characters. Beyond that, we have many ideas for even more roles (e.g. "Q", "Hypochondriac", "The Donald") and hope to realize them with your support. Please also feel free to share your own ideas about exciting characters - we might add them during the campaign! 
Covid Deniers is influenced by social deduction games like Werewolf or Mafia. However, it is much more than that:
Beyond being an outrageously thrilling game, Covid Deniers seeks to be an immersive experience of contemporary politics at heart. You and your friends take part in what is actually happening out there: A fight about truth and trust that trickles down to individual groups of our society.
   Box items such as the branded masks, wipes and the inch ruler add a unique atmosphere to the game. They also serve a real function throughout the game and contribute to the storytelling power of the players. For details, see our “How does it work” section.
  While the basic rules are easy to comprehend for beginners, the various special roles add complexity and depth to the game. Each of the special roles like the Superspreader, the Tester or the Virologist, represent different stakeholders of the pandemic's universe. In the end, we tried to create a well-balanced system of complexity and fun that unites the best aspects of different social deduction games we love.
Covid Deniers is made for unique and very individual gameplay experiences. You can play it over and over again - tension and fun are guaranteed!
We will start the production of the game immediately after the campaign. We plan to ship the final product (box + playing cards) starting February/ March 2021. We don't seek to earn a single buck by shipping the cards and the box. Instead, we will offer the delivery as cheap as possible. We did some research and attached the probable costs. We are confident we can lower these numbers.

We have a finished prototype and an agreement with our manufacturer for all details of the product. This allows our team to start producing the game right after the campaign. Despite the difficult situation surrounding the coronavirus we are very confident to deliver the game to you in time. If anything unexpected pops up we will be 100% transparent. We will communicate on a constant basis and work around the clock to offer you the best product possible.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
All items such as the inch ruler, wipes, masks and brooch are designed to be kept independently of the actual game play.
Sustainable materials
All cards in our prototype video were produced using risograph printing. This is one of the most environmentally friendly printing processes available. For instance, the ink is soybean oil-based, and the master foils are made from hemp fibers. In addition, risography only requires a fraction of the energy of a common digital press. 

We will do our best to maintain this high standard and use the most sustainable and environmentally friendly materials in the batch production.

Microblade Pill becomes incredibly useful just when needed.
As you receive a parcel you start looking for a knife or some other sharp object you could use to open the box. Often it just takes too much effort. With MICROBLADE PILL™ you can forget about spending your time searching for the blade.
You bought something and there is no way to open the plastic clamshell packaging?
Microblade Pill got it!
 With this amazing little tool, you can easily cut paper, remove stickers, strip wires, cut strings, and much more.
Titanium Grade5 features exceptional strength and excellent corrosion resistance and very high strength to weight ratio.
 All pills are CNC machined from solid titanium bars.
All the smallest details have been improved compared to the previous pill to achieve the best possible cap locking and best possible cutting experience.
Refined cutting edge for smoother cutting performance.
We don't want to bulk up your pockets. Microblade Pill Ti is so small and light you can barely feel it in your pocket. In our busy lifestyle convenience is everything. Take it with you wherever you go.

We designed MICROBLADE PILL™ combined with a super-fast attaching/detaching carabiner ring to ease your everyday carry. The carabiner ring also gives you a good, secure grip when using the blade and enables full control of the edge positioning.

2021年春、同時に３つの新作を出したい！
オインクゲームズは、2010年に代表の佐々木隼が立ち上げ、これまでに30作以上のボードゲームを発表してきました。シンプルで奥深いルールと、小さなパッケージに詰まった美しいデザインが特徴の、日本発のボードゲームブランドです。

Product Design
Aesthetics are important to us, but usability is paramount.   All of the designs shown on this page and all updates and marketing are not finalized.  Content is subject to change before delivery to meet engineering, usability, and game balance, and manufacturing requirements.  All 3D renderings on this campaign page are conceptual representations and components may not be to exact scale or finish.
Pledge Manager
We will be using a pledge management platform after the campaign.  This will allow you to manage your pledge and pay your shipping fees.
Currency Conversion
All USD pricing conversions were done against the current market value on January 26, 2020 ($1.00 CAD = $0.79 USD). Exchange rates constantly change. As we are unable to change the reward descriptions, we advise you to look at the current exchange rate toward the end of the campaign for a more accurate USD price. Remember that your pledge is in Canadian Dollars, and your card will be billed in Canadian Dollars when the campaign ends.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our experienced team members have been involved in the manufacturing phase of many board games including the Dice Throne Franchise, Santorini, Brass: Birmingham & Lancashire, Iron Clays, and Steampunk Rally.

We currently have Steampunk Rally Fusion on its way to backers.

Our threshold for quality is extremely high and our regimented artists hit deadlines with the timing of a Swiss watch. Members of our pre-press team have worked in the print industry for nearly 20 years and are able to work smoothly and efficiently with manufacturers. All art and development is completed and barring any unforeseen hurdles, we will begin manufacturing immediately after the campaign ends.

All this said, it is possible that there may be delays. This is the nature of manufacturing complex and innovative products. In our case, possible delays may be associated with shipping, customs, and manufacturing. The biggest unknown at this point is delays related to COVID-19. During the pandemic we have experienced several delays in manufacturing and freight. That said, we are working with a new manufacturer for this game (who also manufactures for Awaken Realms) and have a strong belief that they will deliver according to our timeline.

We have a strong belief in sticking to deadlines, and an even greater belief in transparency. We will therefore ensure that you are informed with our progress and challenges every step of the way.

Thank you for believing in us.
