campaign.story:
The tile-matching hit from 2018 is now back with a revised rulebook and a new expansion, Finesse!
In this Kickstarter, you can pledge for a copy of the second printing of Project L, including a new revised rulebook, a new Finesse expansion, as well as the content from the original Kickstarter campaign.
Project L is a fast-paced engine building strategy game for 1-5 players. This perfect family game is packed with choices that will keep your brain running at full steam.
The core of the game lies in completing puzzles with pieces. Completed puzzles give you points as well as extra pieces to use. The more pieces you have, the more difficult (and valuable!) puzzles you may try to complete.
You start the game with just two little pieces, and on your turn, you can do three actions (you may do the same action repeatedly):
Take a new puzzle
Get a new small piece or upgrade a piece that you have
Place a piece on your puzzle
Master action (only once every round) — put a piece on all your puzzles!
Optimize your actions so that your engine grows rather than runs out of steam. Quick development is crucial since once players have taken all the valuable (black) puzzles, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. 
With the Finesse expansion, you can complete goals on Finesse tiles to earn Credits. You can then spend the Credits to do extra actions.
The Ghost Piece expansion adds 24 new puzzles with unique shapes and new reward mechanics. There are also 3 new types of level-5 pieces, the Ghost Pieces. This expansion enhances the replayability of Project L and opens new strategic options for you to explore.





How to get the Add-ons? To get the add-ons, click on the Manage your pledge button. Then, click on Change your pledge and increase your pledge amount by the total cost of the add-ons you want. You will be able to select the add-ons you have pledged for in the pledge manager when the campaign ends.

The Boardcubator Ambassador Program is our way of thanking all the wonderful people in our community who stayed with us throughout the campaigns and whose support and help keep us moving forward. It’s because of your continuous involvement and interest in our games that we amass enough energy and motivation to push our projects further ahead. As a thank you, we’re including a special promo pack in all our Kickstarter campaigns that our ambassadors get for free!
You will automatically receive Project L: Finesse Ambassador Pack for free if:
You have pledged during the first 72 hours of the campaign,
You have supported any of our previous Kickstarter campaigns, or
You were subscribed to our newsletter before this Kickstarter campaign launched.

  Looking back to the original campaign in 2018, Project L went a long way. Two years ago, thanks to the support of all the amazing backers, we've fully unlocked all Stretch Goals that allowed us to produce the game in a shape and quality we had never dreamed of. There's not much that could be added or upgraded — just look at what the backers and reviewers say!
When it comes to the Finesse expansion, we had no other option than to follow the quality of Project L & Ghost Piece (not that we wouldn't like that), so Finesse is already coming to Kickstarter in a super-maximized mode.
We prefer to not add anything superficial, untested, or not fitting the content that's been originally planned for the game. And since mostly everything has been already added to the game, the inevitable result is that this campaign is Stretch Goal free.
On the other hand, the journey towards making Project L a reality has been so exciting that we just love the idea of sharing it with you in full detail (in even more detail than that the backers of the original campaign remember!). To accomplish that, we’ve prepared a series of behind-the-scenes stories as well as making-of interviews.
Stay tuned for the project updates!
Since the original campaign from 2018, we’ve partnered with Paul Grogan from Gaming Rules!, a professional rulebook writer & editor, to enhance and streamline the way you can learn to play Project L. Furthermore, focusing on the feedback we’ve received since the first version of the game, we’ve also perfected the rules in terms of game mechanics—mostly concerning the player actions and endgame. 
Check out the Revised Rules 2.0 (WIP).
Printed Revised Rulebook (2.0):

If you're interested in a localized retail version of the base game, get in touch with your local branch of Asmodee for details about if/when they are releasing Project L in your country and/or language. Since the localization is now in the hands of Asmodee, we're no longer allowed to produce non-English versions of the game.
Please note, however, that the retail version by Asmodee and this Kickstarter version by Boardcubator are two separate product lines run by two separate companies. While there's a good chance that the content of one will be compatible with the other, we cannot guarantee that.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Project L went through multiple iterations of technological design and solutions to make sure all components are very durable and will last through many plays. Rulebooks, game boxes, player aids, and puzzle boards have scratch resistant varnish or lamination that ensures that these components will last a long time under frequent use. Based on hundreds of rounds of playtesting, we have gradually improved the technological aspect of puzzle boards into their current 5-layer structure.

The base game is readily expandable without the need to make any component changes or upgrades to the base game that would require releasing a new version of the game. All expansions of the game can be mixed together.
Reusability and recyclability
Given the durability and material quality of the components in the game, Project L will last a long time before it starts showing signs of use or general material deterioration. In the rare case a component gets damaged, we will provide replacement parts.
Sustainable materials
Project L holds Verification of Conformity according to the EU Toy Safety Directive 2009/48/EC, which declares the game as safe for children and parents to play with and also verifies that there are no physical / mechanical, flammability, or chemical risks.
Environmentally friendly factories
Panda GM, the manufacturer of Project L pays extreme attention to worker comfort and safety standards with a fully air-conditioned environment, while being BSCI social compliance certified and following the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety.
Sustainable Distribution
Based on our previous experience with successfully fulfilling Kickstarter projects, we are constantly optimizing the shipping routes to make sure that the distance the game travels is as short as possible. We use several distribution hubs and fulfillment companies to make sure that packages are shipped in bulk where possible before the last mile delivery to our backers. All international shipments are realized through sea shipping, which is more environmentally friendly than air shipping.

campaign.story:
Sock Invaders are back! With 5 new original designs inspired by some of our favorite classic movies, as well one or two extra designs available if we meet our stretch goals. We spent over a year trying to apply the Sock Invaders style to a new, often requested theme. And this is what we came up with. 
   Once again, we're creating affordable designer socks with a pop culture twist for the fashionable geek. Blending traditional patterns, bold colours and movie related designs based on movies by amazing directors like Spielberg and Tarantino.  
After 3 years of designing gamer socks, you guys asked us for new themes. And classic movies seemed like a fun, new challenge. We took over a year and made many designs, before narrowing them down with feedback from our community. 
      The main changes we're making with this project are:
Quicker production times. 
Quicker delivery time.
Reduced prices, but with country specific shipping fees.
   For the first time, we're going to start production before the project finishes and use the Kickstarter backer survey instead of an outside survey, to speed things up and hopefully get packages to you before Christmas! Also due to the global virus situation, we've found shipping fees have increased quite a lot. So we've lowered prices but then added shipping fees, based on the costs we experience. 
 Our Socks
Our first ever movie collection!
Below are high resolution photos of each of our initial 5 designs. We've named them after the movie they're based on. Each design is available in 2 different sizes.
Reservoir Dogs
Jaws
The Blues Brothers
Pulp Fiction
IT
Stretch Goals
If we reach our funding goal, we'll announce futher stretch goals. Starting with our mega movie mashup design. Featuring characters from 6 different movies:
Star Wars, The Good, the Bad and the Ugly, E.T., Jurassic Park, Mary Poppins
and The Karate Kid.

 Size Chart 
Our Socks
For 3 years now, our goal has been to make premium quality designer socks affordable for everyone. By cutting out all middlemen and simply producing socks, sending to the fulfilment company and shipping to your door. But what makes our socks so special? Here's just some of our unique features. 
 Our Team 
 After the success of our last project, we kept our talented, up and coming Italian fashion designer Clarissa. During a difficult year, this project has helped keep us all busy and we really appreciate the support you guys give us during each new project. For me, this is the fourth Sock Invaders project and the first new theme we've tried to make. Please let us know your thoughts, feedback and suggestions for how we can improve.  
 Backer Reviews
Here are just a few of the lovely comments we've received from our previous projects. 
Thanks for checking out our movie socks project and we hope you like our new socks.

campaign.story:
Cartographers Heroes is a follow up to the critically-acclaimed flip and write game, Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale released in 2019. 
Cartographers Heroes can be played as a stand-alone game, or combined with the contents from the original game.
 The expedition to the Western Lands is the kind of honor that comes once in a lifetime for a royal cartographer. But these are dangerous times. 
War ravages the land, and you are sure to encounter Dragul forces determined to thwart Queen Gimnax’s plans for western expansion. Fortunately, brave heroes have risen to the defense of Nalos. Chart their deeds alongside the queen's edicts and secure your place in history.
Cartographers Heroes offers new ways to play Cartographers!
Change the goals of the game with 16 all-new scoring cards! 
Beware the 4 new ambush cards, as the monsters now have special abilities! Ignore them at your peril.
Discover 4 new hero cards in the explore deck to draw on your map sheet to destroy monsters within range!
Explore 2 new map sheets to add variety to your Cartographers game.
RETAIL EDITION
COLLECTOR'S EDITION 
This version of Cartographers Heroes will not be available in retail (with the exception of retailers who back this Kickstarter).
The larger box (318 x 227 x 72mm - Roll Player sized) and has room to store additional Cartographers content (sold separately) from Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale, the original Skills Mini-Expansion, and the Ambush Mini-Expansion.  This version of Cartographers Heroes includes:
All the content from the retail edition of Cartographers Heroes 
Custom plastic insert (supports sleeved cards)
 Map Pack 1 - Nebblis: Plane of Flame
 Map Pack 2 - Affril: Plane of Knowledge
 Map Pack 3 - Undercity: Depths of Sabek
 Skills Mini-Expansion 2 - 8 new skills cards + rules card.
 Colored Pencils: 20 colored pencils (4 sets of 5 colors)

In addition to the new version of Cartographers, we are also offering three new map pack expansions. Each map pack includes:
1 Rulesheet specific to the map pack. 
75 Map Sheets (double-sided)
3 New cards for use with the map pack.
 Note: Each map pack is shrinkwrapped separately and delivered without a box.
With the release of Cartographers Heroes, a brand new Skills expansion is available. As with the original Skills Mini-Expansion, you will find 8 new Skills cards and a rules card. Some cards in this mini-expansion require Cartographers Heroes to play, as a couple of them require knowledge of the hero cards work. This mini-expansion can be combined with the original Skills Mini-Expansion, which can be added to your pledge as an add-in in the pledge manager. It allows the players to spend their collected coins to break the rules of the game in a unique way once per season. 
The Skills Mini-Expansion 2 is included with any pledge of Cartographer Heroes.

Cartographers Heroes Rulebook

Cartographers Heroes is divided into four seasons. At the end of each season, players earn reputation stars. The phases of each season are:
Explore Phase
                    A player reveals the top card of the Explore Deck and places it face up in the center of the table so all players can see it.
Draw Phase
                    All players simultaneously choose one of the terrain types and one of the shapes depicted on the explore card and draws it on their own map sheet.
 
Check Phase
                    At the end of the turn, the players check to see if the season is complete and players either move to the Scoring Phase or return to the Explore Phase.

Scoring Phase
                     Once the players have met or exceeded the time threshold on the season card, the season is complete and players score their map. A new season begins or the game ends after four seasons.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks. I've outlined some common areas of risk in boardgame projects and how I've done my best to address them.

> Artwork: All the artwork for the game is complete, with the exception of any final graphic design needs as we submit the final files to the manufacturer.

>Development: The game has been extensively playtested and is ready for printing.

> Component Quality: I've worked with and built a great relationship with one of the best game manufacturers around, Panda Game Manufacturing (www.pandagm.com). Their proven track record on games like Eclipse, Terra Mystica, Pandemic, Belfort, and Mice & Mystics, proves they make great games with a high standard of quality. They've printed all Thunderworks titles to date.

> Delivery Timeline: Unexpected delays out of my control can always occur (i.e. component shortage, manufacturer issues, customs delays, etc...). For the production schedule of Cartographers Heroes, I've used conservative estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road.

> Fulfillment: I have received multiple estimates and will be working with established fulfillment companies that have proven track records for delivering quickly and efficiently all over the world.

> Ninth Project: Even though this is my ninth Kickstarter project, I have continued to spend endless hours researching Kickstarter as well as participating in many Kickstarters. I have done my best to foresee and minimize any obstacles or stumbling blocks.

In addition, in my life outside of this campaign, I have over a decade of project management experience on large-scale software projects. I will continue to leverage that experience and apply it to this project by anticipating issues and sidestepping hurdles that may arise.

A Flavorful Game
      Everyone has a green thumb when playing Herbaceous. Relax while enjoying this elegant game of picking and potting herbs. Pot the best collection of herbs in your different containers, but don’t wait too long or your friend might grab them first.       
A Tiny Edition for Travel
Herbaceous Pocket is the same great game in an even smaller package. Herbaceous is a simple to learn, push your luck, set collection game. 
 Smooth, streamlined rounds make Herbaceous a fast-moving, engaging game of picking and sharing herbs.
 The Pocket Edition is complete with all cards, dividers, and rules included. Visual adjustments were made to maximize clarity of the smaller size cards.  
Steve Finn (Dr. Finn's Games) - renowned designer of Biblios and The Butterfly Garden - has created a wonderful compliment to Beth Sobel's stunning herb art. Eduardo Baraf is at the helm of Herbaceous Pocket to ensure it delivers Herbaceous' perfect balance of simple play, interesting moments, and wonderful art in a fantastic, tiny, package.   
 Keith Matejka (Thunderworks Games) - designer of Bullfrogs, Roll Player, and Skulk Hollow - created the additional rules for solo play, loved for its easy, rapid play.  
Herbaceous is Zee Garcia's #1 relaxing game (and Mike Disilio's #4). The new, great way to experience Herbaceous with a cup of tea.  


The pocket edition of the Flavor Pack Mini-Expansion includes Cinnamon, Star Anise, and Peppercorn and adds a little extra spice to Herbaceous' flavorful play. 
All Kickstarter backers who pledge for Herbaceous Pocket Edition will also receive the Flavor Pack Mini-Expansion for Free. This expansion will be available for sale typically for $5 separately on BGG, at Conventions, the PFG Store, etc. It will not be packaged within the base game.     
My Mother Gives an Overview of How to Play the original Herbaceous - she has the prototype from our first KS.
Rodney Smith from Watch It Played teaches Herbaceous . This is the 1st print edition of the original game.
Rules in Additional Languages: Many of these are fan made, please note the contributor when you download the translation: French, German, Spanish, Italian, Polish 
Board Game Closet I've never really seen it done like this before...it plays just as good, probably even better...it's just really neat how they did it.   
Tantrum House: It's so cute and tiny!...It's a relaxing game. 
Click for Full Article
Boardgame Corner: Herbaceous is a perfect after dinner game! 
Rahdo Runs Through: Herbaceous is Lovely. It is an absolutely delightful and very fast playing game that you can really do with just about anyone. This is the perfect game for high tea. 
Bower's Game Corner: Herbaceous is a rock solid filler game - great family game, great game night game, great gateway game! 
Herbaceous: Pocket Edition is a Stretch Goal free campaign. We set out to make a perfect, pocket, edition of the classic game. Aside from size, card and component quality is in line with the original game.



PFG worked with various partners to find a cost effective way to ship a single copy of Herbaceous: Pocket Edition internationally. Unfortunately, in a padded envelope, it is just a smidge too thick for international letter shipping. Therefore it is basically the same cost of shipping a small game (and there are a lot of additional shipping fees these days). 
However, since it is so small / light, it doesn't cost more to ship 2 or 3 copies in the same box. If you are outside of the US, I highly recommend buying the double or triple pack to split with a friend or give it as a gift. It is an easy, gateway game for almost anyone.

campaign.story:
Hello to whoever's walking by,
Because of an annoying error/bug we had never dealt with before, which did not allow us to been discoverable, we were not able to reach at all the number of people that is usually found easily at the beginning of a campaign. Given the huge amount of work that Comete has behind it, we decided to restart the campaign but with a novelty. In the midst of bad luck, good news also came: we managed to find a lower price for the production of Comete that we hope, will make all of us happy! We would like to thank  those who supported us in this turbulent and unforeseen beginning, and apologize for the problem, hoping that you will be pleased to know that without you nothing would be possible and that if we develop board games it is to share our ideas with you and let you have fun with new playful experiences.
YOU CAN FIND US AT THE NEW CAMPAIGN HERE





Here's a fragment of our old campaign:
Comete marries cleverness and elegance in a way that few games manage to achieve. The rules are straightforward but about halfway your first game your decisions and those of your rival will make the situation more and more intriguing and exciting, clearing a sky of chances in front of you. Moreover, the cards evoke the mind-blowing and fascinating theme of the sky and unleash the collective imagination linked to the outer space and ancient myths and legends about shooting stars. Easy to learn but hard to master, this game will present a new challenge each and every game. Comete appeal to both hardcore boardgamers, but also to less experienced players: when the two gaming experiences are combined in a single game, every player can take advantage of different strategies and lucky draw-reveal sessions. Other highlights are:
 Highly Replayable: Comete is a very dynamic game that urges you to «think on your feet.» We still find ourselves enjoying and improving at the game after hundreds of plays.
 Focused: The unconventional set of Comete is intended to be a complete, deep play experience, with an interesting meta in and of itself. So it's quick to pick up, and there's no need to constantly add more cards to the mix to keep things interesting.
 Simple, quick setup: Just unroll the playmat, shuffle the deck, deal the gems and play. Unlike many deep games, you don’t need to separate or gather cards, set up piles, make decks, etc.
 Player Interaction: Comete is a race (e.g. Dominion, Lost Cities, Tea Time) that has also elements of confrontation (e.g. Azul, Patchwork, Keltis); it can be somehow considered as a balance of racing and interaction. The more interesting the game gets, the more tension between the players grows – we have seen games ranging from peaceful to highly aggressive, depending on the player’s style. Just keep in mind that your actions can come back to you if you waste your hard-gained resources: aggression will not always be your best playstyle. Many cards can cause you more harm than good if played unwisely.. Timing is everything.
- Carl Sagan

updates.update_userinfo: Printed Proofs Approved and a Heads Up!
updates.update_content: We hit an important milestone recently when we approved the English language printed proofs! French and German proofs will have to go out-of-house for approval, so that runs later. Normally, I'd want to share images to show you what a big job this is (and it is a HUGE job), but the Saga content is designed to be "discovered through play" so Mark wouldn't let me share the massive piles of paper he had to look over. But he did take these shots and said I could share them. The important part is that this represents another milestone down!

I’ve been holding off on making this post until I have definitive shipping information to tell you. Unfortunately I don’t have definitive information for you, but it is clear that we won’t be hitting our target shipping month. So I pulled together all the data I could from all of AEG to get you the best possible information I could. I wish I could tell you exactly when you are going to get your game, but that’s just not the state of things right now.

However, if we cannot be clear about exact times, we can at least be completely honest about where we are and what we think the process will be as of right now.

Short update today...
The Pledge Manager is closing in 2 weeks (the 31st). After that point, we will no longer be accepting late pledges. In addition, normally you can "add an extra copy" during the pledge manager if you were already a backer, that will also likely be turned off or limited at that time (we'll be sure to leave a copy for each backer). Why are we doing this?...

I got a ping asking for an update, which I’m always happy to do. So here is where things are as of now…

We are (fingers crossed) within days of finalizing all the files. The complexity of this project, particularly with all three languages, has definitely caused some late nights by the team and we’re all going to breathe a sigh of relief when these files get to the printer.

Holidays over. 
First week of "Oh man, we are so far behind from taking those days off" is over. 
Time for an update!!

Just a quick update...
Things are moving along. Translation are just about wrapped up, which is a bigger milestone than you might think, especially for such a big game. 

One of the great things about doing translated versions in-house is that the translators often catch small issues that we may have missed in the English version - nothing huge, just corner-cases that we may want to cover more fully or places where extra clarification might be a good idea.

Felt like it's been awhile since I've done an update, so I thought I'd fire one off. I honestly never know how often to do updates - I back a lot of Kickstarters and I could do with a few less TBH, so I'll keep this short.

Dead Reckoning is working it's way through the pre-production process now. There is a lot of tranlsation-related work going on as everything (cards, rules, books, sagas, etc...) has to be translated into German and French and then laid out as well. It is a TON of work, but it's getting done.

What is Communist Cats?

Communist Cats is a fast paced game of bluffing and strategy. It can be played with anywhere from 2-6 players, and games last 5-10 minutes each. A puurrrrrfect game to fill those spare minutes!
Game Contents: 54 cards
What is Communist Cats: Revolution?

Communist Cats: Revolution is an expansion to Communist Cats. It introduces "The Scientist" and "The Physician" as new cat characters as well as "Research Cards".
Use "The Scientist" and their range of technological advancements to gain the advantage. Research powerful abilities such as Satellites, Supercomputers and Nukes. Communist Cats: Revolution gives you even more options to win the game!
Are you comrades injured? No problem! Use "The Physician" to recover your numbers.
Game Contents: 24 cards (requires a copy of Communist Cats in order to play)
If you would like any add-ons, just add the value below to any pledge which includes a physical copy of the game. Drop us a message if this is the case with what you would like added-on. There are no additional shipping costs for add-ons!

campaign.story:
Let's be honest, one of the biggest perks of being a male is that we can pee while standing. It's fast and it's easy which makes for there hardly ever being a lineup in public restrooms. But, of course, there is a downside and... it is a messy one. 
 Inevitably we all experience a simple law of urination physics:  when we pee, our height + flow speed + porcelain + water =pee splashing-fireworks. 
This results in residual pee in and around our toilets, pee drips, pee spray, and toilet crud build-up.
As part of our mission of designing products that help alleviate the small, yet common stresses we encounter in the day to day, we've designed the Piss Pad. 
The Piss Pad is a highly dense, diffusing target that attaches to the back of your toilet bowl to diffuse urine splashback. Its robust and functional design is the first in-home urine splashback tool of its kind. 
At a total thickness of 15mm and a diameter of 40mm, the PissPad is a non-intrusive design that remains in your toilet providing minimalistic splashback protection.
 Installing and removing the PissPad is simple: simply peel, place, and stick. Because we've used microsuction waterproof adhesion, you can rest assured that your PissPad will stay anchored to the porcelain of your toilet.
Want to remove it? Simply peel it right back off. No residue will be left behind. Easy pee-sy... and you can always reinstall! 
 When put to the test, we observed that we needed to clean our toilets 67% less when compared to not using the PissPad! Hello to saving time, money, and toilet paper. Guys... you know what we're talking about: the infamous pee wipe down will be a thing of the past.
 Really, there is nothing like the Piss Pad in the market. From its size, design, and its simple anti-splash functionality, we do really mean that it's the first of its kind for in-home use.
No actual urine was used for the making of this campaign. We just thought we should say that...
Because of the dense polyurethane fibers incorporated in our design, the PissPad creates thousands of inner channels that restrict liquid from bouncing off the surface and channels urine away without any splash or spray. Aim for the Piss Pad and the work is done.
Flushing has never felt more satisfying. Once you're done aiming, simply flush as usual and the Piss Pad is rinsed after each and every use. Oh and because Piss Pads fibers are fully sealed, no smells or liquid can cling to its surface. 
 Just last year many supporters here on Kickstarter brought PURP (our previous campaign) to life. The feedback after having shipped on time to all of our supporters was phenomenal and we plan to do exactly the same this campaign if not even better.
We're New Normal, a little San Francisco-founded company focused on creating products aimed to alleviate the small, yet common, stresses we all encounter day to day.
We welcome you to join us on our journey as we create products that aim to do just that, and ideally, lay way to becoming the new normal.
Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign. If you have any questions, please make sure to check out our  FAQ's or reach out to us by sending a message; we'd be more than happy to help!
First time on Kickstarter, and never backed a project? Feel free to chat with our chatbot below. His name is Sebastian :) 
 Get in Touch
Know a friend who would love our project? Tell them and help us spread the word. We've made it easy - simply click on the social media icon of your preference below to do so :)

campaign.story:
Summary
Mantis Falls is a strategic and highly interactive 2-3 player hidden traitor game. As cautious companions, players must use cooperation, hand management, social deduction and deception to protect themselves, and each other, on a dark and perilous journey.
On the shadowy film-noir roads of a mob-ruled mountain town named Mantis Falls, you have witnessed something not meant for your eyes and must now move quickly to escape town alive. You are informed that another witness will join you, and you consider your greatest hope for survival will come if you can contend with the hazards of this night together. But with each damaging event and every fresh wound, your suspicions grow. Looking into your companion's eyes you wonder, perhaps too late, if this person is here to kill you.
By use of hidden role cards, Mantis Falls is a “sometimes cooperative" strategy game. A game may have only witnesses, in which case players can win only if they all escape together. Or there could secretly be an assassin, carefully protecting the illusion of collaboration until the right moment to strike.
Unlike semi-cooperative games with multi-tiered win objectives or accumulations of points, Mantis Falls presents a simplicity of purpose: survival. And this task presents challenge in equal and high measure for all players. When there are only witnesses, players will need to continually perform acts of sacrifice and generosity even as double-edged action cards and "unseen" events test the limits of their fragile alliance. Players charged with the role of assassin can survive only with deceit and cunning, always cautious of the powerful but fleeting ability of witnesses to call in a hit on those they no longer trust.
Mantis Falls combines combo-driven card-play and hand-building with player communication. On every turn, players discuss tactics, defend choices and bluff through carefully guarded secrets. Witnesses and assassins alike must walk the line between a willingness to help their companion and a readiness to kill, always reading each other as much as surveying the hazards of the road.
With a variable modular board and uncertain objectives, each walk through the roads of Mantis Falls is unique. Moreover, the level of interaction means the relationships and personalities of the players themselves have the power to meaningfully transform every game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our first scale-up to mass production and that inherently entails the risk of the unknown. Fortunately, we have the guidance of valuable mentors experienced in this industry, so we are optimistic in our ability to address the challenges that come our way.

Our greatest concern right now is that the game may not reach everyone on our planned schedule. Although this is always a concern, it is particularly so now due to the challenging circumstances of COVID-19. If production or distribution is unavoidably delayed, we will still do all we can to get you your reward as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We chose a card-based design in part to ensure a game that can withstand the rigors of time. The heavy reliance on cards allows for relative ease of replacement of lost/damaged components.
Reusability and recyclability
Mantis Falls is made almost exclusively from recyclable and/or easily biodegradable materials (card stock. cardboard and wood). The only use of plastic is the shrink wrap and thin bags to hold game components within the box.
Sustainable materials
For our design, we have deliberately foregone more substantial uses of plastic such as heavy inserts.
Sustainable Distribution
We are very excited that our collaboration with MyClimate.org has ensured our carbon offsets will account for all fulfillment, from manufacturing all the way to the backer's door. This strategy was made possible in part by our compact game design and small box, which has been a key consideration for us since the start of this game's conception.
Something else
We have proudly partnered with MyClimate.org to make our game 100% carbon neutral.

Hey everyone! It's been a very busy and positive month on our end and we're excited to share lots of news with you! Since it's a long update, here's a quick synopsis:

Hi, we hope everyone is doing well! We've got a quick manufacturing update and some new content to announce. 

Our manufacturing team has said they won't be finished with manufacturing until early May. This pushes our timeline for fulfillment tentatively to June/July.  We are very disappointed to be telling you this, and thus we have worked on two main fronts in the last couple of days; figuring out what went wrong and finding ways to make it up to you all.

campaign.story:
Canopy is a game for two*, where players compete to grow the most bountiful rainforest. The jungle ecosystem is full of symbiosis, and players must grow tall trees and lush jungle plants to attract the most diverse wildlife. By carefully selecting what grows in your forest you can create the ideal balance of flora and fauna and give rise to a thriving ecosystem.  
*Solo and 3-4 player variants unlocked! 
See below for our full plan to make Canopy as environmentally friendly as possible.
Canopy is played over three Seasons. Each Season, players endeavor to create a successful rainforest by collecting Plants, Trees, Wildlife and Weather cards.
Gather plants in specific sets to maximize their points. Grow tall and numerous trees to win valuable bonuses. Attract a diverse array of wildlife to help you manage and grow your forest with unique abilities. Beware - as there are threats to the forest as well and the risk of fire, disease and drought is ever-present.
Designed by Tim Eisner and beautifully illustrated by Vincent Dutrait, Canopy is designed to play quickly and appeal to a wide range of players. It offers push-your-luck drafting, strategic set collection, meaningful choices and invites players to create their own vibrant rainforest tableau. 
*All components are prototype and may change during final printing.
(Digital Mock-up. Actual puzzle will be even more beautiful)
The Canopy puzzle add-on comes in a separate box and costs $18 plus shipping.  We've just added two new pledge tiers (Retail + Puzzle and Deluxe + Puzzle). If you have already pledged you can switch to one of these tiers or add this to your pledge by clicking on the manage pledge option and increase your pledge by $18. Shipping costs are listed in the Shipping section below. 
 Read the full Geekdad review here: https://bit.ly/2YSzWLy
 German Language video preview from Brettspielhero here:  https://bit.ly/2YqMLOi
  Follow this link to read the full Gaming with Sidekicks review: https://bit.ly/3fMvgxO
  Read the full One Board Family review here: https://bit.ly/2VpL8yH
 Here at Weird City Games, we love making board games and we love nature. In recent years we have become increasingly concerned about the effects of climate change on the natural world, and with our own impacts through manufacturing games. When the idea of Canopy came to us, we immediately saw it as an opportunity to work towards making our board games in a more sustainable manner, and working to offset negative impacts. 
While we are a small company, we feel it is important to bring our desire for change into our love of making games. We are learning as we go and doing what is feasible for this first project. We see this as the first step of many to making our games in the most sustainable manner possible. 
We hope that highlighting the unique and wondrous species that live within the rainforest will help connect people to this essential part of our environment. And hopefully, it will spark meaningful conversations and a desire to make sure we all do what we can to protect these wondrously diverse forests.
Steps we are taking to make the game sustainable include:
For each game we sell through Kickstarter we will be planting one tree in partnership with Tree Sisters, a fantastic non-profit based in the UK focused on tropical reforestation and the empowerment of women. 
Producing the game without any plastic. The plastic wrap on cards and the game box will be replaced with paper bands or small stickers. Ziploc bags will be replaced with sturdy paper envelopes.
All wood used in the game will come from FSC (Forest Stewardship Council) certified materials. 
All chipboard components used in the game will come from post-consumer waste. 
Keeping the box size small to limit resources used in freight and domestic shipping.
Thank you for joining us and contributing to our goal of a sustainable future!
 Canopy is played over 3 Seasons. During each Season you will take turns selecting which cards to add to your rainforest from 3 New Growth piles. 
New Growth: Each turn you will select cards from one New Growth pile. Each time you look at a pile you may select it and add those cards to your rainforest tableau, or return the pile face-down, adding 1 additional card. As the piles grow you must search for the plants and animals that will benefit your forest the most. But choose carefully, as the jungle also contains threats in the form of fire, disease, and drought.
Grow Your Forest: During each Season you will add cards to your rainforest. Carefully select an ideal balance of Trees, Weather, Wildlife, and Plants to grow a thriving ecosystem. At the end of each Season, you will discard all Plants, Weather, and Threat cards, leaving Trees and Wildlife to continue to grow.
Score Sets: At the end of each Season you will gain points for your rainforest. Each card type offers a different way to score. Focus on attracting diverse Wildlife, building unique sets of Plants, growing the Tallest Trees, or creating ideal Weather patterns. 
Read the current Canopy Rulebook here.
Canopy is a fully immersive and vibrant game that we are positive you will enjoy! The gameplay and components are already great, and we are confident it can become even better if you help us spread the word, rally the board gaming community, and exceed our basic funding goal.
We have unlocked all of the fantastic Stretch Goals planned to improve component quality and add additional content to Canopy! Thanks for helping us grow a mighty rainforest!
The cost of shipping will be charged after the campaign has ended. In the pledge manager, which will go out after the campaign finishes, you will be asked to fill out a backer survey and shipping will be charged at that time.
Below are the estimated shipping costs. We have incorporated a portion of the shipping costs into all pledges. (We do not expect prices to vary greatly, but those listed are estimates only and may fluctuate slightly.)
Want Extra Copies: You may order multiple copies of the game and pay half of the shipping cost for each additional copy. (e.g. If you wanted two copies of the Canopy Deluxe game in Zone 2 you would pledge $58 for the games and estimated shipping would be $13.50.) 
We have an estimated delivery date of June 2021, and we will be working diligently to get the game to all backers as early as possible.
We realize that shipping can be a great barrier  and we have done what we can to reduce that cost. We apologize for any difficulty this creates. We apologize that we DO NOT SHIP to: Afghanistan, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Burma, North Korea, Sudan.
 Eco-Friendly: For each game purchased through Kickstarter, we will plant one tree through our partnership with Tree Sisters.
 Get it First: Backers will receive Canopy before it is available at retail.
 Exclusive Version: Backers of the Deluxe level will receive the exclusive, deluxe version of the game which will not be sold through traditional retail. 
 Awesome Stretch Goals: By pledging now you will help us unlock stretch goals to improve both the retail and deluxe versions of the game.
 Your Support is Essential: The game design and artwork are 95% complete and we need your help to make the game a reality.
 This project would not be possible without all of you, our wonderful backers. We seek to honor your vital contribution with our promise that backer copies of Canopy will be shipped out before Canopy is available for purchase from retailers or at conventions. You know what they say: the early Toucan gets the game...or something like that.
One of our favorite things about Kickstarter is that it can build and sustain community. We pledge to involve all of our backers in the creation of this project in as many meaningful ways as possible. This may include helping select new wildlife or plants to include in the game, suggesting new components, variants, rules editing, thematic advice, and more. We love your input and will do our best to incorporate as many of your ideas as we can.
Further, we pledge to keep you informed at every step along the way as our Kickstarter campaign unfolds. We value each of you and will ensure that you are fully satisfied with this project. Please feel free to contact us with any concerns, questions or ideas. Let's build this rainforest together!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Canopy is the 5th Kickstarter campaign that we have managed and while we have learned a lot and are confident that we can deliver a successful project, we also know that unexpected things happen. Our promise to backers is that we will work tirelessly to bring you the best product we can in the timeliest manner. In addition, we promise to maintain excellent communication throughout the process to ensure that you are informed of any hurdles or obstacles that we encounter. 

The Game - The game design is complete and we feel confident you will enjoy it. The art is 95% complete and we will be working closely with our manufacturer to make sure the awesome illustrations by Vincent Dutrait are brought to life in brilliant colors. 

Manufacturing - We will be working with a trusted factory that has a proven track record of producing high quality games. We will be in constant communication with them and will make sure that no corners are cut to make this game as excellent as it can be. 

Shipping and Fulfillment - We have established relationships with freight shipping companies and fulfillment centers around the world. Inevitably, when shipping hundreds or thousands of packages, there will be some errors that occur. We will work diligently with our fulfillment partners to keep backers informed of any delays and will work to get your games to you as quickly as possible. 

Customer Support - After the games arrive if you have any issues with the final product, be they missing or damaged components we encourage you to contact us. We want all of our backers to have the best and most complete version of the game and to make sure you get great customer service and support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Sustainable Distribution

Something else
For each copy of the game that we sell through Kickstarter we will be planting one tree through our partnership with Tree Sisters. Tree Sisters is a non-profit based in the UK that works to plant trees in a sustainable, holistic manner and at the same time empower women around the world.

Hello Canopy Backer!
In today's update I will cover the current timeline for production and final assembly of the games. I will also touch on the current state of shipping and how that is affecting out campaign. I'll do my best to keep it short and sweet, while giving you all the information we currently have available. 
Production

Hi Canopy Backer!
It is a very exciting week here in Portland, Oregon as we received the final MPC (Manufacturing Production Copy) of Canopy on Tuesday. There is nothing quite like holding the final print version of a game that you have been working on for years. It is a culmination so much work and support all of which was only an idea 2 1/2 years ago. Thank you all for being part of this and carrying the game to this point.

updates.update_userinfo: Updated Timelines for Manufacturing and Shipping
updates.update_content:
Hello Canopy Crew,
While production of the game is moving along nicely, the state of worldwide shipping is quite fraught with many delays and unexpected hurdles. In this update I'll cover the current state of production, our estimated timeline to delivery, and what fun is happening in the world of ocean freight.
The Good

Hi Canopy Backers!
Today is Earth Day and I wanted to reflect and share what we have accomplished with Canopy and what plans we have for the future in regards to environmentally focused and sustainably produced boardgames. Canopy is in production and moving along smoothly. I am still waiting on the updated timeline of when production will finish so I will share that in the next update. The rest of this update will be dedicated to environmental topics so if you are interested please read on and if not we will see you next update.

Hello Canopy Backer,
I'm writing this update with extreme joy and excitement because Canopy is finally in production! After many months of adjustments, holidays, updates and revisions the mass production process for Canopy is underway. The rough timeline for Production is two months (I'll have a more detailed timeline in the next Update) so games should be ready to load on ships by early June.

updates.update_userinfo: New Inserts and a Slight Delay
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Thank you all for your patience in waiting for these updates. As I said in a previous update we were hoping to begin production on March 15th. Unfortunately, one thing I keep learning in regards to production is nothing ever goes as smoothly or quickly as you would expect. This is especially true during this last year when the pandemic has made life topsy turvy across the globe.

updates.update_userinfo: Final Rules as we Await the PPC

Our manufacturer recently got back from the Lunar New Year holiday and took last week to get up to speed. We are waiting on some updated samples from them before we commence with production. We are hoping to receive those samples by early next week so we can make any final adjustments and then give the go ahead to start production. The updated items we are waiting to review are:

Hello Backers,
I've spent the last week communicating with our manufacturers and making the necessary file adjustments to get Canopy ready for mass production. I have almost all of the files updated and will be submitting them to our prepress specialist early next week.

updates.update_userinfo: A Very Exciting Day in the Rainforest!
updates.update_content:
Greetings Rainforest Fans!
Yesterday the Canopy Preproduction copy finally arrived. Getting the PPC is a big and exciting day as it is the first glimpse of what the final product will look like. This will be a long update, full of lots of photos and details but the short story is that the game is looking fantastic. I have done a quick review of all the components and found a few issues that will need to be resolved which I will outline below. Seeing the artwork for the game in person is a real treat and I cannot wait for you all to get to appreciate the incredible art that Vincent Dutrait created for this game.

campaign.story:
If you are extremely satisfied with the Switch Dock, then don’t waste any time reading this article. Please spend all your time on playing your games. Whether the product we are going to introduce next is attractive or horrible, it is designed to improve your gaming experience.
OK, if you have finished reading the above contents, we will assume you are willing to spend some time checking out what we are trying to say.

“Brook”, founded in Taiwan, aims to design and manufacture the adapter for different platforms. Two of the third employees in this company are gamers so we have a strange insistence on the products that we design - You can simply regard us as the psychopath, we won’t deny that.

“Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” are our latest products, and we know you are going to compare them with other similar products, however, please allow us to prove that no matter one, two, four or even eight people are using our products, they will never disappoint you.
We are terrible at telling amazing stories and not planning to say how hard we work so let’s cut the touching opening and check out the product specification immediately.
We provide two products with different specifications for this fundraising project. The main difference is the Bluetooth support function. “Power Bay” supports dual Bluetooth headsets, but “Power Bay Crimson” does not.
If you’re interested in “Power Bay Crimson”, please skip to the next page and don’t waste your gaming time.
There’s a Bluetooth button on “Power Bay”, press it and then press the “Bluetooth Pairing Button” on the headset to connect. It will connect with the second Bluetooth headset automatically after pairing the first one.
The human can’t hear the latency lower than 70ms, so you will not notice that the sound is actually slower than the image. If you have any doubts, you can test this SoC in any electronics appliance store. I can guarantee that “Power bay” is superior to other well-known products.
In fact, ever since the testing stage, we have highly used this product on “gaming at work” and “workout in the meeting room”. You can see the attention of our product manager in the following photos.
By the way, the people who get caught are our project planner and Brook FAE, the first one is good at boasting (such as the context you’re currently reading), and the other one is good at solving client’s issues with strong muscle (Just kidding. He’s a nice guy and can score 135 points on the chest match at Ring Fit Adventure).  
“Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” default mode is the “Switch Pro Input Mode” but you can manually switch it to the “GameCube Input Mode” while using the GameCube Controller.
Make sure you don’t press any button on the GameCube Controller, press the “Turbo Setting Button” for 5 seconds. You can also switch it back to the “Switch Pro Input Mode” by pressing the “Turbo Setting Button” for 5 seconds again.
Were you confused about what “Turbo Setting Button” is? No doubt, both “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” allow you to set the GameCube Controller to the continuous mode. Alright, I know what you are thinking, just take this as a bonus gift.
If you are a Super Smash Bros. true supporter, I think you have got the point, and I don’t need any extra blandishments to convince you to support our project.
But… if you are not, oh that’s too bad. Go find one to explain to you how important the GameCube is. Seriously, this is “So Important”. Super Smash Bros. has always been a milestone for all gamers, either when you hang out with friends or have fun with family. The GameCube Controller represents the best of every happy time (cheering after winning) and touching moments (weeping after losing).
Not to mention these two GameCube ports for you to connect with other devices such as Donkey Kong Bongos.
Controller, headset, expansion adapter, even Mario wheel, these two ports are enough for you to connect with multiple devices. Ok I know there are some people already thinking about what they are going to connect with their peripherals. For example, when you stay up playing games, I suggest you connect with the wired controller and headset to have perfect gaming experience before being shouted at by your parents. Ah, I admitted that there are plenty of amazing and proper ways of using the product but please allow me to remind you something even more important, which is “Stability”.
We put extra attention to the input stability and latency issues of the external devices when we first designed “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson”. To be more specific, we don’t want to see that when you are playing, you input something and the instruction is lagging on the image or even nothing happens, causing you to lose an important game.
Do you think we will exclude these excellent features in the new product? Absolutely not!
We conducted a test before launching the product - Randomly choose 10 screens between 20” to 60” and observe the image output from the HDMI port of “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson”, and we can’t find any broken or blurry images.
Although the focus of our discussion has changed from King Koopa to Princess Koopa. Okay, it's not even relevant. The most important part is that we have come up with the idea of “Real-Time Meeting Room”. Sometimes we have to attend other meetings in different companies, and one single laptop is actually hard to satisfy the actual needs and you can’t expect the meeting equipment in other companies to meet your requirements.
As a result, we have a portable projector, two Bluetooth speakers, and one phone which supports DP-Alt Mode with “Power Bay”. These small things composed together have become a “Portable Presentation System”.
When we first presented in the other companies with the system, I immediately felt I was at least three levels up than other people and unlocked the secret advanced job “Trendy Marketing Planner”.
You can only experience the actual fun part of this product when it’s not connected with power. As everyone knows that the Switch’s hardware has bound with the HDMI output and charging inspection, so if you want to display the Switch image on TV, it’s very difficult to get rid of this limitation. Well, it’s also challenging for us to throw away this burden. On the contrary, we realized that “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” have more flexibility.
First of all, as long as you don’t output the image with the HDMI port, while you are using Switch, you can normally use the Bluetooth function, also the expansion GC and USB port.
Secondly, for any devices with USB Type-C port and support DP Alt-Mode (such as MacBook Pro), you don’t need to buy the additional Type-C to HDMI converter, simply using the HDMI output function of “Power Bay" and “Power Bay Crimson” to display the image on your screen. The “Real-Time Meeting Room” we mentioned earlier is the application of this function.
--Or maybe you can interpret the case like we are trying to find more selling points to make this product more competitive…
I’m not sure if you have ever experienced the following situation: Your Switch device suddenly shuts down while you were charging and playing game. You are confused as to what the problem is before realizing your Switch is out of juice. How did this happen when you were charging it the whole time?
Answer: The Switch requires max 15V power to operate normally as well as allow playing games and charging to be conducted simultaneously, the voltage required for the entire charging process of Switch is constantly changing, and both "Power Bay" and "Power Bay Crimson" have the function to adjust the voltage accordingly to protect your lovely console.
I know you’re probably tired of or simply don’t care about what’s coming next but we want you to know that
“Us caring, means that you don’t have to.”
There are tons of third-party Switch Docks on the market and what makes us different is that we care while others don’t give a damn. We use our own products at home so we certainly don’t want anything bad to happen. For this reason, we adopt only the best in places you wouldn’t normally notice - materials, parts, and processing technology. We want our products to be free from overheating, overvoltage and short circuits after being shipped to our customers. To achieve this, we have a tremendous amount of “tedious” effort. We will spare you the time and energy to understand what we went through, but rest assured, you can relax and be carefree when using “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson”.
After all, us caring, means that you don’t have to.
Just to clarify again, we to hate see our products damage your Switch, perhaps even more than you do. However, as a responsible company that thinks ahead and prepares for the worst, we have done the following:
Reinforce the USB Type-C flexibility and seal,  preventing short circuits from occurring when your Switch slips. You definitely would not want something like this to happen when you upgrade your firmware or when charging your device.
Reinforce the power control, make sure that “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” voltage curves match that of original  manufacturer Switch Docks.
What if the above-mentioned situation still occurs?
Simply put, if you don’t use any non-original manufacturer’s firmware or jailbreak your Switch, and “Power Bay” and “Power Bay Crimson” cause your Switch to malfunction, Brook will take care of the repair. If we can’t fix it, we will compensate you for our loss. 
As what I said, we are also players, and we're not satisfied with the current dock - whether officially one or others. Therefore, we try to design a new dock ... if no one wants it, at least we can use it ourselves.
This video aims to prove that Power Bay is a finished product, it may not be perfect, but at least it's not a garbage which waste you money. 
PLAY


Yes. To ease your mind, we have asked some gamers to test our products. Some have praised us, while others have criticized our products. We welcome all forms of feedback and let you, the customer, make up your own mind.
And there are more media reported or shared information about "Power Bay" with players, maybe you are also interesting about what they say. 

*MSRP of Power Bay: $65
*MSRP of Power Bay Crimson: $55
 *You can check Information about Brook Mas Wired Controller and Brook GameCube to Switch Controller Adapter on Brook Official website.
Brook, it was born in 2015. The name is taken from a subspecies of chameleons – one of the world’s most adaptable creatures. Breathing life into favorite, old controllers that had fallen into disuse; the Super Converter gives them new life for you while having fun. We back you up. This is our promise for all of fans. As a gamer, it is flawless to use the unique controller to play all kinds of games on different consoles. Brook is the partner who can make gamers’ dream come true. It is our mission to give them the best gaming experiences.

campaign.story:
It’s time for the Selection Committee of the Animal Kingdom to choose the new monarch to rule over all. Now it’s up to you to appease the five council members on the Selection Committee to win the Regency. The catch...each Committee member is appeased in a different way, so you must choose wisely as you can only appeal to one each Age.
Roar and Write is a competitive press-your-luck game about impressing different council members on the selection committee, garnering favor throughout the five kingdoms, and completing your own personal objectives to rise to the top of the selection committee's choices for the new ruler of the Animal Kingdoms.
Do you have what it takes to impress the Selection Committee over your opposing candidates?
 There are 5 rounds, or ages, during a game of Roar and Write! During each age, all 6 dice are rolled 3 times. 
After each roll, select dice values to add to your council offerings. You may have up to 6 total offerings to appease the conditions of 1 of the 5 Selection Committee cards during each age. 
 You may also add 1 unused die from each roll to one of the Kingdom. A full kingdom rewards you with bonus Prestige Points!
 If you manage to fill an entire row of Council Offerings before the third roll of each age, score bonus Prestige Points for early appeasement!
 At the end of each age, choose a Selection Committee member to appease with your Council Offerings. Choose a unique Selection Committee member during each age for extra prestige points!

updates.update_content:
Mass printing
Printing is complete! We are now waiting on Roar and Write to get on a boat! HOW EXCITING IS THAT?
Print and Play

The pledge manager is now open!
When we launched Roar and Write! over six months ago, we had gotten quotes for shipping and we were pretty confident that those rates would stay about the same. It turns out that the prices for shipping at the fulfillment partner we were going to use have skyrocketed to about 4 times the cost that we calculated them to be.  That meant that we had to find another fulfillment partner to ship out the games, which was not ideal. However, there's good and bad news with this! The bad news is that the shipping does cost slightly more than we originally budgeted for and while we're still subsidizing most of the shipping, we're asking some of you to put in slightly more money for shipping than we had anticipated.  Since this is not what we had advertised, we will give refunds to anyone who prefers that to paying additional for shipping.

Pledge Manager Update
We are happy to announce we have finalized everything in the pledge manager and will be opening it up next week. We appreciate your patience in our release of the pledge manager but we wanted to wait until we were further along in the process to do so. 

Printing Update
First off, we wanted to apologize for not updating sooner! We usually are better about having consistent updates, but with the pandemic and everything else, things are going A LOT slower than normal.

campaign.story:
Your goal in In Too Deep is to personally gather the most Intel on Syndicate operations, but also to gather Evidence of different types. Evidence can be put towards individual success by investigating the three Chapters that make up the game's timeline, or towards a shared pool of Evidence dedicated to foiling the Final Plot itself and preventing the Syndicate from dominating New Dawn City for good. 
Evidence is filed into the Chapter for personal gain, or into the Final Plot to foil the Syndicate's plans as a group!
Each turn, you'll hook into the mind of a criminal, then you'll gain Grip with every criminal you control. As your Grip increases with criminals, you'll gain access to their unique skills, and develop the stamina to extend your turn and accomplish more. 
A player hooks into the Smuggler, and gains enough Grip to activate its unique Skill!
Next you'll put your hooked criminals into motion in the zones of New Dawn City. You can move criminals about, transport crucial items, activate the unique zone powers if the coast is clear, trigger powerful criminal skills if you have enough Grip, manipulate the unsuspecting local security forces, and engage in other activities designed to bring you ever closer to the heart of the Syndicate. 
There are lots of possibilities... the game provides a deep toolkit for achieving your goals!
You'll need to put everything in place for the Syndicate's criminals to carry out their nefarious deeds. When everything has been arranged and a crime is committed, you'll earn Intel and Evidence, and unlock more serious crimes in that storyline. Your presence in the minds of the criminals lets you influence their approach... dangerous behaviour will earn you more Intel on the Syndicate's operations, but it also destroys Evidence and earns you more Dilemmas. 
Side Crimes are simpler but less rewarding. Story Crimes get more complex and more rewarding the further into a storyline the group pushes!
Dilemmas are tricky; they come with tempting rewards, but also dangerous Corruption. At the end of each Chapter you'll be forced to choose half of your dilemmas to keep as Permanent Corruption... the ones you keep could be richly rewarding, but the best rewards come with the most corruption! Losing control could drive you over to the Syndicate's side if you're not careful... and it's hard to know for sure if you are the most corrupt agent!  
You want big rewards but can you risk the corruption? That's the dilemma!
 At the end of the game, the least-corrupt player earns a bonus. The most-corrupt player has gone in too deep, and will suffer a massive penalty... if the plot was foiled! If enough of the needed Evidence has been filed, the plot is foiled and the In Too Deep player suffers the price of their corrupt ways. If the plot wasn't foiled however, that player reaps the benefits of their troubling tactics with no penalty at all. All players cash in their Dilemmas, and when the dust settles, the player with the most Intel wins the game! 
Ready for more? Watch this detailed tutorial video by the inimitable Jon Gets Games!
 Take a look at the writeups and rundowns below from our wide variety of previewers and playtesters!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign comes with its own challenges. We are confident that you will get a game that you’ll be proud to play AND proudly display on your game shelf.

The art and mechanics for In Too Deep are nearly complete. Once this campaign ends we will tie up loose ends and submit print files.

It is always possible that delays occur while a game is coming to fruition. This can happen for various reasons such as manufacturing issues, freight delays, and even importing the games to the various regions of the world, as we have recently experienced during this global pandemic. Although we have budgeted 10 months to bring this game to your doorstep, please know that these delays can change our timeline at various stages. Therefore our timeline is only an estimate. We are working to meet our goal to fulfill the game by the end of May 2021.

We will be using fulfillment partners from around the world so that we can ensure a fast and smooth operation. We have worked with all of these partners many times before, so we are optimistic that everything will go as planned. We have full faith that your games will be delivered to you safe and in a timely fashion.

A note on our track record:

 • Successful and timely fulfillment of 6 projects over 5 years (between Burnt Island Games and our sibling company Kids Table Board Gaming), including the following games: Foodfighters, Problem Picnic, Haunt the House, Endeavor: Age of Sail, Wreck Raiders, and In the Hall of the Mountain King. Unfortunately the Endeavor: Age of Expansion campaign was delayed in some regions of the world due to Covid-19. We found ourselves just entering into our fulfillment phase when the world shut down. Although the fulfillment process continues, even today, we have been open and honest about the process, updating backers often.
 • Wide praise for production quality and gameplay development, as quality products is of the utmost importance to us. 
• Our designers and artists come to In Too Deep with many years of experience.
• Customer service is key to creating a positive backer experience. We are here for you!

OUR REFUND POLICY

We will refund your pledge within 7 days of the campaign’s end, including all fees associated with the campaign. After that period, we will refund your pledge, no questions asked, minus all of the fees associated with the Kickstarter, payment processing, and our pledge manager. These fees cannot be recovered from Kickstarter/our pledge manager after two weeks of the campaign ending. This project is in CAD, therefore, refunds will be processed in CAD.

We want you to be happy! We promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way. If you have any questions, send us a direct message, email us at info@burntislandgames.com or simply comment on the campaign. We will get back to you as soon as we can.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We produce high quality products that have been proven to last. Your game will stay intact for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
Because our games are made with incredibly high quality materials, they will last a very long time. We expect our games to be reused over and over. But at times, game shelves need to evolve. Please hand this game down to a friend, sell it on the secondary market, or donate it to a cause that is near and dear to your heart.
Sustainable Distribution
We choose to use fulfillment partners from all over the world. Rest assured that your game will come from the closest region to you. The less fuel we use to get your game there, the better we feel about sending it to you.
Something else
Burnt Island Games has made a commitment to create the smallest possible carbon footprint we can. We are committed to making the most of this by using a factory that promotes efficiency when printing, only producing materials that are necessary for this game, fulfilling games from your region, and replacing only parts that are absolutely necessary for a complete and flawless game. We don't include rules in multiple languages, instead we ask you to use our digital downloads. We ask that if you need replacement parts, you consider whether or not that part is a necessity to make your game play experience a good one.

campaign.story:
The tabletop tin treasure Mint Works is getting a fresh new spin! Lovers of the game can play in a whole new way: digitally! 
More of a mobile, Steam, or tablet gamer? We have a refreshing new game for you! Try the lightweight worker placement phenomenon that's built a home in hearts across the globe!  
During the game each player will have a limited number of mint tokens, which represent their workers.
Players will use these mint tokens to work locations for effects, like earning more tokens, becoming first player, or buying and building plans.
Plans are built to give a player victory points, extra abilities, or both.
Once a player has at least 7 victory points, play continues until the end of the round, at which point the game ends.
Whoever has the most victory points wins the game!
Screenshot of Mint Works Digital
Digital Features
Players will be able to play Mint Works- in English or Spanish- with their friends or with strangers. Make long road trips more enjoyable with the hot seat option (passing your phone to your friends) or play with your friends in app. Great while social distancing or between game nights! 
Players will also have the option to play with strangers instead of their friends. Can't sleep? Waiting for your name to be called at the dentist? Get in a game or two of Mint Works Digital with fellow gamers also looking to add a dash of fun to their day. 
In addition, players can easily play solo. Try playing against our bot! The bot we created for this program will simulate a live player, and keep gameplay fresh. Want something different in your solo play? If the stretch goals are met, classic A.I. Characters from the tabletop game- Sonic, Rachael, Mort, and Justin- will all be ready to play, whenever you are.  
 $5 Pledge Level: Mint Works Mobile- Pledge $5 and get a digital download of Mint Works for IOS or Android.
 $10 Pledge Level: Mint Works Steam- Pledge $10 and get a Mint Works Steam Key. 
 $15 Pledge Level: Mint Works Double Digital- Pledge $15 and get a digital download of Mint Works for IOS or Android, and a Mint Works Steam key. 
 $25 Pledge Level: Mint Works Pin & Play- Pledge $25 and get a digital download of Mint Works for IOS or Android, a Mint Works Steam key, and two exclusive enamel pins, the Mint Works logo and one The 'Unboxed Games' logo.   
Shipping 
Pledging at the $25 level does not include the shipping cost. Shipping is $5 in the US and $8 for international shipping and will be charged after the campaign. 
 $11,000: Our first stretch goal, when unlocked, will allow players to select various music options in game. 
 $13,000: $19,000: Our next four stretch goals, when unlocked, will allow players access to new A.I. characters to play against, Justin (13k) Rachel (15k), Mort (17k), and Sonic (19k).
 $21,000: Our sixth stretch goal, when unlocked, will allow players to have access to leaderboards. 
 $23,000: Our final stretch goal, when unlocked, will allow us to include the 1st promotional pack created for Mint Works; 'David the intern' (A.I.) and 'Work Study' (Location).  
 Rachael Blaske Trying Mint Works Digital  
 Reviews of the tabletop sensation Mint Works 
"A twenty minute Euro is hard to make, and even harder to make fun. This game delivers all that and more in a nifty little package."
         - MHGreenleaf,  From Board Game Geek
"This game is easy to learn but difficult to master, and playing with different groups of people can be refreshing, as there is not a "one strategy wins" phenomenon going on. There's a bit of strategy and thinking ahead required but not enough to make playing with a person with AP (analysis paralysis) unbearable, allowing gameplay to go around pretty quickly. The presence of four Advanced Locations also gives the game an element of replayability."
           -Alice Y., From Board Game Geek 
"The solo AI in this is surprisingly intuitive to navigate, and provides an interesting mix of challenges. Each one of them plays a little differently from the others, and might even bring about alternate losing conditions for the player. I have felt adequately challenged in all but one of my plays so far in this one, and some of them have forced me to adopt strategies and planning that I otherwise wouldn’t consider in a multiplayer game. You have relatively perfect information as the player, since you know where and how they should place, as well as which plan they would prioritize taking from what is offered."
        - David Wiley, From Board Game Geek  
The original Mint Works Kickstarter was 1783% Funded! 6,654 backers pledged $89,165 to help bring this project to life in 2017.  

 Mint Works is currently in it's third print run, and available in over six languages around the world.  

Dice Tower Review Of Mint Works With Tom Vasel. 
Rahdo Runthrough, Final Thoughts of Mint Works (with James Hudson)  
 Our Story: Unboxed Games  
We are a team of designers dedicated to bringing quality tabletop games to screens everywhere. For our first project, we wanted to usher the tabletop delight, Mint Works into the digital world. With the help of our backers, we will perfect a digital version of Mint Works, allowing you to play with your friends, or on your own, all without the need of a tin, table, or even being in the same room! The game will not only be available on mobile, but Steam as well. No matter how you prefer to game, we have an option for you! 
Selecting the first game to share with screens everywhere was not an easy decision. We wanted something simple enough to play with anyone, but deep enough to scratch the true gamer's itch. Something people could play while waiting 20 minutes or for hours. A title that could be enjoyed not only by friends at the bar, but between a parent and child as well. Mint Works not only checked every one of our boxes, but another we weren't expecting. Justin and Rachael Blaske were more than just good to do business with, they were good people. They care, not only about their product, but everyone who plays it. We found magic in Mint Works, and the Blaske family, and wanted to share some of that magic with others. The design for Mint Works  was licensed to us to use in the digital medium, and we are more than excited to share it with you! 
The Mint Works Story 
Mint Works was created in response to the 2015 Mint Tin Design Contest created by R4D6 on BGG. The list of constraints for the competition were as follows:
The game must fit within a mint tin.
That was it! Such a simple constraint, but it gave Justin Blaske the push he needed to come up with a fun idea. Because a mint tin is so easily portable, and designed to be rugged enough to fit in a pocket, he considered making a game that would be good on the go.
Justin thought, 'what would be a good game to carry around in your pocket that isn't typical for that form factor?  Worker Placement would be neat!' So he ran with it. The rules turned out to be fairly simple, Justin then realized he had a portable gateway worker placement game. Mint Works became something you can carry with you on a day to day basis, and use to introduce new people to the hobby of strategic gaming.  
Justin Blaske, Rachel Blaske, and Family

We are so excited to bring one of our favorite games to you on a digital platform. We'd like to once again thank Five24 Labs, and all of our backers who are helping to make our dreams come true!
