updates.update_content:
We're very excited to start fulfilling all of these orders!  We have about 800 orders printed and we are beginning to go through the survey responses, cleaning up the data some, contacting some people about under pledges and putting together the addresses for import to our shipping software!  The first batches of shipments will be in the mail later this week.
Things are going a little bit slower than we had hoped, we've had an explosion of business with our insert sets that we are obligated to meet deadlines for on Etsy & Amazon, we've since pushed back the promise dates on those sites and we're finally caught up there.  The new printers we ordered to cover the demand are delayed due to manufacturing and shipping delays and we've run into issues getting reliable shipments of quality filament right now due to shortages at various places.  We're working our way through the issues though and it looks like the worst of the shipping bottlenecks has been resolved so hopefully it's smooth sailing going forward!  I will definitely not be meeting end of May delivery for all customers though, assuming most everyone will see their clips by the end of June.

This Kickstarter campaign has been a blessing to our family and we're so grateful to all of you for your support!  We're so excited to start the shipping process on these clips and getting them in your hands.  I really can't wait for the day when I see some of these being used at a convention and I can thank you personally!  God bless you all.
As I stated in our last update, I ordered two more printers to fulfill these orders as quickly as I can.  We've printed about 15,000 clips in the past month and we hope to print and ship another 40,000 by the end of May which should get us through all of our orders if everything goes as planned.  I am noticing some hiccups in the availability of printers and plastic, hopefully this trend doesn't get any worse!  We have a basement full of packing supplies and clips and we're just about ready to go on the first batches of shipments.

The world’s first charging and data transfer cable of its kind! Organizing your cables has never been simpler or more addictive. Simple to use and ingenious, SuperCalla will meet all of your OCD needs.  Our "automagic" technology holds the SuperCalla cable in a neat and tidy shape while remaining fully functional and extendable.  Our patent pending design provides easy storing, fast charging, and organized traveling all in the palm of your hands—you will never want to put it down!

We quickly realized that we were fidgeting with our cables for fun as much as they were charging our devices.  We cannot wait to see all the designs our supporters come up with!  Please keep in mind, this product is not only plugged into an outlet when charging, it contains magnets as well.  Please be cautious and keep out of reach of children. Our team researched charging cable standards and what goes into the same cables that come with your devices.  Not so we could duplicate them, but so we could make them better!  We tested hundreds of cables, connection types, magnets and silicone tubes ensuring our cables have superior quality while meeting USB requirements and international safety certifications.

campaign.story:
Wehrlegig Games is coming back to Kickstarter for a new printing of Pax Pamir: Second Edition. From the award-winning game designer of Root, Cole Wehrle brings you into an interactive history lesson about life on the edge of empire.  
In Pax Pamir, players take the role of Afghan political factions in the early nineteenth century. For generations the Durrani Empire held the region together. Now, their authority has collapsed. Rivals both old and new have emerged from the shadows. It’s up to the players to see if a fledgling Afghan state might come into being.
The core of Pax Pamir is simple. Each turn, players will draft cards from a central market and then play those cards. Cards can be used to entrench your position and grant players access to powerful abilities. Throughout the game players will command mighty armies, direct the subterfuge of their spies, and undertake daring political maneuvers.
Players have many tools at their disposal, but the work of forging a new central Asian state is not easy. Players will often need to band together in coalitions. However, only one player will be the winner. As a coalition grows in size, its members will have to fend off internal rivals and secure their own personal dominance.
Pax Pamir takes its subject seriously. The game is the product of over five years of research and draws on a wide range of both primary and secondary sources. For this reason, the game may not be suitable for all groups. It offers an extended meditation on life at the fringes of European power and asks the players to understand the many currents that guided the history of central Asia in the nineteenth century. It is also a deeply interactive game where the path to victory often cuts through the hopes of your opponents. 
For the first print run of Pax Pamir: Second Edition, Drew and I printed as many copies as we could manage. At that time, we weren't sure if there would be much demand for the game after it's release. The game was a labor of love, and we wanted to focus our efforts on making the best game we possibly could. Neither one of us thought that the game would require a second printing so soon. 
But the game's sales after its release were strong, and we began to be flooded with requests for a reprint. Because Pamir is an expensive game to produce, we are once again returning to Kickstarter to raise funds for this new printing.
We're happy to report that there will be only marginal differences between the second printing and the first. A few small typos on some of the card flavor text have been fixed and a couple of very minor clarifications have been added to the rules. Neither of these changes warrant an upgrade kit for any of the printed components.
There will be only one material change. The laser cut ruler tokens proved to be both expensive and hard to decipher, so, for the second printing, we're swapping them with screen printed wooden disks. Anyone who owns the first printing can acquire these by either pledging at the five dollar level or by adding five dollars to either of the other pledge levels. 
We are also thrilled to be using BackerKit again as our pledge manager. Pledge mangers are third-party services that lets you manage your order leading up to fulfillment. After the campaign ends,  you'll be able to see your unique shipping rate and select any add-ons to your pledge on Backerkit.  
 Anyone who wishes to supplement their pledge with any of the add-ons listed below may add that dollar amount to their pledge or adjust their order in Backerkit after the campaign. 
We're happy to be working with Backerkit again to help with your KS pledge and process accurate shipping fees. After the campaign, everyone will be emailed by Backerkit so that we can collect your shipping address and process shipping payment for your finalized order. 
The metal coin add-on contains a cloth bag and 40 single-denomination coins pressed with a period design from the early 19th century (the last struck by the Durrani empire).  Each coin is 25 x 25 x 2mm, small enough to be practical for parsing the market and large enough to have a great feel during play. You can see another picture of the coins here.
We have partnered with several experienced international fulfillment companies to help you get your game as soon as possible. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from a partner hub in the US, EU, China, Canada, or Australia.
The following is a list of cost estimates for shipping 1 copy of Pax Pamir. Keep in mind these are not finalized yet, and the accurate costs will be calculated in the pledge manager according to your address after the campaign wraps up. Shipping will vary from country to country and be calculated using both weight and size. In general, the more copies of Pax Pamir you order, the more shipping will cost. Additional copies will add another 30-50% of shipping cost to your order. 
For folks submitting small orders, like those interested in just metal coins or ruler tokens, shipping will be a fraction of the cost. Depending on your address, most small order shipping will cost less than 50% of the listed rate below. 
If your game store is interested in a retail order, please submit a Retailer Deposit Pledge and a fill out this form here!  This offer is only available to Brick & Mortar retail stores. Proof of status will be required. Bulk discounts not available for group buys or clubs. 
All retailers will be required to place a $50 deposit on Kickstarter to get access to our Retailer Backerkit platform. Your $50 pledge will be credited to your retailer order. Note, you must be a verified retailer to have access to this order platform. All unverified Retail Deposit Pledges will revert to the standard pledge. If you have any questions about Pax Pamir retailer info, check out the order request link and do not hesitate to contact drew@wehrlegig.com
This Kickstarter is for the English edition of Pax Pamir only. However, alongside this edition, we have partnered with several established game companies to help produce editions of Pax Pamir in five languages! If you are interested in more information about these translated editions of Pax Pamir, please click the links below.
All of our language partners have the ability to offer the metal coins since they are being produced at the same factory. So, if you are in their region, you can order the coins directly from our partners.

Furthermore, we are happy to announce that Pax Pamir: Second Edition is now available for free under Creative Commons license BY–NC–SA 4.0. That means we will offer a full, free print-and-play kit of Pax Pamir: Second Edition for download. Anyone can use, remix, and share the game so long as they do not use it for commercial purposes. 
At Wehrlegig Games our objective is simple: publish beautiful games with historical themes that treat their subjects and their players seriously. These are games that make arguments and encourage discussion. They don't shy away from difficult subjects.
Because we know the audience for such games is limited, in order to make sure we produce games up to our standards we have decided to rely on a direct sales model. The vast majority of all copies produced will be sent to Kickstarter backers. Our games are not designed for traditional distribution or retail channels. This means we can spend many more resources on the game's physical production without having to worry about retail viability.
Our next project is the second edition of John Company, which we hope to launch on Kickstarter later this year.
Cole Wehrle is a published writer and game designer who currently serves as a staff designer at Leder Games in Saint Paul. Before working in the board game industry, Cole earned his PhD at the University of Texas. His research concerned the ways that the British Empire influenced narrative structure in the nineteenth century novel. He has presented at conferences all over the world and taught classes on a wide range of subjects, from Rhetoric to American Postmodernism. He is perhaps best known for his historical board games (An Infamous Traffic and John Company),for Root, and for his upcoming game Oath.
Drew Wehrle is the older of Cole's two younger brothers. He has helped Cole develop every game he has ever designed. During the development of the first edition of Pax Pamir, Drew lived with Cole in Austin, Texas and was instrumental in preparing the game for publication. Drew will be handling all of the business and operational elements of Wehrlegig Games, as well as assisting in game development. He previously managed school programs at Chicago Botanic Garden, and as of early 2020, he now helps manage Wehrlegig games full-time. 
Thank you to our collaborators: Abol Bahadori for the action icons illustrations, Josh Berer for the box script design, Alex Singh for the wonderful video, Travis Hill for the rulebook support, Ross Connell for the lovely photos, David Carter for the extra customer service, Ben Kyo and AgentElrond for the digital implementations, and all the Backers that help bring our projects to life.

campaign.story:
Is there anything more wasteful than legal notepads? (Before you answer, remember you are under oath). The original legal pad design hasn’t been revisited since 1888! No wonder it’s the 21st century and the most widely-used writing surface can’t connect to the digital universe and is a doomsday device for trees. 
Legal pad users everywhere should be held in contempt! Until now. The Rocketbook Orbit is an endlessly reusable, customizable, cloud-connected pen and paper notepad.  
Magnets + Modularity = Magic! The Orbit utilizes customized “Page Packs” that can be removed from the pad! Our new technology uses a magnetic base and has stainless steel rings attached to every pack of Rocketbook pages that can be lifted off the Orbit, flipped 360 degrees, and changed out for a brand new mission.    
For your core mission, we’ll equip you with a Page Pack so you can write and sketch at the speed of light, then flip the page for your next objective. A standard lined / dot-grid combo Page Pack is included! But what about other page templates to fulfill all your handwritten needs, like planning the future, conquering your tasks, or writing a fierce space ballad? We’ve got you covered at every phase.
The Orbit uses patented Rocketbook reusable pen and paper technology and is forged with a hard plastic composite with a textured synthetic outer layer so the vessel that protects your notes will last for lightyears to come.     
What is your favorite force in the Universe? Ours is magnetism, which is why we designed the world’s first magnetic binding system. Orbit “Page Packs” are bound with ferrous metal rings and stick to a magnetic pad. That also means the entire Orbit happens to stick to your fridge. 
Rocketbook’s patented technology means the Rocketbook Orbit is designed for endless reusability. First, use any Pilot FriXion product on your Rocketbook Orbit pages for a traditional handwriting experience. Then, simply use a damp cloth to wipe your pages clean again and again! We’re including a Rocketbook microfiber towel for truly advanced erasing capabilities.   
Did you know you will consume an entire tree with an average lifetime use of legal pads? Don’t be a weapon of mass tree destruction. It’s not cool for our planet … not to mention that ordinary, one-use legal pads just don’t look cool. Rocketbook’s mission is to eliminate all the boring and wasteful single-use writing products from the galaxy (don’t believe us? We blogged about it … so yea, it’s pretty legit).      
Make no mistake, the Rocketbook Orbit doesn’t only exist in the analog world! First, use your Rocketbook Orbit and Pilot FriXion pen to jot down your notes and big ideas. Then download the free Rocketbook app. When you scan your pages with the app, the space-age machine vision will “see” your handwriting and quickly capture your notes from any angle.      
The free Rocketbook app will instantly adjust and visually enhance your notepad scans to ensure the digital version is light years ahead of the real thing.        
In the app, you can also assign 7 shortcut symbols to "destinations" in the cloud. These destinations can be a folder inside Dropbox, Evernote, Google Docs, an email address, and many other popular services.   
Control the internet with your pen. Use these 7 shortcut destinations to send your notes, diagrams, and big ideas to the cloud at the speed of light! You can even send to shared folders that your teammates have access to!   
The Rocketbook app can even transcribe your handwriting with OCR or “Optical Character Recognition” technology. Transcription allows you to send a digital text version of your notes without ever having to type a single word. OCR also gives you the power to search through all your scans with keywords and phrases. You can even auto-name your files by using the special Smart Title Bar at the top of every Orbit page. Traditional legal pads just can’t keep up! 
Set up the Rocketbook app to instantly beam your notes, diagrams, and big ideas. And save precious time by transcribing your handwriting with our powerful optical character recognition technology. For more information on our OCR features, fly over to the Rocketbook Launch page
Customers & Duties Information For International Orders
We cannot mark as gift, this is illegal so we will not be able to do this.
Our prices do not include VAT, GST or other country taxes.
As many of you know, our terms of sale are CIF destination. This means that we pay all freight, but none of the duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Kickstarter.
As many of you know, Canadian Customs are very strict on products imported into Canada. All products over Canadian $25 are subject to duties and GST or Vat tax. Our invoices are in U.S. dollars, and being converted to Canadian dollars for purpose of duties and taxes, by Canadian Customs.
Here's a link to find the CBSA offices where you can actually go and do the clearance, and save some significant dollars:
http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/do-rb/services/lvs-efv-eng.html

campaign.story:
Two years ago we set out to design the ultimate cooking and eating utensil.  The result was the original Morsel, a spoon, fork, and spatula in one awesome utensil. We ended up shipping over 18,000 Morsel Sporks to 5400+ backers.
Now we're back with Morsel Metal - an ultralight metal and high-temp silicone spork. 
Why? Because you asked for it.
WHY METAL?  
You gave us the idea!  We heard from countless fans of the original Morsel that we needed to offer a metal option, so we decided to make it happen. After stumbling down a rabbit hole of ultralight metals, we decided that 7075-T6 aluminum was the only choice.
We’ve improved on our original design by swapping plastic for hard anodized 7075-T6 aluminum and a fully wrapped high-temp silicone spoon.
Did we mention it comes in four different flavors?
Choose from 7.5 inch or 10.5 inch lengths.
Available with our signature silicone spoon, or our ultralight all-metal design.
Oh yeah, we also designed a carrying case made from recycled ocean plastics.
Our bespoke carrying case features a magnetic closure.


Morsel Metal's signature asymmetric shape fits where other utensils fail, so you can scrape every last bite, every time.
Morsel Metal's fork is designed for serious forking. We never understood the use of itty-bitty tines at the end of a spoon. The spork world deserves better, so we're here to deliver.
Length matters when you're sporking.



Morsel's silicone spoon conforms to fit whatever you eat out of.
Morsel Metal's spoon is wrapped in a high temp silicone. Perfect for cooking, scraping, and even using at home in your kitchen. It's durable, tough, and designed to last a lifetime.
Show off your skillet skills.



WHY ALUMINUM?  
Compared to titanium,  7075-T6 aluminum has a better strength-to-weight and stiffness-to-weight. Basically, it's stronger and lighter. 
Morsel Metal's hard anodized coating acts as an ultra-hard, ultra-durable skin to protect and seal the metal. 
7075-T6 Aluminum is used in the construction of airplanes, bicycle frames, and now, finally... Sporks. 



How light? Morsel Metal is one of the lightest utensils out there!  Our lightest Morsel Metal weighs in at a featherweight 0.5 ounces.
Function #42 - Great for cracking open a cold one when your fingernails are thrashed. 






Stretch Goals are extra funding targets that will allow us to offer new options - and even give away free stuff - IF we're wildly successful.
If we hit $200k we'll offer a limited edition Rainbow Spork.
And if we hit $300k we'll give a FREE CASE to all of our backers!
Do you really want a rainbow spork AND a free case?
Help us meet our $300k stretch goal by spreading the word to food-eaters and spork enthusiasts everywhere!



How Did We Get Here?
Designing stuff isn't easy, and making stuff is even tougher. We knew our last Kickstarter would be a massive undertaking, but we managed to pull it off, shipping our rad sporks to over 5000 spork enthusiasts around the world. Since then we've been hard at work building Morsel's community and talking to our fans to learn what they love, and what they lust for.
Check out these beautiful 3D models!
When our Morsel fans requested a metal and silicone model, we knew we would be in for an adventure. The last year has been a wild ride between ideating, designing, prototyping, testing, and figuring out production. We've traveled to trade shows, visited factories, and even tried sporking while jumping out of an airplane (it was messy).
Our sporks have been used at summer camps for the disabled, and while rowing across the oceans for ALS. We've hosted beer-and-food fundraisers for outdoor nonprofits, and handed out free sporks to new friends like sweet spork candy. We've loved all the positive feedback and encouragement we've received from the community, and if all goes well we're here to stay.
This Kickstarter is the result of a year's work, getting all the countless pieces in place to hit that launch button. 
We're finally here, we're excited, and we're glad you're here with us helping make Morsel Metal a reality.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be Morsel's 2nd Kickstarter campaign, and our team's 4th crowdfunding campaign overall. Our last Kickstarter successfully shipped over 16,000 sporks to our 5400+ backers, and since then we've shipped thousands more to spork enthusiasts around the world. Armed with the knowledge and experience from our previous campaigns, we've spent the last year focused on challenges like Production, Tooling, Fulfillment, Communication, and Customer Service.

With our team's combined 20+ years of product design and engineering experience, we spent the last year optimizing Morsel Metal for production manufacturing. We've traveled far and wide to visit and evaluate the factories that we'll be using for production - factories that produce kitchenware en masse for other popular household brands. And we've sat down with the production engineers at our factories for detailed discussions about our production processes because we want to ensure that everything goes off without a hitch and the end result is a quality product that our backers will be excited to use.

Will there be surprises along the way? Quite possibly. But that's the nature of launching any new product. The good news is that we've successfully navigated this road before, and we've got the expertise to quickly tackle any challenges that may arise.

Hi Backers,

As most of you have already guessed, the sporks have not shipped out yet.  We're still waiting on an updated timeline, and we'll pass that along as soon as we get some more information.  

Unfortunately, the issue with the anodizing was harder to correct than we originally thought.  They are having trouble keeping color and quality consistent.  Below you'll see the a few different variations of what they are producing compared to what they should be matching.  The darker spoon is the standard, with the lighter two being what they currently are able to produce.  Even between the two lighter versions, we're seeing some variance.

Hi Backers!

The manufacturing facility ran into a snag with the anodizing process that resulted in minor discoloration of some batches. They've corrected the problem and have now completed enough sporks to cover all of our backers.  This still leaves us with the over-molding process to complete.

Hey all,
We just wrapped up our weekly meetings with the manufacturer and are still on track to ship by the end  of the month.  We're currently working on logistics to get the finished sporks here as quickly as possible.  This means we'll be air-shipping your sporks here to the US to potentially save us WEEKS of transit time.  To put this in perspective, it's been quoted to take  3-7 days for your sporks to arrive rather than 5+ weeks by boat.  By the end of the month, they will ship from China to the US. They will then have to pass through customs and be received by our distribution partner.  This process can take only a few days or up to a couple weeks.  Unfortunately we don't have much control over this.  From there, they will start to ship out across the US and the globe.  Best case scenario, we'll start shipping the sporks out to you the first half of April.  Most likely, customs will take their time and it'll be closer to the end of April.  From there, it depends on your proximity to California, as that's where we'll be shipping from.

Hi Backers!

I know it's been awhile since our last update.  We just had our first meeting since CNY with the mfg team last night(3/3).  We're still on track to ship this month!  We were told that they would be shipping 3/20-3/30 and that is still the case.  And to clarify, this is when they'll be shipping from China to our HQ.  From there,  we'll be shipping them out to you all.

Hello all!

Chinese New Year is upon us.  For those of you who aren't familiar with CNY, it's a 16-day national holiday that essentially shuts down all business within the country.  It's a time for people across China to go home and visit their families.  Our manufacturing partner, along with others, will be closed for almost the entirety of February.  We had hoped to complete manufacturing prior to the holiday, but unfortunately that wasn't in the cards.  The reason is still complications due to COVID and backlogged anodizing factories.

campaign.story:
Lawyer Up funded on Day 1 in less than two hours! We have fully stretched the game to perfection unlocking 15 Stretch Goals along the way that have upgraded all of the components, added some additional backstory cards, some mini expansions, a solo mode and expanded the Art Forgery case into a deeper experience.  We are looking forward to supporting Lawyer Up with a bunch of new case expansions down the line!
Click the 'Late Pledge' button above and you'll be able to pledge/pre-order via Gamefound. Remember, this option will only be available for a limited time so act fast!
If you miss the Gamefound.com pledgemanager, you can visit our online store at https://shop.rockmanorgames.com to place a preorder (or just buy the game if it's available)
If you have any questions, be sure to check the FAQ or our most recent Kickstarter updates before messaging us directly!
Meticulously designed and developed by Samuel W. Bailey (Forbidden Stars, Talisman: Cataclysm) and Mike Gnade (Maximum Apocalypse, the Few and Cursed) over the last 4 years, Lawyer Up is an asymmetrical two-player courtroom drama card game where one player is the noble prosecution and the other the steadfast defense. Each game begins with the Discovery phase, where players draft vital evidence to support their case and bury evidence that might help their opponent. Next comes the Trial phase, where players call witnesses and play powerful arguments along with the evidence they drafted into their examination pools. To form a coherent line of questioning, players will need to chain together their cards by matching bias symbols. The player who can best examine the Witness by generating the most influence will spend the difference to sway the Jury to their side. Every game is different, but the lawyer with the best case and most convincing arguments will be sure to get the verdict they are after!
The core game includes the base decks for both the prosecution and defense along with all the other components (jurors, bias tokens, etc) you need to play any case of Lawyer Up.  The core set also features two unique cases to play: The Art Forgery Case and the Murder Case.
The Art Forgery Case is a shorter case (6 Witnesses instead of 9) that focuses on learning the arguments and procedures in the base Prosecution and Defense decks.  It is all about drafting the paintings from famous Dutch painters and using the right evidence to replay them from discard piles.
The Murder Case is your modern Law and Order murder trial.  Jessica Fairmount was found standing over her father, covered in his blood, but insists that she was only trying to save him. The wealthy socialite has a lot to gain with her father's murder, but did she do it? This case features major asymmetry between the Prosecution (who can lock jurors to their side) and the Defense. The Prosecution must get all the Jurors to believe she is guilty while the Defense only needs one Juror to believe in her innocence for reasonable doubt.  
Lawyer Up is divided into two phases, the discovery and trial phases.  The discovery phase is a drafting phase representing both attorneys working back at their offices going through all the evidence of the case. During this phase, players simultaneously draw 3 cards and add one card to their deck, one card to their opponents deck and bury the last card.  This means that every time that you play a case, your deck will be unique.
Players will not only draft unique decks, they will also select their legal strategies and Witnesses.  The trial phase of the game is typically made up of 9 rounds of witness examinations. During this phase, players take turns calling witnesses and chaining together legal arguments fighting to win the witness and influence the jury.
You can only play cards from your hand that share at least 1 symbol with the card previously in your Examination.  You can't jump from legal argument to an emotional one, because that would confuse the jury.
As you win witnesses, the jury will be swayed more and more to your side.  Each case can have slightly different win conditions, but in general whoever wins the most witnesses will have the jury on their side and win the case.
For the first time ever, Rock Manor Games has two deep thematic expansions already developed and available as part of this campaign!  Each expansion offers up new mechanics and win conditions - while staying true to the drafting and easy to learn card play of the core game.
Between February 1692 and May 1693 more than two hundred people were accused of being witches in colonial Massachusetts. This case takes a look at this infamous time in America's history, where mass hysteria is taking hold of the judicial system.
The Witch trial features over 80 unique illustrations by Abigail Larson whose art beautifully captures the time period.  The Witch Trial does away with the jury and is instead lead by an angry mob who is ready to hang anybody they believe is a witch. The goal of the Prosecution is to hang 3 witnesses as witches before they run out of cards.  The defense is scrambling to keep the mob under control and prevent a full blown witch hunt!
This case transports you back to Atlantic City in the 1920s where Carmine Monacelli is put on trial for conspiracy to violate the National Prohibition Act.  Carmine is accused of operating a network of criminals involved in bootlegging, murder, gambling and more - but he's a powerful man in AC so it's going to take more than some Federal Prohibition Agents to take down this Godfather. 
The Godfather expansion features over 80 unique illustrations by Nabetse Zitro and introduces a Dossier deck. As players win witnesses, they are able to reveal or discard the top card of the Dossier deck.  The prosecution needs to prove Carmine's Mafia connections by revealing these Dossier cards while avoiding the powerful criminal activities such as "Jury Tampering" and "Swim with the Fishes" that the defense has shuffled into the deck.  
While these expansions are planned for retail release, we plan on spreading out their release over a few months.  Kickstarter backers will get everything first! well before any of it enters retail and distribution.
 Tons more previews in the playlist below!
Retailers 
We love to work with retailers from all around the world. Brick and Mortar Retailers who back at our retailer pledge will receive an early demo copy of the Art Forgery case to promote Lawyer Up in their store.  The demo copy will be ordered shortly after the campaign ends and produced in the USA with the Game Crafter (most of the videos above feature such a prototype).  The shipping associated with this pledge is for the prototype only.  All orders for the actual game will be handled outside of Kickstarter.
Someone from Rock Manor Games will contact you after the Kickstarter to help you with your personalized order.  Retailers are NOT required to pay for their orders upfront, we simply invoice you for your order and ask that you pay the invoice before Kickstarter fulfillment commences (~6 months later).
If you're an online retailer or simply not interested in contributing on Kickstarter, signup as a retailer here. We will email you closer to our retail release so that you can get Lawyer Up into your store.
Group Pledges
We do not have a specific Pledge Level for Group Pledges and plan on handling this in our Pledge Manager.  If you have a group of friends and are looking to pledge for at least 6 copies of Lawyer Up, message us on our website at rockmanorgames.com/contact and select the Subject "Group Pledge".  You will need to make sure you pledge for at least 1 base game here on Kickstarter and then we will import you as a group pledge into the pledge manager after the campaign is completed.
When our pledge manager is sent out via email, you will be asked to fill in your address and you will be charged for shipping at that time.  You must fill out the pledge manager and pay for shipping to receive your reward.  We know that high shipping costs are the worst, so we are offering a $5 shipping discount to all of our Kickstarter Backers. Here are our estimated shipping costs for this project. Keep in mind these are just estimates based on our 2020 shipping rates and costs could change based on a variety of circumstances.
1: Lower 48 States
2: Canada, Hawaii and Alaska
3: Andorra, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, and Switzerland
 4: Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam 
 5: Rest of World does not include Afghanistan, Brazil, Bolivia, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Niger, North Korea, Russia, South Africa, Syria, Somalia, Yemen. 
We have key fulfillment partners in the US, Canada, Australia, China and the EU and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT. We have typically shipped EU rewards from a German depot. For this campaign, it's possible we may ship UK rewards from within the UK if necessary We'll make this decision as we get closer to fulfillment, based on the fees/customs/taxes after Brexit has occurred.  If you have any specific shipping questions before pledging, please message us on Kickstarter.
About the Team
Game published by Rock Manor Games, owned and operated by Mike Gnade. Learn more at https://rockmanorgames.com or follow us on facebook, instagram, youtube or twitter.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are fortunate to have gone through the Kickstarter process many times before and have consistently delivered our games to backers before our estimated delivery date. We attribute a lot of this speed to getting all of the core artwork completed upfront and have done the same with this project. We pride ourselves on communicating with our backers and impressing them by meeting deadlines and delivering an excellent product. Check out our past Kickstarter projects for samples of our transparency, process, and products.

REFUND POLICY
All pledges can be refunded within the 2 week post-campaign window via Kickstarter, no questions asked. Any refund requests after the 2 week post-campaign window has elapsed will be refunded via Paypal minus Kickstarter and Credit Card fees. No refunds will be given after shipping labels have been batched and prepared in preparation for fulfillment. We may at our sole discretion provide you with credit in our web store equal to your pledge amount if we are contacted after fulfillment has begun.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

You are responsible for confirming your pledge, address and other information required to ship your reward to you in a timely manner. If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our invitation via email, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

You are responsible for following our updates and tracking your shipment. If you do not contact us within 6 months of our update announcing that reward fulfillment has been completed, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

When you confirm your pledge, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your reward as entered into our pledge management system and agree that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment. Furthermore, you agree that when shipping to countries other than those specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, we suggest that you contact us before pledging and/or reconsider your participation in this campaign. Thank you.

Asia

I'm titling this update part 1 because I know we will have another update with more details in the next few weeks.  Games have been arriving at ports and there are a lot of emails out there waiting for responses and updates on coordinating everything.  I expect to receive direction from Funagain Logistics on fulfillment very soon.  Last week, games for the EU and USA both arrived at port.  Tracking things from Ocean Freight to Warehouse is a bit tricky.  Typically, we don't get specific details until games have cleared customs and been received and unloaded at the warehouse.  We haven't gotten any receiving reports so far, but expect to get them this week.
I'm happy to report that I have much better news for this month's update.  Our Watch it Played video should be going live on their channel later this week.  Here's a sneak peek:

I'm going to start the update with all the bad news.  
Progress Update
It's been a pretty frustrating month.  I attended a 2.5 hour UK VAT webinar and learned practically nothing.  In fact, all it reinforced was that no one knows what's going on. updates.update_userinfo: January Update: BGG's Most Anticipated Games of 2021!
updates.update_content:
Welcome to 2021, everyone! We hope your new year was full of joy and games! 
BGG - Most Anticipated Games of 2021
For the past several years, there has been a "Most Anticipated" list curated by fans on BoardGameGeek. Nominations are closing any day now and Lawyer Up is hanging onto its nomination by a thread, so we'd love your nomination and vote (just hit the thumbs up):

With the holidays, things have been very crazy trying to coordinate everything.  We are currently trying to book containers and ocean freight and hope to have the games on the water very soon.  I will do my best to provide ship names and time frames when we get all the shipping lanes straightened out.  It is our goal to start fulfillment in late January but that is very dependent on booking ocean freight which is apparently very stressed at the moment because of the holidays and COVID.
Estimated Timetable

BREXIT / VAT reckoning for the UK
Let me start off with some very bad news for UK backers going forward.  I just received freight shipping quotes and importing in the UK is 10x more expensive than importing into the EU.  We're talking ~$25 per copy of the game big.  I thought it was a typo and they added an extra zero.  After talking to 2 different UK fulfillment partners, I have discovered that not only was the quote correct but it's the result of some BREXIT policy changes with VAT calculation that start January 2021.  TLDR your government requires us to prepay 20% VAT on the MSRP.  That leaves us in the predicament of either shipping everything from the EU (and having you deal with VAT/customs/import etc) or figuring out a way to invoice and collect the VAT fees for each UK backer and then shipping from within the UK.  I'm currently investigating ways to best handle this unfortunate reality.  I feel the best result would be to figure out a way to invoice everyone in the UK for the VAT based on their order so it can ship UK friendly, but we could also just ship from the EU and see how it goes (no one really knows with BREXIT looming).  I'm open to suggestions on the best way to handle it, please feel free to comment and discuss below.

campaign.story:
Click the image to see all the Destination art on our BGG page
 The All Who Wander Journey Card Pack enriches the game and complicates its strategy. We tested and refined these cards as much as we did the other game elements, but chose not to include them in wide release. They're exclusive for Kickstarter backers because we know you enjoy the added complexity (and not everyone does). They're our way of expressing our gratitude for your support. 
Trekking the World is a route management game where you travel the globe to fantastic destinations, collect souvenirs, and race to become the most seasoned traveler. 
Along the way, you score points in a variety of ways such as by collecting special souvenir sets or traveling to locations indicated on the oversized Destination cards. 
 Each Destination card illustrates a real location on one side and tells you about that location on the other. Playtesters have told us they've planned trips based on these cards.
There's a variable setup. Each game, you set out two randomly chosen "Journey Cards" which alter the rules in different ways. They ensure every game is different.

Setup only takes 3 minutes:
Click to Read
We'll translate the rules into French, Spanish, and German after the campaign ends and send them to backers as PDFs before they receive their games. The game itself is largely language-independent.
Our goal is to make games that spend more time on tables than shelves. No big rulebooks, no long setups, no hoping you might someday play that game you bought if only you could find new friends and ten more hours per week.
18 months ago, we published our first game with this philosophy, Trekking the National Parks, which has since sold more than 80,000 copies. 
Trekking the World is a sequel, but not a re-skin. Charlie Bink, the designer of both games, studied what folks liked and disliked about Trekking the National Parks, then created a new system about world travel based on what he learned, to amplify the good and avoid the bad. 
In fact, Charlie has been developing and refining his travel game system for 6 years now. When you play Trekking the World, we think you'll agree it shows.
See Never Board Gaming's video in the Game Preview section below for more about the differences between Trekking the World and Trekking the National Parks. 
We believe passionately in keeping our campaign simple: one pledge level and no stretch goals. Time we could’ve spent creating and managing a complex campaign, we instead used to polish gameplay and make high-quality components. Campaigns end but games are forever, so we owe it to our customers to put all our energy into the game itself.
If you want to see more campaigns like this, please share this one.

Risks and challenges
We’re a team of game industry professionals with experience making and selling board games at scale. 

Unlike most board game publishers, we sell most of our games directly to customers and retailers online. Because of that, we’ve built our business around solving the kinds of fulfillment challenges Kickstarter campaigns present. 

We’ve chosen to run a simple campaign not just to focus on perfecting the game, but also to reduce the chance of fulfillment and production problems. Having only one pledge level, no stretch goals, and no add-ons dramatically reduces the chance for error. 

Key challenges:

Coronavirus, which is causing delays in manufacturing and shipment from China, where Trekking the World will be made. Our manufacturer reassures us that the production schedule has not been affected. Nonetheless, we’ve built an extra cushion into our fulfillment timeline to hedge. Our minimal campaign structure will also help us in this regard. 

Missing/broken components, and cards with printing errors. We’ll replace them for free. Use the form on this page to request replacements: 

https://www.underdoggames.com/pages/refunds-customersupport

I'm going to keep it short and sweet. But basically for the last 24 Months I have been reviewing lots of kitchen gadgets with the aim to put together product that I would want to use. It took a long time and I put what money I could into the stock, but eventually the Barry Lewis Veggie Prep Kit and Baking Mats, were born! 
Demand was bonkers, they sold out in the UK & USA within 5 hours. My aim is to slowly grow my brand and use kickstarter to make sure I don't run out of stock again and also help me develop the next batch of products! 
The kickstarter exists for two reasons:
1. To help me fund the stock for veggie kits, with new features.
2. To help fund my next product - a cake kit, featuring a turntable / stand as seen in my videos.
The rewards are simple - if you want a veggie prep kit or cake stand / turntable, back it, then when the campaign ends I know what to order and will ship them out!
As an exclusive to Kickstarter any Veggie prep kit or cake kit backed here can be shipped Internationally with the option for it to be signed! Just make sure to select that option when ordering. 
This really is the start of something awesome. I aim to use kickstarter to help us grow and create more product over time, this is all just new to me, but very exciting. 
I'm not a big corporation or anything. I just want to help people and this is all very bonkers, but lets see what happens!
Barry

campaign.story:
Tumble Town is a town and engine building spatial puzzle game for 1-4 players in 45 minutes where each building you construct grants you either a dice manipulation power, engine building skill, one time use ability, or additional scoring conditions. 
Back now to get a free mini expansion with Tumble Town! This offer is only for Kickstarter backers, so don't miss out! 
Watch the Runthrough in the How to Play Section
Everyone knows Tumble Town deserves to be the best town in the West - so it needs a mayor to match! The Tumble Townspeople are hosting a competition to turn the town tootin’ and boomin’! It’s up to you to impress them with your construction and planning skills!
In Tumble Town players are rolling dice, constructing buildings, and competing to make the best town in the West.
 Dice Manipulation & Engine Building: Each building you construct gives you more powers and options. Certain buildings can let you manipulate the dice, making it easier to continue constructing! Other buildings can generate dice or give extra scoring objectives. 
 Spatial Puzzle: Place your constructed buildings along Main Street to create your town. The townspeople want a specific look for the town and if you meet their requirements, you'll gain even more votes from the townspeople!
 Added Scoring Conditions: Construct the right buildings and you can gain more scoring conditions as the game progresses! These can include the size of your constructed buildings, the animals and plants near your constructed buildings, or even the types  of buildings constructed by your neighbors. 
Can you build the best town in the West?
            ULTRA EDITION TIER WOODEN BOX
Ultra Edition Wooden Box Design is Not Finished. Final Version May Look Different.
 Below is a How to Play video:
Rahdo does a Runthrough below: 
Tumble Town Overview
In Tumble Town, you are a mayor trying to best meet the needs of the townspeople by constructing the buildings they desire. Your goal is to have satisfied the townspeople by the time the building materials run out. You make the townspeople happy by constructing buildings, placing the constructed buildings on Main Street in the best formation, and making the townspeople care about other aspects of their town, like the cacti and windmills. 
Each building plan requires certain building materials (die colors) and has restrictions on what die values are needed. 
Each turn goes through a series of four phases: 
1. Claim (take a card)
2. Take Dice + Roll
3. Construct + Use Powers
4. Place + Discard Extra Dice
Claim a Building Plan
You can choose any of the 12 available building plans. You might choose a building plan based on the materials you currently have to build, the benefit that the building gives you when you construct it, the point value, or for the icon it has. 
Take Dice and Roll
You may now take the dice shown on the stack of the cards in the row of the  building plan you choose. 
Construct and Use Powers
Now that you have dice and a building plan, you can construct a building! You may use any of the powers from either your constructed buildings or your horse to help you manipulate your dice into what the building plan requires. 
Place and Discard Extra Dice
Once you construct your building, it's time to place the building on Main Street. You can gain points by matching the criteria on Main Street and you can also get points by making alleys between buildings. 
You may only carry over dice that fit into your Storehouse to your next turn, so if you have more than six, you must choose some to discard back into the supply. 
Game End
Players take turns until the Dice Supply runs out. Once two of the supplies get below two dice, the game end is triggered and all players take an equal amount of turns. 
Scores are tallied and Horses revealed; the player with the most points wins! 
Solo Game
If playing the game solo, you simply choose an Outlaw to play against and start the game! The Outlaw has quick turns and makes the game a race to get the best building materials. There's three difficulties of Outlaw to try and outwit and only the best of the best can win against the Outlaw!
The Solo Missions will give you a point goal and an objective and if you meet it, you move on to the next one. The goals get progressively more difficult as the game goes on.

People sometimes wonder why they should back a Kickstarter campaign instead of waiting to get the game later in retail. The most important reason not to wait with Tumble Town is that even if Tumble Town funds, we currently don't know if Tumble Town will go into distribution. If you wait, you may end up missing out, as we won’t have many extra copies to sell and unless your local store backs the campaign, they won’t be carrying it either.

Most importantly, without you, Tumble Town would not get created.
Tumble Town is a game we truly love and want to share with the world. We've worked on this game for years to make it perfect for you. Tumble Town ties together engine building with spatial puzzles to create a truly unique gaming experience. We love playing and know you will, as well.
We really appreciate your support in making our dream a reality.
We would love to support game stores by offering the Kickstarter versions of Tumble Town to retailers during the campaign. We will be charging shipping after the campaign ends. This ensures you get charged the shipping you deserve. No more, no less.

Please keep in mind these are estimates and there can be slight variations from country to country. Also, the more items you purchase, the more shipping will cost. If you have any questions, please email us at contact@weirdgiraffegames.com.

We are currently considering the UK to be within the EU at this time. We know that shipping will change for the UK in 2021, but the ways that that will change are not currently known. Also, we're hoping to ship in 2020 so that is hopefully not an issue! The estimates on the tier levels include buffer months in case several things go wrong, but that may not be the case.

If you've gotten this far, you are seriously considering supporting us and we really appreciate that. We also want you to know that we take this very seriously.

Although we have already successfully funded and delivered multiple projects on Kickstarter, Tumble Town will have it's own unique issues. We would love if everything went smoothly, but we are also trying to be prepared for any problem that could arise.

Tumble Town will be manufactured by a reputable company but international shipping always has the potential for delays and complications.

If things run behind schedule, we think the best approach is to always be up front and communicative with backers. It's our goal to make post-campaign updates part of this experience and we plan to update monthly until the game has shipped to backers in order to keep backers informed of the progress of Tumble Town.

Fulfilled!
If you have not received your game or are missing parts to your game, please submit a help desk ticket here: https://weirdgiraffegames.freshdesk.com/support/tickets/new so we can try and fix your issue.
Expansion Survey

US Shipments
TLDR: Games could be shipped out tomorrow or they could be in fulfillment for an unknown amount of time due to the pandemic / holidays.
So, the games are at the fulfillment company and have been for almost a month. Why are things taking so long? Honestly, we're not sure as every time we've used this fulfillment company, the turnaround time has been close to 3 days. 
However, we've never fulfilled a campaign during the holidays or during a pandemic. Here in the US, COVID cases just keep rising and I assume that is at least partially why fulfillment isn't happening as fast as we have seen in the past. If people are getting sick and not going to work, that can definitely slow things down, especially during the busy shipping season.

US Shipments 
TLDR: Games should be to you as soon as next week, but could be later depending on how long fulfillment takes. 
The games have gone through quite a lot in the last month!

Shipment Status
The games are now on boats! 
One Harbor, which is going to California. Tracking Link: https://www.marinetraffic.com/en/ais/details/ships/shipid:462669/mmsi:372367000/imo:9302152/vessel:ONE_HARBOUR It was estimated to get to Atlanta on October 25th, but we'll see what happens.

Shipment Status
The plan was for the games to be packed on a boat this week! I should have more updates on that soon. If they do get on the boat this week, they should land in either mid October for the US or late October / early November for the rest of the world. We'll keep you informed as we know more! 
Print and Play

Most of you have filled out the pledge manager! THANK YOU for being on top of things. It's very helpful to have so many of you complete the pledge manager early as it helps with the shipping plan. 
Pledge Manager CLOSING on September 4th
In the previous update, we said the pledge manager would be open until the end of September. HOWEVER, we now want to close the pledge manager earlier than that!

Manufacturing has started! It's set to finish on September 16th and from there, the games will be on their way to the US. 
Pledge Manager
You should now have an email in your inbox with the information needed so you can give us your address and also add on any add-ons that you'd like.

It took quite a bit longer than expected to get in the proof copy of Tumble Town, but we have gotten it! There's definitely some fixes that need to be made and we're not sure on what all needs to be fixed right now as the proof copy immediately got dropped off with a blind playtester and we haven't heard back yet. At this stage, we gave the proof copy as is to the volunteer and they're going to punch all the things, open the cards, and see if they can understand everything there without us being there to explain things. Based on their feedback, we'll clear up anything that went wrong! The goal is to make sure that the game can be learned in the correct way without needing any videos or help from anyone.

campaign.story:
It's back and it's bigger and smaller at the same time
The 2019 report included 2709 projects from 2005 creators all crammed into 300 pages. For 2020 I'm compiling the report quarterly which means a smaller number of projects, probably around 700 and less projects mean I can space everything out more. So now you have more information for more projects at your finger tips.
The feedback I got from the 2019 report was that you wanted the small projects to get the same level of exposure as the big projects. So all of this years projects will get the same quarter page listing, whether they had 2 backers or 10 million. One of the aims I have with the report is to bring more exposure to smaller project creators so this feels like the right way to go.
Each listing will include all the details and images you need to get a real flavour of the project. The images are in high resolution so you can zoom right in for a better look. You get a breakdown of the top pledge levels and the PDF version also includes web links to projects, their creators, websites and social media. Every project is categorised to group similar things together and help you find what you're looking for fast.
You might not realise the real value of the report until you have used it for yourself, so I have created a sample for you to try it out. It's a PDF so you can view it on your computer or tablet, you can zoom in on the pictures, it's fully searchable and crammed with web links. 
The full report will include about 700 projects which end successfully between 1st January and 31st March. I'll be working through the night to get the finished report available for download on the 1st April so you get it bang up to date. If you want to you can pay for the whole year up front. You'll save a bit but also it's done and then you can just forget about it. I'll send a message to remind you when each report is released.
Spring (1st January - 31st March) released 1st April
Summer (1st April - 30th June) released 1st July
Autumn (1st July - 31st September) released 1st October

If you missed the 2019 report you can check out the Kickstarter project or you can buy a copy from DriveThruRPG.

campaign.story:
A Place For The Things That Matter
Introducing the new Geco Hub. The perfect place to keep the things you always need to hand. We need your help to bring Geco Hub to life!
Preorder your own Geco Hub(s) to help us reach our goal, and save money by backing the project early. Scroll down to find out more 👇
With Geco Hub, your things are kept secure, visible and easy to grab at a moment’s notice.
Wouldn't it be cool if you got home from a day at work and all the stuff you have in your pockets - phone, keys, wallet, etc... could just be thrown against the wall and forgetten about? Instead of dropping everything on a counter-top, they can be kept out the way.
Whatever it is, Geco Hub can hold it.
Combining fun and practicality, Geco Hub saves time by keeping your valuables and belongings all in one place and declutters surfaces.
Part storage unit, part notice board, Geco Hub is flexible and adaptable. You can organise your things where you want them, in a way that suits you.
There are tonnes of ways to store items in Geco Hub
Geco Hub's patented flexible matrix adapts to instantly and securely hold your things, whatever shape or size they are. It's quick, fun and intuitive.

Geco Hub separates your important things from the day-to-day clutter and ensures you never have to search for your keys when heading out the door ever again.
Whether it's your e-book reader and reading glasses 👓 by the bed, car keys 🔑 and a shopping list by the door 📝, or your favourite utensils in the kitchen 🥣, Geco Hub keeps your important things in easy reach, so they're there where and when you need them.
Remove surface clutter and keep your belongings safe
Install Geco Hub wherever you find yourself reaching for stuff.
Geco Hub might be small in size but not in spirit. It packs the punch of larger organisers, all whilst staying close to the wall, making it perfect for smaller living spaces. Its small size means it can fit on wall spaces other organisers just can’t too.
I'd like to see you put a shelf on the side of a fridge!
The thing that sucks about wall-mounted storage is mounting the damn thing on the wall in the first place! No need to worry about that with Geco Hub. 
Stick the optional adhesive strips onto the placeholders on Geco Hub's backboard.
Geco Hub installs in minutes with strong, yet removable, adhesive strips (available as an add-on) or using the included screw fixings for something more permanent.
Take off the outer tape and stick Geco Hub on the wall. Easy as 1, 2, 3.
The option of using adhesive strips or screws means you can mount it to tiles, glass, brick walls, plaster walls, wooden furniture and even the side of your fridge. Wherever you want.
Whatever the surface is, chances are you can fix Geco Hub to it.
These optional adhesive strips won’t mark the wall either, keeping you and your landlord happy. If you want to remove them, just pull the tab down and away. They're strong too, meaning you can fill Geco Hub with up to 2.5kg/5lb of things. 
Use the screw fixings included with your Geco Hub to screw it to the wall.
Screw fixings come with Geco Hub as standard, and adhesive strips are an optional extra. To get adhesive strips with Geco Hub just add £3 to your pledge.  
Remove without leaving a mark. These adhesive strips are available as an add-on.
We made an earlier version of Geco Hub a few years ago and it got quite a bit of press. This version is based on feedback from early users and lots of testing so now Geco Hub is better than ever! 
You can read about the earlier version and what's changed further down the page 👇
Want to feature Geco Hub? Download our Media Kit by clicking the button below or get in contact with us at kickstarter[at]version22[dot]com.

If you can spare a second, consider sharing the #GecoHub campaign online and tagging a friend or two who would love their own.
Think about it, you'd be helping the campaign and doing your friends a solid too 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 
You can tile Geco Hub together to expand your storage space as much as you like.
You could fill an entire wall with Geco Hub if you wanted...
What's more, the gap between each Geco Hub becomes another storage space for your things.
The space between two Geco Hubs becomes another storage spot.
Whether you want a small, starter installation of 1 Geco Hub, or the "whole-hog" XL 9 Geco Hub installation, we've got you covered! Check out the rewards further down 👇

As Geco Hub seamlessly tiles together you can install Geco Hub any layout you want.
Whether it's for...
A big, shared hub for the family
A long notice board and organiser for the hallway
Quirky toy storage in the kid's room
... Or something for that awkward space you've been scratching your head over, Geco Hub has it covered 😎
There is no limit to how big you could make Geco Hub. You could fill entire walls! (20 units shown here)
Your wall is the canvas and you're the artist, create your very own piece of functional wall art with Geco Hub. 
Rows, squares, rectangles, zig-zags, a checkerboard. The list goes on...
(Note: this GIF is a digital rendering, as we only had two final prototypes at the time of launch.)

Geco Hub's backboard is made from ABS, the same durable and tough material used in power tool casings, LEGO bricks, the keys on your keyboard, and more. This means it can comfortably live up to the rigours of everyday use.
ABS plastic is used for Geco Hub's backboard.
Geco Hub's round disc and rectangular fins are made from silicone rubber, which is made from silica sand. That's right, sand! Silicone rubber is strong, stain-resistant and easy to clean, it won't deform over time like other rubbers, and has a great "soft touch" feel to it too. It's not cheap, but it is hands-down the best material for the job. 
Silica sand is used to make silicone rubber, the ingredient for Geco Hub's fins and discs.

Still not impressed? Here are 10 extra benefits and features that help make Geco Hub great.
Size it up
We know that it's one thing looking at nice photos online, but another thing entirely imagining something on your wall at home. So here are Geco Hub's key dimensions.
Okay, so we've thrown some numbers at you, want more info? No problem! Here are a few common everyday items stored in Geco Hub so you can get a better idea of scale... 
And finally... the extra details just in case you're interested.


Every little helps in a project like this, so if you're not completely sold on getting yourself a Geco Hub but want to help out with the project anyway, you can pledge a minimum of £1.
Anyone who pledges will receive exclusive access to news and updates about Geco Hub, so you won't miss out on the latest. You'll also receive a digital postcard with a thank you note from the Version 22 Team.

Add-ons
To include one or more add-ons, simply:
1) Sum up the cost of the add-ons you'd like
2) Add this total to your chosen Reward when backing the campaign. 
After the campaign, we will send out a survey so you can confirm your choice. 


Trade
If you're a distributor or retailer interested in Geco Hub we'd love to hear from you, get in touch with us via email at trade[at]version22[dot]com today.


We've delivered three campaigns to date (including an earlier version of Geco Hub), so this isn't our first rodeo.
As with any manufacturing project, however, there are always unknowns that pop out of nowhere. That said, we're confident we can tackle anything that comes our way.
We've already got suppliers lined up for most of the components, and have had manufactures evaluate all of our designs to confirm that they're suitable for mass production, so we don't anticipate any major problems.


You've probably already heard, but we launched an earlier version of Geco Hub a few years ago!
When we launched the original Geco Hub in 2014, we ended up shipping to dozens of countries, solving the problem of lost belongings all over the world! But we weren't done innovating there...
Taking user feedback from this first version, as well as our own experiences designing it, we worked tirelessly to develop the new and improved version you see today.
At 4 by 4 circles, the new version is a little smaller (but rest assured lower in price too!), which makes it even better suited to those small areas around the home that nothing else fits. 
The new Geco Hub is also more versatile with what items it can hold and how it can hold them. 
Finally, the new version is the same colour all over, instead of having a white backboard like the old design. All in all... nothing but improvements!

Prototypes 
As I'm sure you can imagine, we didn't arrive at the final design for Geco Hub right away. In fact, dozens of prototypes and thousands of hours of development have gone into it. He's just a small snapshot of what was involved.


Over the last 5 years, we've successfully funded 3 different products with a total of more than 3,000 backers and shipped to more than 80 countries. We're excited to bring Geco Hub back to life with a new and improved design!
The first Geco Hub had 339 backers and raised £25,106
Nimble had 1,893 backers that pledged a total of £34,757
... and our last project was Mobu with 814 backers that pledged a total of £20,402



At Version 22, we aim to make functional gift and home products which solve REAL everyday problems in ways that make you smile :)
We have successfully launched three different brands through crowdfunding platforms (Kickstarter and Indiegogo), and our product ideas have collected a bunch of national and international design awards between them, and have featured heavily in national and international press too.
We love making things, and will continue doing so... until someone stops us! Thanks for joining us on our latest journey, and we hope to see you stick around for more.
Simon Lyons (Product Design)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've successfully fulfilled three Kickstarter campaigns to date. So we're well versed with the complications and challenges that these projects present.

Though we've had our fair share of unexpected delays (as with almost all Kickstarter campaigns) we've learnt and improved each time and are confident we can deliver Geco Hub by the date given.

The main challenges with a silicone rubber and plastic product like Geco Hub is the tooling process, which takes up a good chunk of the overall schedule, and the logistics involved with moving thousands of components from location to location, so that everything happens where and when it's meant to. That said, we're working with a manufacturing coordinator who we've worked with before, and we are confident in our joint ability to get the job done.

We have already produced test tooling for Geco Hub's silicone rubber fins, and have had the tooling for Geco Hub's other components pre-approved by mold tool designers.

With our background in engineering and design, and 5 years experience manufacturing and shipping products around the world, we're confident Geco Hub will be in your hands in no time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Geco Hub is designed to be durable and long-lasting; a product that becomes part of your home, not something that breaks after a few months. 

Also, all of Geco Hub's parts assemble without glue and are replaceable, so if the worse happens, you can replace just one or two parts and not have to replace the whole thing.
Sustainable materials
All of Geco Hub's flexible parts are made from silicone rubber. Silicone rubber is derived from silicon, the stuff sand is often made up of. Silicon is the 2nd most abundant material on Earth, it's not made from non-renewable petrochemicals like many synthetic rubbers. It won't degrade and become brittle over time like many other rubbers either.

Geco Hub's backboard is made using ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene) plastic. ABS is a very tough and durable plastic often used for the casings of products that need to be really strong, like power tools. Because of this Geco Hub's backboard can withstand last years of rigorous use without needing to be replaced.

Geco Hub's packaging will be 100% plastic-free and made from sustainably sourced card and paper. Even the outer packaging used to ship Geco Hub to you will be plastic-free.
Sustainable Distribution
Geco Hub's product packaging, outer cartons (used for shipping from the factory) and the packaging it's put in to be sent to you will be 100% plastic-free.
Something else
We plan to carbon-offset the production and shipping of Geco Hub to make the whole process carbon neutral. 

This will be done by conducting a study with ClimateNeutral.org to calculate the impact of production, and then investing in carbon capture activities which reclaim the total amount (or more) of carbon produced from the atmosphere. Where possible we will invest in carbon-capture activities which have the most immediate impact.
