campaign.story:
Click to read
LudoCherry is a new kind of geeky clothing, designed to be subtle and stylish so you can wear it anywhere. Each of our five fabrics is an original design inspired by board games and RPGs, created to reference iconic elements of tabletop games while blending in with your everyday wardrobe.
Those polka dots? They're d20s! The floral design? Look closer and you can spot the hidden meeples!
The result is clothing that winks at gamers while still being beautiful pieces that can be worn anywhere, not just at a convention or your local game store.
LudoCherry lets you wear your love for tabletop games on your sleeve, no matter where you are! Whether you're dressing for game night or a night out, your LudoCherry shirt or skirt will be the perfect fit for the occasion. 
But don't just take our word for it! Here's a quick preview from Rodney Smith of Watch It Played that will give you an overview of everything we're about.
Click through to see Ella wearing her Polka Dice skirt!
 Our range includes four original fabric designs that you won't find anywhere else, each available as both a button-up shirt and a circle skirt.
Each of our LudoCherry textiles has been lovingly created to celebrate tabletop gaming, by integrating iconic components from board games into classic patterns.  Dice, meeples, and player pieces can all be found in our designs, but only if you look closely. 
Keep scrolling to see each of our designs up close! 
Click to see LudoCherry Signature close up!
Click to see Polka Dice close up!
Click to see Meeple Garden close up!
Click to see Victory close up!
UNLOCKED: NEW SHIRT & SKIRT DESIGN - "MADNESS"
Inspired by the mystery and madness of Lovecraftian horror, Madness features swirling tentacles and skulls on a rich forest green background. Look closely and you'll see items vital to every aspiring investigator, including magnifying glasses, books, and of course some cryptic occult symbols...
We'd like to thank Chaosium Inc. for granting permission to use the Star Elder Sign in this design.
This design was created by illustrator Mary Haasdyk (who also created the wonderful box cover for the board game Chai)
The Star Elder Sign (Arcane Symbol) design © 2020 Chaosium Inc. Used with permission.
THANK YOU for helping us unlock this design!
Over the next few weeks, we will be printing this design and constructing a sample garment so you can see how it looks on fabric before you commit to choosing it.
Click through to see Mandi wearing her Meeple Garden skirt!
Click through to see Stella wearing Polka Dice!
It's important to us to build a responsible business, by ensuring that the processes creating our clothes aren't exploiting people or the environment.
We're proud to say that our manufacturer is certified by the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) as both ethical and environmentally sustainable.
Click through to see Ross wearing his Signature shirt!
The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) is the worldwide leading textile processing standard for organic fibres, including ecological and social criteria, backed up by independent certification of the entire textile supply chain.
The GOTS environmental criteria requires that all textiles are made of at least 70% organic fibres. It also requires that manufacturers limit potentially toxic ingredients in their dyes and manufacturing processes, and that they have processes in place to limit and treat waste water. Our manufacturer ensures that the water used in the dying process is still clean enough to be recycled for irrigation and other purposes.
The GOTS social criteria requires safe and hygienic working conditions for employees, the payment of living wages, regular and fair working hours, and the right for workers to unionise. It also prohibits child labor, forced labor, discrimination, and harsh or inhumane treatment.
To read more about the GOTS certification and their criteria, please see their website here.
LudoCherry x Level Up Dice
We're collaborating with Level Up Dice to bring you these gorgeous d20s, all inspired by our unique fabric designs! You can add on a dice for $85 AUD (~$55 USD), an exclusive Kickstarter discount from the regular retail price of $60 USD.
These bespoke dice are being individually handmade by the talented Brie of Fortune Feyvours. Each oversized 35mm dice contains a real swatch of our fabric in the centre, so even your initiative roll can match your outfit!
These dice are available in five different designs, one for each of our fabrics! You can see close up photos of them below. For more details about the dice, please see our most recent update here.
Please add $85 AUD to your pledge for each dice you'd like.
Enamel pins
Our adorable D20 cherry logo pins can be added on for $15 AUD (~$10USD). Please add $15 to your pledge for each pin you would like! 
If you'd like to add on more button-up shirts to your pledge, please make sure you're backing at the Shirt Pledge or the Shirt and Skirt Pledge level. For each shirt you'd like to add, please increase your pledge by $70 AUD.
If you'd like to add on more skirts to your pledge, please make sure you're backing at the Skirt Pledge or the Shirt and Skirt Pledge level. For each skirt you'd like to add, please increase your pledge by $100 AUD. 
To quickly figure out which level you should back, and the total amount, please use our pledge calculator below! 
If you're still not sure how to pledge, feel free to message us and we'll get back to you as soon as possible. 
The size charts below will help you find your perfect fit! The best way to ensure we have your size is to find and measure a similar garment that you already own. You can also use the US and UK size equivalents as a guide, but we recommend measuring as well since sizing can be so variable between brands.
Please note that all of the measurements in the charts refer to the size of the garment, not your body measurements. We explain how to use them underneath each chart.
Click through for a larger version
To find your skirt size, you'll need to get your waist measurement! Use a soft tape measure and measure around the smallest part of your waist (above your belly button and below your ribs). For a more detailed explanation of how to measure yourself, please see this link.
The back waistband of the skirt has elastic, and can stretch up to 10cm / 4".
If you prefer a snug fit around your waist, please select a size where your measurement is in the high end of the waist measurement range (For example, a size 14 for an 87cm waist). This means the elastic will be more stretched when you wear it, and will feel firmer.
If you prefer a looser fit around your waist, please select a size where your measurement is in the low end of the range (For example, a size 20 for a 97cm waist). This means the elastic will be more relaxed on you.
Click through for a larger version
To find your shirt size, we recommend measuring a similar button-up shirt you already own and feel comfortable in. Our shirts are semi-fitted, so make sure the shirt you're measuring isn't loose or baggy around the chest and waist.
To find your shirt's chest measurement, lay it flat on a hard surface and measure across the front from one underarm seam to the other. Please watch this video for a thorough guide of how to do this.
Once you have your shirt's chest measurement, round up to the next size in the size chart that will fit you. For example, for a 56cm chest you would size up to a M.
You can also take your shirt's shoulder width and length measurements, if you'd like to make sure that the size you've selected will fit. The videos linked below explain in detail how to do this:
Finding your shirt's shoulder width
Finding your shirt's length
All shipping will be handled in the pledge manager after the campaign is completed. You will be charged separately from your pledge on Kickstarter! 
The chart below is an estimate of the shipping costs, based on your pledge level and your country. Please note that these are in Australian dollars.
 Zone 1: Japan, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Thailand, Vietnam
 Zone 2: US, Canada, UK, Australia, New Zealand, France, Germany, Netherlands, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden
 Zone 3: Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Slovenia, Luxembourg, Norway, Switzerland
 Zone 4: Cyprus, Malta, Iceland
Unfortunately, we are unable to ship to Afghanistan, Cuba, Iran, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Myanmar, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
If your country isn't listed please get in touch with us! We will do our best to get you a shipping estimate. You can message us through Kickstarter, or send an email to hello@ludocherry.com, and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
If you are adding items onto your pledge, each additional shirt will add ~$3-6 shipping and each additional skirt will add ~$5-8 shipping.
If you are planning on ordering a large number of items and would like a more accurate estimate, please get in touch with us!
If you're a retailer interested in stocking LudoCherry in your store, or getting our clothing for your staff to wear to work, please get in touch with us!
You can email us at retail@ludocherry.com, or message us on Kickstarter.
 There are a few reasons! 
The first is that Kickstarter allows us to raise the funds we need to actually make LudoCherry a reality. We’ve already invested a large amount of our personal savings into developing our business, our fabric designs, and our clothing, but the amount of money required for a production run is beyond our reach. With your support, we'll be able to raise the money we need for the production run.
Kickstarter also allows us to solve many of the issues that traditional clothing brands face. Companies often create their clothes in limited size ranges and colours, to prevent profit loss on variations that don't sell. By using Kickstarter, and knowing in advance what our backers will be ordering, we’re able to create a much more inclusive range. We'll be able to order more of the sizes and fabrics that are the most in demand, and reduce our loss on the less popular variations - meaning we can afford to create a wide range of sizes and fabrics for you to wear! 
Finally, Kickstarter allows us to interact directly with our community, and take your feedback and ideas on board. We want you to be as excited to wear LudoCherry as we are, so we want to use Kickstarter as a chance to talk with you about what we're doing well and what we could be doing better.
Finally we'd like to extend a special thanks to some people who helped us make LudoCherry the best it can be.
To James Mathe, Jamey Stegmaier, Daniel Zayas, and Martyn Poole - Thank you for your contributions to the crowdfunding community, and for always being willing to give advice.
To Ted and Toni - Thank you for seeing my passion for the industry, and for all your support.
To Neil Thomson and the Albury Game Club - All of this is your fault.
To my parents - Thank you for always supporting me, even when I gave up politics for game design.
 -Phoebe
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this is our first Kickstarter as a company, we both have years of experience working within the board game industry. Phoebe has worked on 6 successful Kickstarter campaigns through her position as Bezier Games' Social Media Manager (raising a total of over $2.5 million USD).

Mark has worked in film for 6 years as a Producer and Assistant Director. As a result, he is experienced in managing logistics for large scale and complex projects, as well as meeting production deadlines. 

We are confident that our combined experience will allow us to finalise and deliver a high quality project. All of our art is completed, and we have a manufacturer ready to start production after our campaign.

In the event that we receive samples back from the manufacturer that are not up to our standards, we may need to make alterations to the garment design or work with them to ensure a higher quality. However, we have built in sufficient time to our estimated delivery date to allow for this.

As a smaller company, it is also possible for us to be pushed back in the production queue for the manufacturer to prioritise larger brands.

Finally, the ongoing coronavirus crisis in China has the potential to cause delays to our production and shipping. Currently it appears that factories are reopening, but we are not able to tell how the situation will evolve.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Long-lasting design
Our clothes are designed to be high quality statement pieces that will last in your wardrobe for years to come. We're using 100% cotton fabric with a higher than standard thickness, to ensure that the material will last. We're also printing our fabric using digital printing, so the colour will be brighter and last for longer.

Our clothing has also been designed by our professional pattern-makers to be durable, with reinforced seams at the points that see the most movement and wear.

Finally, our clothing pieces are simple but classic styles that won't go out of fashion - so our backers won't feel the need to throw them out for the next hot "fast fashion" item.
Environmentally friendly factories
We're proud to say that our manufacturer is certified by the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) as both ethical and environmentally sustainable.

The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) is the worldwide leading textile processing standard for organic fibres, including ecological and social criteria, backed up by independent certification of the entire textile supply chain.

The GOTS environmental criteria requires that all textiles are made of at least 70% organic fibres. It also requires that manufacturers limit potentially toxic ingredients in their dyes and manufacturing processes, and that they have processes in place to limit and treat waste water. Our manufacturer ensures that the water used in the dying process is still clean enough to be recycled for irrigation and other purposes.

The GOTS social criteria requires safe and hygienic working conditions for employees, the payment of living wages, regular and fair working hours, and the right for workers to unionise. It also prohibits child labor, forced labor, discrimination, and harsh or inhumane treatment.

campaign.story:
Presenting  5 euro-styled games, part of our new Matchbox Collection. All games have been created along Italian authors and the illustrators that you have already seen in our previous titles. Each game has its own identity and the boxes are as small as 12x8 cm. You can carry them with you, slide the matchbox and play in just 20 minutes with cards and small bits that will make the whole experience so satisfying!
Natural phenomena have had an odd behaviour lately, seasons seem to have been disrupted and animals are migrating in the wrong direction. The 24 East Asian traditional solar terms are out of sync. Your seasons must find their alignment so the sun can find its route again and set the order right among all living things.
In 15 days, players will take alternating turns. Each turn choose 2 out of 4 possible actions, trying to receive the  animals pawns for special abilities and completing sets of Season cards for the most points at the end of the game.
Menace is approaching you. There seems to be a way out, but as a Samurai your first move is to reach for your weapons. Your basic instincts to run and hide have dissolved since the only option left is to fight for your honour. You are a rock and will hold tight, fighting the opponents face to face, using your weapons until the the very end.
Eiyo is a fast paced game where you need to strategically manage your weapons to defeat hordes of enemies. You will need to survive the attacks while gaining honour points that will be crucial at the end of the game.
After relentless days spent diluting solvents and heating liquid mixtures in vials, the air is damp, while the old and overused books stored in the library of your laboratory smell of humidity and dust. The end of the day is approaching and you have just found the perfect transmutation. You decide to stay a little longer, but you know the candles will stay on until they consume completely.
Rebis is a 1–4 player game. To win, you have to play your alchemistic ingredients wisely in order to brew the best elixirs and find the right time to brew them to get the most points.
The multiverse has spoiled you given the vastness of incredible places and creatures to meet and observe. You smell spices from miles away, your pores dilate, your gills tickle and your three stomachs are growling like an echoing symphony. You get to the source of the tasty fumes faster than a ray of light, your taste buds start working as a glowing sign shows up on the horizon: “Serving succulent food and spicy, quenching potions during satellite setting hours.”
Space Lunch is a 1-2 players, short, set-collection game. To win, you need to grab your preferred dishes before it’s too late by choosing Food cards from the table. However, beware! Your opponent might interfere with your plans.
The new surface of Earth is at its most bleak appearance. It may seem completely infertile and arid, but on the horizon promising mountains of mud and clay arise higher and higher. Golems, the magical mutable creatures, are being summoned with synergies among the resources of the earth.
Golems is a card collection game where you can use every card in two different ways. You have to decide whether you want to boost your Golem for victory points or save the resource to summon further Golems. With the use of Gems and special Runes you will be able to maximize your strategy to become the best Golem summoner.
We have always created games that we really enjoy playing and the Matchbox Collection is no exception, but every time we launch a new line of games, it is fundamental for us to understand if our vision resonates with you.
After a year since our last campaign, we are very excited to share a brief moment with you to shape this new creation together; and this is among the most interesting and rewarding moments for us.
Kickstarter and retail are two very different worlds and both of them are extremely important for us, but sometimes you want to create something regardless of the production boundaries, and Kickstarter is the best place to shape the games we dreamt of exactly the way we envisioned them.
Thundergryph exclusive is a new way for us to experiment, understand the product better and find the best way to make it work; and while we are not offering a retail option, it doesn’t mean that this line won’t have a possibility of hitting retail.
These games might become a collectible exclusive to this campaign, but they could reach more players in the future as well. For now, this campaign is the best chance we have to offer them to you directly at an honest price and make these games happen.
We really appreciate your support and we thank you for being the foundation of our imagination.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is our 7th campaign, we feel that it is important for us as creators to share with you what we have learnt throughout all the other campaigns and during 2019.

TIMELINE IS EVERYTHING.

While we always set important goals for the year, revising the timeline is something we have been doing for the past 3 years, and it was not a surprise for us that Tang Garden was about to create an important change in our timeline for 2019. 
Shaping the games together with our backers is one of the most interesting things of being a Kickstarter creator, but all of this additional content needs to be meticulously calculated before the campaign starts to add enough buffer time to the communicated timeline, while still being unaware of how successful a project will be.

Revising the timeline affects your perception towards us and affects the company stability by postponing future releases.

NEW WORKFLOW AND KICKSTARTER.

When you back one of our campaigns, you are not pre-ordering a product, you are really helping us make the game happen. This is a feeling we don’t want to lose, but we also understand that a game needs to be fulfilled at the right pace.

For the Matchbox Collection, we segmented the potential success of the project into four different outcomes and we have decided to establish the proper buffer based on the best-case scenario. This gives us room to listen to our community without compromising what we love the most about launching on Kickstarter: shaping a game together.

**Please refer to our timeline section on Kickstarter, where we show how we have organized the production and freight for the Matchbox Collection.**

A SETTLED PIPELINE IS MANDATORY.

Starting 2019, we decided to split our team into groups. We would be working at the same time on different projects and we would request help from freelancers if needed, without compromising our main tasks as a team.

Today, we are much more solid as a team, having a greater confidence on facing the challenges that the future holds, and we owe all of this to you and your support towards our projects.
We will always be grateful and we will always be prepared to listen and learn from your advice.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Due to the success of his Mint making empire in Mintopia City, Mort’s efforts (and market share) have come under attack! Four new mint making companies have noticed the profit potential of Mintopia City and have moved in, in an attempt to dominate the market and make all of the money. Players will take the role of one of four mint making companies and assert their influence over various locations in Mintopia City to secure their loyalties and earn the market share.
Mint Control is designed to provide a small footprint introduction experience to the Area Control and Action Selection genres of gaming that is fun and rewarding for new and seasoned gamers alike.
Set Up
Shuffle the Location Cards, and randomly add Locations to the game area until there are at least 5 Influence Token spaces per player.
                            (10 for 2 players, 15 for 3 players and 20 for 4 players.)
Put the remaining Location cards to the side, they will not be used in this game. Place the 5 Action tiles near the Location cards, this is the Selection Pool.
Place the Mint Tokens near the Location Cards. This forms the Mint Supply, each player then takes 2 Mints from the Supply as their starting currency.
Each player selects a color and takes the 5 Influence Tokens for that color.
The player with the freshest breath starts the game with the Starting Player Token.
Gameplay
Each round, the starting player will select one of the available Action tiles and place it in front of them. They will then perform that Action, followed by the Perk in its entirety.
Then in clockwise order around the table, each other player will perform that same Action (but not the perk) until each player has had the option to perform the Action if able.
After every player has had the option to perform the action chosen by the starting player, the next player in clockwise order will choose one of the remaining available Action Tiles. This process continues until each player has selected one Action tile.
After the final Action has been fully processed, if there are not enough remaining Action tiles for each player to choose from the remaining cards, return all of the chosen Action tiles to the selection pool, so that all Action tiles are available in the next round.
Finally, the Starting Player token passes to the next player in clockwise order, and a new round begins.
Action Tiles
When an action is selected by a player, that player performs both the Action and Perk. Then clockwise around the table each other player performs only the Action.
Influence
The Influence Action allows players to pay Mints to add an Influence Token to an open Influence space. The Perk for selecting this Action reduces the cost to Influence a Location by 1, to a minimum of 0.
Earn
The Earn Action gives players Mints to spend on future turns. The Perk for selecting this Action is to gain an additional Mint.
Presence
The Presence Action grants each player the Presence bonus for each Location where they have Influence. The Perk for this Action is gain the eviction bonus from a Location that the player controls.
Oust
The Oust Action gains each player one Mint, similar to Earn. However, the perk for Oust is to spend 1 Mint to remove any 1 Influence Token from a Location. Then an additional 3 Mints can be spent to remove a second Influence token from a Location. The second token has no additional restrictions, it can be on the same or a different Location, and the same or a different player.
Scavenge
The Scavenge Action does not provide an Action for all players, only the player that selected it. That player can choose to gain 1 Mint from the Supply, or steal 1 Mint from another player.
Win/Lose Conditions 
The game ends at the end of the Action in which at least one player has all 5 of their influence tokens on Locations.
Players gain points for each Location they control. The player with the most points, wins!
In the event of a tie, the player with the most Mints left over wins.
Then, the tied player that has the most Influence placed on locations wins.
Then, the tied player whose age is closest to 42 wins.
PLAYTHROUGH

The Mint Series was born of the 2017 BoardGameGeek Mint Tin Challenge where designer Justin Blaske submitted Mint Works, the Minty Fresh Worker Placement Game. Following the contest, he brought Mint Works to Kickstarter where it funded on Day 1 and went on to become an evergreen product, selling over 30,000 copies -- and it's still reprinting! His second design, Mint Delivery, the Minty Fresh Pick Up and Deliver Game, was a huge Kickstarter success, funding in the first hour, raising almost $200,000, and expanding into the French market. Most recently, Mint Cooperative funded over $100,000 and gained partners around the world: the Mint Series has fresh new versions in French, Italian, Chinese, and Japanese.
The Mint Universe has become its own licensed IP and we are having more and more industry designers submit designs to join our series. Our vision is to make singular modern board game mechanisms approachable by designing games that are simple to play, easy to teach, and a quick play time.
The Mint Series follows the narrative of Mort, introduced in the first game. After much success launching his mint-making company, Mort branched out and provided mints to surrounding towns and regions. Unfortunately, villains from the Dominion of Halitosis  grew jealous of his success, and the Mint Cooperative was launched to protect the citizens of Mintopia from the threat of periodontal peril. With peace restored and the villains defeated, Mort now finds himself threatened by other mint magnates trying to steal his success!  It has been exciting to see characters and locations evolve to have more personality through the games' progression, and it is thrilling to continue the saga in this exciting title.
Quackalope's storytelling expertly explains how the world of Mintopia unfolded and dive into the characters we are falling in love with.

campaign.story:
For 1 to 4 players (standard box), 1 to 5 players (premium box). For ages 14 and up, higher complexity level. Play time is 15-30 minutes per player. 
The goal of the game is to unravel the reason/mission why your alien faction is on the Ark and then activate specific parts of the Ark in order to achieve your mission.The first player that does so, wins.
Introducing Ark: Awakening - Theme and Story
You awake from cryogenic sleep in a strange biodome that resembles your home planet. You have no memory of how and why you are there – apparently a temporary loss of memory is a side effect of the cryogenic sleep. You start exploring and find out that your biodome is just one of infinitely many rooms on a traveling semi automated alien space ship – the Ark. Each room is the size of a city and the Ark is the size of a planet. You explore the Ark, opening and enabling parts of the ship, you power up rooms, integrate the Ark’s technology with your own in order to advance your faction, exploit resources needed to awake the rest of your species, collect alien artifacts and investigate the reason why your faction is on the Ark.
Game Overview and Key Features
Asymmetric Factions and Custom Meeples. The player boards are double sided and you can play on A-side which is the same for all factions; or the B-side that offers asymmetry. There are custom meeples for each playable faction and also custom meeples for the neutral factions. 
Prototype Image
Rooms that break the game rules. In the Ark there 30 completely different rooms representing different modules/parts of the space ship. Each room provides a different benefit to players, and some rooms, allow players to break the game rules. 
A choice to compete or collaborate. A competitive game where it makes sense to collaborate? Every room of the Ark can be used by more players or it can be hacked to be exclusively controlled and used by one player. In Ark: Awakening there are no alliances between players. Two players might cooperate in one room and fight for control in another room. It is a free-for-all, it is a puzzle to solve - should you build upon other's work, should you be aggressive and compete for exclusive control, should you collaborate? The game does not push players to fight or collaborate ... it just provides these options and players play the game as they want. Players themselves decide how to win. 
Tailored for both cautious and aggressive players. Players can develop their faction inside the safety of their biodome, hence avoiding interaction with other players; or players can venture "outside" to gain better benefits but also they would be risking conflict with other players. Combat exists only as an option to accomplish a mission. There is no conflict for conflict sake and usually players can complete their mission using other means than combat. 
Prototype Image
Great Replayability due to the asymmetric factions, random missions, random rooms and random board setup. The game has 33 different mission cards and each game each player draws a random one. 
Click to Enlarge
In the Ark there are 30 completely different rooms representing different parts/modules of the Ark. Each room is unique and can be utilized differently. And each game you play with only half the rooms, returning the rest to the box for another play. 
And last, due to the random setup of the modular board, each game will offer different opportunities to play. The modular board is constructed as you play - see in "Warp 9" speed on Youtube.
Tabletopia Image - Guardians Mode
"The Guardians" is a solo and co-op mode against a player or an automated opponent. Due to your meddling in the Ark’s systems, a defensive measure was activated – the Guardians. Now these scary looking blue robotic meeples are traversing the rooms, attacking anything alien and disintegrating any cube or cylinder you have worked so hard to place. The Guardians movement is determined by a die, so players are never sure where they will show up. Players will try to accomplish their mission while avoiding the Guardians, they must cooperate and build upon their choices, synchronize their play to perfection in order to win. But, be careful - the Guardians monitor all communication! In this scenario, 1-4 players can play against an automated opponent or 2-5 players can play co-op from which one player will take the role of "The Guardians". In case one player of your gaming group does not like heavier games, they can take the "The Guardians" role, as its mechanics are very straightforward. Read our blog or for more and you can demo it on Tabletopia. 
Turns are fast. Player turn is very short, usually while handling the effects of your action, the next player has already taken the action. With up to 3 players there is almost no player idle time. Game lasts around 15-30 minutes per player. See our 2-player playthrough in 30 minutes!
Is 15-30 minutes per player too much? No worries - there is a Short Game variant that makes it easier to accomplish your mission. 
Is this Game right for You
You are a veteran board game player and you like playing heavier games.
Many interesting choices, but you can only make one per turn reducing analysis paralysis. 
No Victory Points, no second place. The player that finishes their mission fastest wins and the game ends.
Each game is somewhat of a puzzle to solve - what actions to take in order to minimize the number of turns needed to finish your objective.
Luck plays a very small role in the game. Only the drawn artifact cards and how the board is constructed are random. The most efficient player will almost always win.
You will be head down on the board, trying to play more efficiently. 
If you do not like most of the above things, then this is not the right game for you. We would rather have a few happy backers than many unhappy ones. Please spend your money on another Kickstarter project - there are a lot of good ones to explore. Otherwise, scroll down - we want to convince you that this project is worth your time!
Inside the Box
Unboxing for Ark: Awakening, a demo version that was sent to reviewers. Note that the demo version shown on the video contained only 4 out of the 6 groups of special rooms and components for 3 players instead of 4 in the Standard Box and 5 in the Premium Box. Additionally, the meeples in the shown demo version were acrylic and with the same shape. The Standard and Premium Boxes will have wooden custom-shaped meeples. 
Add-ons
 You can add all add-ons to the Standard and the Premium Box. 
After months of work, the engineers managed to break through the "Sealed Section" of the Ark. What lies behind those doors? => Neutral Factions and Side Missions and 2 New Playable Asymmetric Factions - Raghna and Qfin. 
When a player encounters a biodome belonging to a neutral faction, they will see, in secret from other players, a random objective related to that neutral faction. If the objective is fulfilled, the player receives the neutral factions unwavering allegiance and gets a huge benefit. This benefit potentially can be a different action that can be taken each turn in addition to the 7 basic actions – like changing the place of two rooms, turning off the energy in the entire Ark, blocking rooms to prevent movement, sabotaging the opponent’s weapons supply, etc. But, pursuing the objective is risky, and do you really want to jeopardize your main mission to do a side quest? What would you do?
See "Sealed Section" Factions sections for more info about Raghna and Qfin.

Even if a printed game is not available in your preferred language, we made sure that it is language agnostic and can be enjoyed without understanding English. A rulebook in multiple languages will be available to download. On the printed components, text is only found in 3 places: 
as card titles, to add flavor. E.g. "Warp Engine" 
the mission cards have text explaining the story and motivation behind the mission objectives. E.g. "The cryogenic sleep has been hard on Mother. We need to ensure her speedy recovery!" This is only for the sake of theme ... players do not need to understand the motivation to play and on the mission cards there are icons explaining how players can accomplish the objectives.
the artifact cards have a one-time use that is explained both with an icon and with text. The text is there so new players do not need to lookup the icon in the reference sheet.

Why Pledge Now
 Kickstarter exclusives. Kickstarter backers will receive +4 special room cards/tiles for FREE! And more Kickstarter exclusives will be unlocked with stretch goals. After the Kickstarter campaign ends, these exclusives will only be available at conventions or through other exceptional means. 
 Influence the product and get more in the box. As a backer you can influence the final product, both through funding stretch goals and your valuable feedback through surveys. Every pledge counts towards unlocking more stretch goals and getting more in the box. 
 Limited Supply. The game will not go through normal distribution channels. There will be limited copies of the game produced and it is possible you will not be able to get a copy of the game if you wait for retail. Actually, there is a very real possibility that the game may never be available at retail outside of retailers who choose to back here. 
 Warp Travel. You will receive your copy first. 
 Discounted Price. You get this game well below the retail price. After the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will no longer offer the same discount. 
New to Kickstarter?
Kickstarter provides a funding platform for creative projects. When a creator posts a project on Kickstarter, they’re inviting other people to back a project (pledge for project), in return for receiving a reward. Projects last around 30 days at which time people can pledge for a reward. 
When you have pledged for a reward: You’re only charged if the project reaches its fundraising goal. You’ll provide your payment information when you pledge, but you won’t be charged. Your payment will only be collected if, at the time of the project’s funding deadline, the project has reached its fundraising goal. You can also change your pledge to a different level or cancel your pledge at any time before the project’s funding deadline.
When a project is successfully funded, the creator must complete the project and fulfill each reward. 
The above is only a short summary, for more details go to Kickstarter basics, How Projects and Funding Work and Accountability.
Group Orders
If you are interested in ordering 20 or above Premium copies of the game, please write to contact@skyportgames.com. Please note that we are only able to offer a very small discount as our Kickstarter pledge prices are already quite low. 
Game Mechanics
“Ark, Awakening” is a hybrid worker placement and area-control game with engine building mechanics. During the gameplay, the central board is constructed by placing tiles (rooms) next to each other. In each game, each player receives a unique secret mission card. The first player that accomplishes what the mission card says, wins the game. 
Choose one of 7 Simple Actions Each Turn
Ark: Awakening is a action selection game. Players take turns clockwise performing one action out of 7 basic actions: move, integrate, route power, exploit, awake new units, militarize or research.
Players will do much more thematic actions - like hack the main power generator, upgrade their biodomes, fully integrate rooms, activate rooms, steal energy, teleport, re-architect the Ark, etc, but these actions are all accomplished by performing the core 7 actions. 
Factions
In Ark: Awakening you can play asymmetrically on the B-side of the player boards. Each faction is different, with different actions on their player board and different special powers.
In this video series the designer Zharko gives an overview of the alien factions Hara, Diruni, Pajak and Gimli - their mechanics, special powers, and how playing them feels like. If you are interested in more detailed overview of each faction, you can read the Rulebook Appendix (F) for Factions. Note that the rulebook is still in progress and some things might change due to the balancing of the factions.
And last, a survey Which Faction do you like best? In case there is interest, we will do another live session with a backer, playing the top 2 factions against each other! You can register here.
Premium Box Factions
Introducing the 5th and 6th faction that are part of the Premium box - Eiilis and Togach. 
Adapting the living environment. When faced with the Eiilis it will be clear that the danger does not come from direct attacks. Instead, the Eiilis adapt the Ark to become more like the their biodome, essentially killing the other Ark's inhabitants in the process.
Only 12. No one has seen a Togach, but based on dealings with their emissaries, it is almost certain that there are and there have always been only 12 of them. This explains their secrecy and hiding as necessary in order to not put any of them in danger. They stay hidden bellow their empire of industry, using range weapons to defend against attackers.
"Sealed Section" Factions
In addition to the neutral factions and side missions, there are 2 additional playable asymmetric factions in the "Sealed Section" expansion. 
Learn the Rules
If you prefer to learn by example, see a playthrough of the First Mission - it is a tutorial mission to help you learn to play by going through the basics. For an detailed look at the rules, read the rulebook. Note that the rulebook is work in progress so please do not upload it to BGG. The German translation is also incomplete - some parts are not yet translated from English.

See How the Game is Played
To see the game played in real time, we have uploaded couple of playthroughs. But be warned, there is no famous person playing, it is just us. Shown game elements in the video are a prototype, except the artifact and mission cards - we love how those look.

Play a Demo
You can try the game for free on Tabletopia - there is a 2-3 player variant and a solo variant. You can also Print and Play a demo version yourself, but please note there are non-paper components that you need to improvise in order to play the game. For exactly what you will need, read the ReadMe.txt inside the Print and Play folder. 
We are always trying to improve our games and we use jotform to gather feedback. 
Planned Timeline
March - Kickstarter campaigns ends
April - finishing touches, final graphic designs are ready
May - materials for printing are submitted to manufacturer 
June - pre-production sample approved
July - mass production sample approved
August - mass production finished, shipped
September - 1 month buffer, anticipating the unexpected
October - arrived in warehouses
November - delivered to backers
For the progress we will post weekly updates to backers for the first month and then a monthly update until the game is shipped. For more frequent updates you can follow us on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram or our blog. 
Shipping Information
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter campaign ends. 
The European Union, USA, Canada, Australia, China and most countries from Asia will all be “Shipping Friendly”. This means that backers from these countries will not incur any import taxes or VAT. 
The standard box will weigh around 1.7 kg (3.7 lb) and the premium box will weigh around 2,2 kg (4.8 lb). This weight does not include any unlocked stretch goals. 
After the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will send you a survey where you can provide your shipping address, based on which your shipping will be calculated and charged. Please note that the below are only estimates. The final shipping costs will depend based on various factors like inflation, the final weight of the packaged game, the number of copies shipped to the same address and the number of copies shipped in a region, more copies meaning reduced shipping costs. 
For details per destination see shipping costs per destination. In the linked document you can also find info for 2 and 20 games (group order) delivered to the same address. 
Spread the Word to help with our Campaign
As we are first time publishers it is difficult to get the word around about us and our games. Helps us do that by sharing/following/liking/subscribing on social media.
For updates your can also subscribe to our Youtube channel or our blog: 
We also have an available Media Kit. For any inquiries you can write to us using contact@skyportgames.com or on Facebook. 
About Us
Skyport Games was founded with the intention to create challenging, exciting and unique experiences to board game players everywhere. We put a lot on emphasis not only to the visual appeal, but also to the core of our games, making them versatile, offering multiple levels of difficulty and more than one playing mode, so that players from different calibers and with discerned playing styles can enjoy our games. Hopefully, we can extend our enthusiasm for our games and you can first hand enjoy our creations, made with hard work, love and stride towards the highest quality possible. 
For the beautiful images and iconography see credits. Some of the tutorial videos on this page were generated using Tabletopia.

Risks and challenges
If founded, this will be the first game we publish and deliver and hopefully one of many to come. We are a small company, but we are completely devoted to providing you the best product and service as possible.

This is not a pre-order. The final version might be different than the version shown during the campaign. What remains from the development are:

 * minor balancing between the factions. 
 * play-testing some of the newly unlocked stretch goals.


For the post-campaign tasks we will be partnering with the best fulfillment and game manufacturing companies. After the campaign ends, we will finalize these partnerships and you will be the first to know. 

You will get timely updates from us about the progress and we will always be upfront about the status. 

RISKS
As with any Kickstarter tabletop project, the largest risk is a delay in the delivery - issues with manufacturing, freight shipping, and fulfillment logistics. 
It is unlikely, but even with well known manufactures and fulfillment logistics, mistakes are made and your copy can have a missing or damaged component. In this case, please let us know at contact@skyportgames.com and we’ll address the issue. 

REFUND POLICY
During the campaign you can always cancel your pledge. 
If you request a refund within 14 days after the Kickstarter campaign ends, all fees will be refunded - including Kickstarter fees. See https://www.kickstarter.com/help/fees
You will receive a full refund in case we do not deliver the product.

Risks and challenges
Last year, Rival Restaurants was successfully funded and--perhaps more importantly--delivered, raising over $300K from 4,000+ backers. It was an amazing experience going from concept, to prototype, to mass production, to successful fulfillment. We are applying everything we’ve learned from our 1st campaign to orchestrate what we hope will be an even smoother campaign with the expansion and re-print.

We are proud to say that both the base game and the expansion are 100% finished. Everything from the art to the components to the rules has been carefully thought out, tested, and re-tested. Because we want to make sure that Rival Restaurants is being produced and delivered at the highest possible level, we are continuing our partnerships with some of the biggest names in board games: Panda Games, Quartermaster Logistics (US & Canada), GamesQuest (Europe), Aetherworks (Australia/New Zealand) and VFI (Asia).

We know and recognize that some things will always be outside of our control. However, we remain resolute in making it our #1 priority to make sure that the game you are delivered is of the highest quality. We can’t wait for both Rival Restaurants and Back for Seconds to be played at your next game night and we hope to receive your support for this project. Thank you.

REFUND POLICY: 
We understand that life happens. Therefore, refund requests made within 14 days from the end of the campaign will be fully honored (100% refund), no questions asked. Kanban (看板) is the name for a scheduling system that supports an efficient assembly line, just-in-time production, and a smooth workflow process.
Kanban EV set up for 4 players
Note: All Artwork Subject to Change
Kanban EV is a game that focuses on resource and time management; and puts you in the driver’s seat of an entire production facility, racing for factory goals and the highest level of promotion. You will earn Production Points (PP) for performing various actions in the game, and the player with the most PP at the end of the game is declared the winner.
Vehicles moving down the assembly line
Electric Vehicles (EVs) have become more common since 2014. EV’s are the future of the automobile industry. They are superior vehicles due to being more efficient, easier to maintain, cleaner, and are cheaper to run. They are computerized machines that use AI to improve safety and in the near future will provide autonomous driving. They receive software upgrades during their lifetime and are constantly improving, unlike their traditional combustion engine counter parts, which start to become obsolete as soon as you start using them.
Each car model can be upgraded by various parts
Over the course of the game, players take on the role of novice supervisors, trying to secure their careers. You will need to manage suppliers and supplies, improve and innovate automobile parts, and get your hands greasy on the assembly line in order to boost production and impress the factory manager.
Blueprints can be claimed from the Design Department
You must make shrewd use of the recycling facilities and the limited factory supplies in order to appropriate parts when the suppliers come up short. Because the factory must run at optimum efficiency, production doesn't wait for you, or for mistakes.
Sandra, the factory manager, will review your performance and keep the factory on tempo
The Eagle-Gryphon Kanban EV Deluxe version of this critically-acclaimed game improves on past editions by providing:
 All-new artwork and graphics by Ian O'Toole to improve both the visual aesthetics and the functional play of the game (e.g. the beautiful and all-new board layout and display!)
 5 different models and "paint jobs" of the 5 wooden vehicles AND the possibility to add-on a complete set of 40 metal vehicles 
 A solo game version designed by the master of solo game versions -- David Turczi 
 A brand new SpeedCharger expansion created by Vital Lacerda
 A new approach to the Boardroom (and its chairs) which streamlines play in that area of the board by using wooden Speech Tokens -- creating a cleaner implementation of this mechanic
 Lots of other great 3D wooden bits instead of 2D cardboard tokens (e.g. see below the Certification, Production Cycle, Meeting, Banked Shift, and Car Part Value Markers; Worker and Sandra Meeples; Player Locks and Car Parts; and Book and Parts Voucher tokens)
 Dual-layered, spacious and well-organized Player Boards 
 A silver-painted Metal pace car (Stretch Goal)
 A Special Garage Tile Expansion (Stretch Goal)
 New (and extra) Final Goal tiles (Stretch Goal)
 A new and better laid-out Rulebook, Reference Book, and Player Aid sheets 
 Rules Changes from Previous Editions:
You may no longer replace Cars in your garages with new ones.
When Sandra penalizes you, you now lose 1 PP in addition to PP for any Banked Shifts that you have below 5.
In the Nice Sandra variant, you are only rewarded PP for Banked Shifts you have over 5, instead of for all of your Banked Shifts.
There are 3 new Final Goal tiles to choose from during Setup. 
The new Board Room with Speech tokens for a cleaner implementation
 SOLO Mode by David Turczi
Kanban EV Solo cards
In the Kanban EV Solo Rules, you’re the new hire at the company and your productivity will tightly watched. Any sign of slacking behind and you’ll be terminated. Worse, the senior engineer Mr. Lacerda and junior architect Mr. Turczi would rather you don’t make the cut, and will be trying to outperform you every step of the way.
SPEEDCHARGER Expansion Now Included! 
The SpeedCharger expansion provides players with persistent special abilities they may pay shifts to unlock.
During setup, place 4 SpeedCharger tokens per player in a supply next to the Game board. Each player receives a Charging board which is placed next to their Player board.
When working Shifts in R&D (or indirectly through Administration), you may spend 1 Shift to take a SpeedCharger token from the supply and place it on a space of your choice on your Charging board. From now on, the covered bonus is active for the rest of the game. Also, at the end of the game, each Charger token is worth 1 PP for each Car in your garages.
For example: If you have 3 cars and 4 SpeedCharger tokens, you score 12 PP. 
You can only take one SpeedCharger per turn.
The Bonuses when played in...
R&D - Once per turn, you can upgrade 1 Design with a Car Part from the supply.
Assembly - You may ignore the restriction of having to provide upgraded parts first.
Logistics - You bank 2 Shifts instead of 1 when placing a Kanban card.
Design - When you take a Design from the Central Design Stack, gain 1 Book.
Administration - When working in Administration, you receive 1 extra Shift.
KANBAN EV Rulebook

D. Mariana Vitória de Bragança (1718–1781)
Once the King was unable to reign, the Queen became the regent.  Mariana Vitória didn’t like the Marquis de Pombal because of the way he handled the Tavora affair, in which a  noble and powerful family that were friends of the Queen were accused of attempted regicide, and then executed in public by the Marquis, without a fair trial, purely to gain political power. In 1777, immediately after the death of the King, she dismissed the Marquis by Royal Decree and exiled him to his hometown, Pombal.

Vital Lacerda has designed a prolific list of euro strategy games including On Mars, The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Lisboa & Escape Plan. He has a master's degree in Marketing and Advertising. His game designs center around the theme of the game and heavily incorporate intertwined mechanics. Vital lives in Portugal with his wife, Sandra, and two daughters. He enjoys extreme sports such as snowboarding and kitesurfing.
Ian O’Toole is an Irish illustrator, graphic designer and gamer working out of Perth in Western  Australia. Ian has created the artwork for such notable boardgames as Rococo: Deluxe Edition, Age of Steam Deluxe, On Mars, Lisboa, The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, and The Scarlet Pimpernel. Ian works in a wide variety of styles and particularly enjoys drawing from design trends throughout history. Ian works from his home in Perth, where he lives with his wife, two children and dog.

Wanted to share a quick fulfillment update with you. Fulfillment is still in progress and has taken a bit longer than expected due to the impact of Covid-19 and various other factors. Below is a brief summary of where fulfillment stands in the various regions.

North America
The first of 2 containers were unloaded 12/17/20 at our broker in Chicago. Our broker is shipping 1500+ packages that we were able to have pre-packaged at the factory. Our broker was able to ship 500 of the 1500 individually packaged games out Friday 12/18/20, the remaining 1000 pre packaged games were shipped out Monday 12/21/20. The second container that was expected to be unloaded Friday did not actually arrive in Chicago until Monday the 21st.

Just a quick update for US backers
Around 1500 single copies of Kanban EV have shipped from Chicago ahead of the bulk shipment coming from Chicago to each of the West Coast/East Coast US fulfillment centers. The shipments to the US fulfillment centers in Arizona and Kentucky respectively, should arrive this upcoming week and our teams will be working hard packing and shipping pledges out to backers.

campaign.story:
What is Game Boy Geek?
My name is Dan King a.k.a The Game Boy Geek and over the last 7 years I have produced over 2100 board game videos with over 80% of those being reviews! My mission from day one has always been Helping You Find the Next Board Game You'll Love.
YOU (the viewers) benefit from my videos by:
Helping you find the next board game you'll love by attacking reviews with hi-energy.
Investigate 5x more new games than normal by quickly using my 2 minute "Allegro" format.
Helping you enjoy the next board game you'll love by teaching you how to setup and play the game without reading the rules yourself in my "Rules School" videos.
Helping you stay away from certain games that you may have otherwise spent money on.
Making you aware & providing details of the latest games in the industry.
Learn about which games I think are the best from Top 10 lists.
Get the latest information from the largest conventions in North America.
Seeing how board games can be used in the community to help charitable organizations obtain their mission in my "Gaming on Purpose" series.
Listen to my reviews (intros and final thoughts) via an audio podcast while you're on the go.
What We Need & What You Get:
Donations to the Game Boy Geek will allow me to get closer to helping you find the next board game you'll love full time. The $25,000 goal will allow me continue spending as much time as I can on the channel in addition to my normal full time job.
Going beyond the $25,000 goal will help me approach my channel full-time. It will also allow me to do the following:
Procure more equipment needed to create better videos.
Travel to more conventions which helps me keep up with the latest news and major developments in the industry.
Allow me to get closer to working full time, which will equate to more quantity & better quality.

updates.update_content:
Hello my friends!
The estimated date for the promo cards delivery was September 2020 and even with some major COVID-19 related snafus we came across, I'm still hopeful that we will still be able to send the promos out towards the end of the month. We are still waiting for the last 8 sets to come in, and then it takes a lot of work and coordinating getting the 40+ unique promos assembled into the correct packs (Family, Strategy) and then sent out.

Hello My Friends,
I just wanted to let you know that even with the challenges of factories being closed through the worldwide pandemic, it still appears we are on track to be able to deliver the promos, Insert here Inserts, and Game Topper Mats on time (end of Sept).
If you backed a Game Bundle, you'll be getting those promos at that time as well, alongside the Game Boy Geek Game Bag.  If your reward level for the Game Bundle (you might want to double check) was supposed to be delivered by the end of June, and you haven't received the games by the end of June, please message me via Kickstarter and I'll look further into it for you.

campaign.story:
We have spent nearly three years critically testing and crafting the play pattern to reflect a balance of rules that parallel the lore and science of the game. 
Migration Mars  progressively layers on strategic decision making so it increasingly becomes more engaging as you play. The complexity of rules are easily digestible for the casual player, yet still quite stimulating for the serious gamer.
Shipping will be charged in our pledge manager after the campaign.  Using the pledge manager, you will be able to confirm your rewards, confirm  your address, and finalize your order. Please note that we are absorbing some of the shipping costs to help keep these as affordable as possible.
Shipping Restrictions
As a reminder, we are unable to ship to: Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Kazakhstan, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Ukraine.
Backing for additional copies of the game will offer lower per-unit shipping costs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When Migration MARS gets ready for production, there most likely will be some minor changes to improve the final product (probably because of your feedback). But just to be clear, these minor changes will be for the benefit of you, “the Backer”!

Sometimes things happen, things that are out of our control: a supplier knocks over our shipment during transport or a machine breaks down, etc. This could cause a delay. One thing we will definitely do from the beginning to the end is to keep you posted on all developments, positive or negative, we will let you know!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Are you new to Forsaken Forest? If so, watch the original trailer and the tutorial:
Otherwise, welcome to the Spirit Uprising!
We coordinated with the manufacturer and added all of the Stretch Goals that we had planned into the Expansion. This includes a number of powerful Travelers Cards, Destinations, an alternate art Forsaken Role, and 24 unique standees!
The Auto-Moderator is now live on the Apple App Store! If you have the game, you can download it right now at https://apps.apple.com/app/id1490289318
You can find the Spirit Uprising Rule Book here:
https://forsakenforest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Spirit-Uprising-Rules-Book-For-Website-1.pdf
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having shipped the original game after the completion of our 2018 campaign, Forsaken Games is as confident as ever that your game will be manufactured and shipped promptly upon the completion of the campaign.

A few factors that we cannot control are manufacturing delays, and freight shipping delays. We've done everything on our end to prevent these issues by completing the prototyping phase and locking in our production schedule with the manufacturer. We hope to have a very precise and pristine campaign this time around.

campaign.story:
Chiseled is a deck-DEconstruction and action-drafting game, challenging everything you know about traditional deck-building games.
The game includes 13 classical and modern Tool Cards, with 7-9 used each game. Try different strategies with different Tools on the workbench! Some deal with your hand of 3 cards drawn at the end of each turn, trashing Scrap or sculpted elements; others deal with the top cards of players’ decks; some even let you fix mistakes if you're able to grab them!
There are 8 Critics included in the game, each of whom want specific things removed from your final sculpture; some want a certain amount, others want more of one than the other, but all of them will award game-end bonuses!
Sample Game
PLAY

Cards shown in this video feature prototype Scrap art: back at the Patron of the Arts tier to improve the art further!
All 230 cards are 57x88mm (Bridge-size). The game also includes 4 player tableaus for scoring and play areas, and a detailed rulebook.
If your new hand looks polished enough at the end of your turn, the critics will get closer to the studio. When any player's countdown card hits 0, that's game over for everyone! Whoever has the highest-scoring sculpture after bonuses wins!
Keep as many Head cards as possible, an even number of Arm cards, and a middling number of Body cards in your deck to score big... but be sure to remove Scrap to prevent penalties!
Cleanup is a snap! Just shuffle your deck back together and play again!
Chiseled features a solitaire score-challenge mode AND 3 advanced solo challenges, both perfect for lunch breaks. Optional "Take-That" Waxed Marble cards offer further challenges for any amount of players! 
The 24 evenly-distributed Waxed Marble cards are worth 1 point at the end of the game for each in your sculpture... unless you have the most! Then they inflict a penalty! Yes, that means in solo mode they’re always negative!Sine Cera is included in all copies of Chiseled to add a new level to gameplay.
Previews and Testimonials
One Board Family did a fun playthrough of Chiseled on livestream during the campaign. Check out a full 3-player game here!
"I love the theme, and how it ties into the gameplay so well... Thinning out your deck to utilize it in a way that equals victory points is novel." -Bob Crowell, One Board Family
Solo Playthrough from One Stop Co-Op Shop
We sent Lizzy and Derek Funkhouser of Board Game Spotlight, and Rob Kalajian of A Pawn's Perspective prototype versions of Chiseled last year, and they loved it! 
Chiseled was also featured as part of the Indie Tabletop Showcase at BostonFIG Fest 2019. Many new fans were made!
More media coming throughout the campaign!
Getting the Game - Pledge Tiers
By backing now, you are helping to ensure that Chiseled gets printed and can reach gamers all over the world! As thanks, here are the ways you can get Chiseled with your pledge: 
 Chiseled - $35: One copy of Chiseled: A Deck-Sculpting Card Game. Add $35 for each additional copy.
 Chiseled, Pigment, and Deluxe Meeples - $65: One copy of Chiseled; one copy of our first game Pigment; 6 solid hardwood meeples made in Vermont. Limited to 54 backers; US only! 
 Patron of the Arts - $250: Two copies of Chiseled; your choice of art included in the Scrap Cards of all copies of Chiseled (you'll need to communicate your preference to us within 1 month of the campaign's end); your name in the credits as a Patron of the Arts; one full set of 250 transparent card sleeves for Chiseled. Limited to 8 backers! 
Expected Shipping
Subsidized US shipping is included in Kickstarter with your pledge. Additional international shipping fees will be added AFTER the campaign in a pledge manager. This will allow us to account for any changes in shipping costs that may occur between the Kickstarter and fulfillment. The prices below are estimates made at the time of the Kickstarter launch for international shipping. 
We are planning to partner with Greater Than Games, Spiral Galaxy, and VFI to fulfill Chiseled in the US, Canada, UK, EU, and Asia, so VAT will be covered by Copper Frog Games for these regions. If we can secure partners during the campaign to fulfill in Australia or other regions, we will update the expected price list above!
Stretch Goal
Many campaigns lock additional content behind financial stretch goals, but we have decided to include everything designed from the get-go, so that you can be sure that shipping costs won't skyrocket, and that the game will be manufactured as promptly as possible.
We have only one stretch goal for this campaign: improving the cardstock of all 230 cards from white-core to black-core. If we reach 500 backers, we will invest in better, thicker cardstock, ensuring even more durability and snappiness. Share the campaign to help us reach this goal!
Retailer Pledges
Game retailers looking to back and stock Chiseled should pledge for 1 game at the normal $35 tier and email/message us your business info to proceed. We will work out the details for bulk ordering following the campaign, with final payment due when fulfillment begins. Your pledge will be considered a down-payment on at least one case of 6 games at keystone pricing with shipping included. As well, be sure to ask your distributors to pick up Chiseled for wholesale! We want to make sure it's available for you beyond the Kickstarter, and multiple retailers requesting a game helps us help you get it.
 Multiple Copies and Pre-Orders
Backers interested in more than one copy of Chiseled will be able to pre-order them in the pledge manager following the campaign with the same subsidized shipping as during the campaign. Other pre-orders will be charged full shipping for their respective regions, so back now! Adding $35 to your pledge now will get you another copy of the game, shipped to the same address. You can also do so in the pledge manager following the campaign.
Thank you for your support in bringing Chiseled to the world! I hope you enjoy this fun and unique game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter for Chiseled, and fourth overall for Copper Frog Games. We have worked very hard since our last attempt to get all the art and graphic design far more polished ahead of time, and have simplified aspects of the game to make it more approachable. Currently, the only remaining pieces of art and layout that need completion are the Scrap Card images, (which require backer input), and some diagrams to further enhance the rulebook and back of the box.

We have also altered the pledge tier structure to only have to manufacture one version of the game, making both design, manufacturing, and shipping easier (and cheaper for you). We had 232 backers in the first Chiseled Kickstarter when we pulled it, and if we get that many again at just the base pledge tier, we'll be over 90% funded this time.

While issues with the manufacturing process, trade conflicts, or other unforeseen events may slow things down, we've built in a fairly large buffer to get the game proofed, printed, and shipped on time. We are continuing to work with established fulfillment partners, manufacturers, and shipping agents whom we have had good experiences with in the past, and are excited to see Chiseled out in the world. We will let you know if anything changes or is significantly delayed.

The game is done; the game is fun; we just need you.

campaign.story:
The five elements; Void, Wind, Fire, Water, and Earth
Gorinto is a captivating abstract game where you must harness the power of the five elements (Earth, Water, Fire, Wind, and Void) to build a shrine. You seek balance to earn you the most wisdom, based on a shared pair of goals that changes from game to game. Turns are simple but deep; you simply move a tile from the Path into the Mountain, then collect surrounding tiles based on the collection pattern and the depth of your understanding of that element. Every decision alters the landscape, grows your understanding, and charts your path forward.
The Gorinto campaign will not have any Stretch Goals. The game will be produced at high quality from the start, and the game system is so tightly designed that added content of the sort that Kickstarter campaigns usually feature (new characters, scenarios, etc) are not really suitable. Gorinto stands strong as a finished project without the need to "stretch" into anything beyond what we are presenting here. 
There are a few Kickstarter Enhancements that will make the Kickstarter Edition of Gorinto more deluxe than the (still gorgeous) version that will go to retail. Scroll down below the Game Elements to see what is special in the Kickstarter Edition!
Whichever version you get (retail or Kickstarter), your copy will come with all of the amazing high-quality components described below, which support three modes of play:
Competitive mode: strive for individual Wisdom
Partnership 2 vs. 2 mode: team up with an ally to succeed together
"Kitsune" Solo mode (designed with David Turczi)
Gorinto's gameplay is simple. On your turn, you choose an element tile from the Path at the edge of the board, and move it on a straight line into the Mountain, stopping wherever you wish. Once the tile is placed, you will use its elemental collection pattern to gather nearby tiles... and the more understanding you have of that element (meaning the more tiles you have previously collected of the moved type), the more tiles you will be able to gather! Each element gathers differently:
EARTH DIGS DEEP (Gather tiles from beneath the placed tile)
 WATER FLOWS WIDE (Gather tiles horizontally from the placed tile)
 FIRE BURNS HIGH (Gather tiles vertically from the placed tile)
 WIND BLOWS FREELY (Gather tiles orthogonally adjacent to the placed tile)
 VOID SLIPS BETWEEN (Gather tiles diagonally adjacent to the placed tile)
Your purpose in gathering these tiles is to satisfy the two public and shared Goal cards which are set at the beginning of the game. Each of them describes criteria which will earn you wisdom at the end of each season if your Gorinto is balanced in a certain way. There are also two key elements that will earn you wisdom at game end for gathering a lot of them. Managing these considerations is part of your challenge!
GOAL CARDS describe how you'll score at the end of each season. KEY ELEMENT cards grant you 2 points per tile of that type in your Gorinto at the end of the game only.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign comes with its own challenges. We are confident that you will get a game that you’ll be proud to play AND proudly display on your game shelf.

The art and mechanics for Gorinto are complete, so once this campaign ends, we'll be almost ready to submit print files. There's always some tweaking to do. 

It is always possible that delays occur while a game is coming to fruition. This can happen for various reasons such as manufacturing issues, freight delays, and even importing the games to the various regions of the world. Although we have budgeted 11 months to bring Gorinto to your doorstep, delays can change our timeline at various stages. Therefore this timeline is only an estimate. We are working to do everything we can to meet our goal of getting Gorinto to you by February 2021.

We will be using fulfillment partners from around the world so that we can ensure a fast and smooth operation. We have worked many of these partners before, so we are optimistic that everything will go as planned. We have full faith that your games will be delivered to you safe and in a timely fashion.

A note on our track record:

Successful and timely fulfillment of 5 projects over 4 years including the following games: Unreal Estate, Pocket Ops, The Artemis Project, and Endeavor: Age of Sail. (Endangered and Endeavor: Age of Expansion are underway.)

OUR REFUND POLICY

We will refund your pledge within 10 days of the campaign’s end, including all fees associated with the campaign. After that period, we will also refund your pledge, no questions asked, minus all of the fees associated with the Kickstarter and payment processing. These fees cannot be recovered from Kickstarter after two weeks of the campaign ending. This project is in USD and refunds will also be processed in USD, excluding applicable fees.

We want you to be happy! We promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way. If you have any questions, send us a direct message, email us at marc@grandgamersguild.com, or simply comment on the campaign. We will get back to you as soon as we can.
